	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 6</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">Administrative Council with regard to employees referred to in Article</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">11, paragraphs 2 and 3;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">(i) he may delegate his functions and powers.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p853 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The President shall be assisted by a number of </SPAN><NOBR>Vice-Presidents.</NOBR> If the President is absent or indisposed, one of the <NOBR>Vice-Presidents</NOBR> shall take his place in accordance with the procedure laid down by the Administrative Council.</P>
<P class="p854 ft5">Article 11</P>
<P class="p855 ft4">Appointment of senior employees</P>
<P class="p856 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The President of the European Patent Office shall be appointed by the Administrative Council.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p853 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The </SPAN><NOBR>Vice-Presidents</NOBR> shall be appointed by the Administrative Council after the President of the European Patent Office has been consulted.</P>
<P class="p857 ft32"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft127">The members, including the Chairmen, of the Boards of Appeal and of the Enlarged Board of Appeal shall be appointed by the Administrative Council on a proposal from the President of the European Patent Office. They may be re- appointed by the Administrative Council after the President of the European Patent Office has been consulted.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p858 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The Administrative Council shall exercise disciplinary authority over the employees referred to in paragraphs 1 to 3.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p859 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(5)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The Administrative Council, after consulting the President of the European Patent Office, may also appoint as members of the Enlarged Board of Appeal legally qualified members of the national courts or </SPAN><NOBR>quasi-judicial</NOBR> authorities of the Contracting States, who may continue their judicial activities at the national level. They shall be appointed for a term of three years and may be re- appointed.</P>
<P class="p860 ft5">Article 12</P>
<P class="p740 ft4">Duties of office</P>
<P class="p861 ft4">Employees of the European Patent Office shall be bound, even after the termination of their employment, neither to disclose nor to make use of information which by its nature is a professional secret.</P>
<P class="p862 ft5">Article 13</P>
<P class="p863 ft4">Disputes between the Organisation and the employees of the European</P>
<P class="p749 ft4">Patent Office</P>
<P class="p864 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">Employees and former employees of the European Patent Office or their successors in title may apply to the Administrative Tribunal of the International Labour Organization in the case of disputes with the European Patent Organisation, in accordance with the Statute of the Tribunal and within the limits and subject to the conditions laid down in</SPAN></P>
<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t37">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td137"><P class="p3 ft4">the Service Regulations for permanent employees or the Pension Scheme</P></TD>
	<TD rowspan=2 class="tr14 td71"><P class="p17 ft4">257</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr37 td137"><P class="p3 ft202">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_258">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t21">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">Regulations or arising from the conditions of employment of other</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">employees.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft4">Bilaga 6</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">An appeal shall only be admissible if the person concerned has exhausted such other means of appeal as are available to him under the Service Regulations, the Pension Scheme Regulations or the conditions of employment.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p865 ft5">Article 14</P>
<P class="p866 ft4">Languages of the European Patent Office, European patent applications</P>
<P class="p867 ft4">and other documents</P>
<P class="p681 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The official languages of the European Patent Office shall be English, French and German.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">A European patent application shall be filed in one of the official languages or, if filed in any other language, translated into one of the official languages in accordance with the Implementing Regulations. Throughout the proceedings before the European Patent Office, such translation may be brought into conformity with the application as filed. If a required translation is not filed in due time, the application shall be deemed to be withdrawn.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The official language of the European Patent Office in which the European patent application is filed or into which it is translated shall be used as the language of the proceedings in all proceedings before the European Patent Office, unless the Implementing Regulations provide otherwise.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p279 ft32"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft127">Natural or legal persons having their residence or principal place of business within a Contracting State having a language other than English, French or German as an official language, and nationals of that State who are resident abroad, may file documents which have to be filed within a time limit in an official language of that State. They shall, however, file a translation in an official language of the European Patent Office in accordance with the Implementing Regulations. If any document, other than those documents making up the European patent application, is not filed in the prescribed language, or if any required translation is not filed in due time, the document shall be deemed not to have been filed.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p840 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(5)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">European patent applications shall be published in the language of the proceedings.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p320 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(6)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">Specifications of European patents shall be published in the language of the proceedings and shall include a translation of the claims in the other two official languages of the European Patent Office.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p840 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(7)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The following shall be published in the three official languages of the European Patent Office:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft4">(a) the European Patent Bulletin;</P>
<P class="p174 ft4">(b) the Official Journal of the European Patent Office.</P>
<P class="p320 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(8)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">Entries in the European Patent Register shall be made in the three official languages of the European Patent Office. In cases of doubt, the entry in the language of the proceedings shall be authentic.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p446 ft4">258</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_259">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t60">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td249"><P class="p868 ft26">Article 15</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td249"><P class="p869 ft7">Departments entrusted with the procedure</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft4">Bilaga 6</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p682 ft4">To carry out the procedures laid down in this Convention, the following shall be set up within the European Patent Office:</P>
<P class="p174 ft4"><SPAN class="ft7">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">a Receiving Section;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p283 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Search Divisions;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">Examining Divisions;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Opposition Divisions;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft4"><SPAN class="ft7">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">a Legal Division;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(f)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft37">Boards of Appeal;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(g)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">an Enlarged Board of Appeal.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p683 ft5">Article 16</P>
<P class="p715 ft4">Receiving Section</P>
<P class="p481 ft4">The Receiving Section shall be responsible for the examination on filing and the examination as to formal requirements of European patent applications.</P>
<P class="p683 ft5">Article 17</P>
<P class="p870 ft4">Search Divisions</P>
<P class="p481 ft4">The Search Divisions shall be responsible for drawing up European search reports.</P>
<P class="p683 ft5">Article 18</P>
<P class="p871 ft4">Examining Divisions</P>
<P class="p681 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The Examining Divisions shall be responsible for the examination of European patent applications.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p279 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">An Examining Division shall consist of three technically qualified examiners. However, before a decision is taken on a European patent application, its examination shall, as a general rule, be entrusted to one member of the Examining Division. Oral proceedings shall be before the Examining Division itself. If the Examining Division considers that the nature of the decision so requires, it shall be enlarged by the addition of a legally qualified examiner. In the event of parity of votes, the vote of the Chairman of the Examining Division shall be decisive.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p683 ft5">Article 19</P>
<P class="p872 ft4">Opposition Divisions</P>
<P class="p672 ft4">(1) The Opposition Divisions shall be responsible for the examination of oppositions against any European patent.</P>
<P class="p320 ft32">(2) An Opposition Division shall consist of three technically qualified examiners, at least two of whom shall not have taken part in the proceedings for grant of the patent to which the opposition relates. An examiner who has taken part in the proceedings for the grant of the European patent may not be the Chairman. Before a decision is taken on</P>
<P class="p174 ft135">the opposition, the Opposition Division may entrust the examination of</P>
<P class="p390 ft4">259</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_260">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t61">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">the opposition to one of its members. Oral proceedings shall be before</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">the Opposition Division itself. If the Opposition Division considers that</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 6</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft7">the nature of the decision so requires, it shall be enlarged by the addition</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft4">of a legally qualified examiner who shall not have taken part in the</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">proceedings for grant of the patent. In the event of parity of votes, the</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">vote of the Chairman of the Opposition Division shall be decisive.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr11 td140"><P class="p678 ft26">Article 20</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr11 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">Legal Division</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p445 ft32"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft127">The Legal Division shall be responsible for decisions in respect of entries in the Register of European Patents and in respect of registration on, and deletion from, the list of professional representatives.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Decisions of the Legal Division shall be taken by one legally qualified member.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p873 ft5">Article 21</P>
<P class="p874 ft4">Boards of Appeal</P>
<P class="p481 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The Boards of Appeal shall be responsible for the examination of appeals from decisions of the Receiving Section, the Examining Divisions and Opposition Divisions, and the Legal Division.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">For appeals from decisions of the Receiving Section or the Legal Division, a Board of Appeal shall consist of three legally qualified members.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p840 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">For appeals from a decision of an Examining Division, a Board of Appeal shall consist of:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p320 ft6">(a) two technically qualified members and one legally qualified member, when the decision concerns the refusal of a European patent application or the grant, limitation or revocation of a European patent, and was taken by an Examining Division consisting of less than four members;</P>
<P class="p250 ft4">(b) three technically and two legally qualified members, when the decision was taken by an Examining Division consisting of four members, or when the Board of Appeal considers that the nature of the appeal so requires;</P>
<P class="p283 ft4">(c) three legally qualified members in all other cases.</P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">For appeals from a decision of an Opposition Division, a Board of Appeal shall consist of:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4">(a) two technically qualified members and one legally qualified member, when the decision was taken by an Opposition Division consisting of three members;</P>
<P class="p250 ft4">(b) three technically and two legally qualified members, when the decision was taken by an Opposition Division consisting of four members, or when the Board of Appeal considers that the nature of the appeal so requires.</P>
<P class="p875 ft4">260</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_261">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t62">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td250"><P class="p876 ft26">Article 22</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td250"><P class="p877 ft7">Enlarged Board of Appeal</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft4">Bilaga 6</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p480 ft4">(1) The Enlarged Board of Appeal shall be responsible for:</P>
<P class="p878 ft4"><SPAN class="ft7">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">deciding on points of law referred to it by Boards of Appeal under Article 112;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p840 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">giving opinions on points of law referred to it by the President of the European Patent Office under Article 112;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">deciding on petitions for review of decisions of the Boards of Appeal under Article 112a.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4">(2) In proceedings under paragraph 1(a) and (b), the Enlarged Board of Appeal shall consist of five legally and two technically qualified members. In proceedings under paragraph 1(c), the Enlarged Board of Appeal shall consist of three or five members as laid down in the Implementing Regulations. In all proceedings, a legally qualified member shall be the Chairman.</P>
<P class="p683 ft5">Article 23</P>
<P class="p879 ft4">Independence of the members of the Boards</P>
<P class="p686 ft32"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft127">The members of the Enlarged Board of Appeal and of the Boards of Appeal shall be appointed for a term of five years and may not be removed from office during this term, except if there are serious grounds for such removal and if the Administrative Council, on a proposal from the Enlarged Board of Appeal, takes a decision to this effect. Notwithstanding sentence 1, the term of office of members of the Boards shall end if they resign or are retired in accordance with the Service Regulations for permanent employees of the European Patent Office.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p837 ft8"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft63">The members of the Boards may not be members of the Receiving Section, Examining Divisions, Opposition Divisions or Legal Division.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p379 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">In their decisions the members of the Boards shall not be bound by any instructions and shall comply only with the provisions of this Convention.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The Rules of Procedure of the Boards of Appeal and the Enlarged Board of Appeal shall be adopted in accordance with the Implementing Regulations. They shall be subject to the approval of the Administrative Council.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p683 ft5">Article 24</P>
<P class="p880 ft4">Exclusion and objection</P>
<P class="p686 ft6">(1) Members of the Boards of Appeal or of the Enlarged Board of Appeal may not take part in a case in which they have any personal interest, or if they have previously been involved as representatives of one of the parties, or if they participated in the decision under appeal.</P>
<P class="p250 ft4">(2) If, for one of the reasons mentioned in paragraph 1, or for any other reason, a member of a Board of Appeal or of the Enlarged Board of Appeal considers that he should not take part in any appeal, he shall inform the Board accordingly.</P>
<P class="p283 ft4">(3) Members of a Board of Appeal or of the Enlarged Board of Appeal</P>
<P class="p174 ft76">may be objected to by any party for one of the reasons mentioned in</P>
<P class="p390 ft4">261</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_262">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t21">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">paragraph 1, or if suspected of partiality. An objection shall not be</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td140"><P class="p3 ft8">admissible if, while being aware of a reason for objection, the party has</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 6</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">taken a procedural step. An objection may not be based upon the</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">nationality of members.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p451 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The Boards of Appeal and the Enlarged Board of Appeal shall decide as to the action to be taken in the cases specified in paragraphs 2 and 3, without the participation of the member concerned. For the purposes of taking this decision the member objected to shall be replaced by his alternate.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p683 ft5">Article 25</P>
<P class="p156 ft4">Technical opinion</P>
<P class="p673 ft6">At the request of the competent national court hearing an infringement or revocation action, the European Patent Office shall be obliged, on payment of an appropriate fee, to give a technical opinion concerning the European patent which is the subject of the action. The Examining Division shall be responsible for issuing such opinions.</P>
<P class="p881 ft8">Chapter IV</P>
<P class="p882 ft26">The Administrative Council</P>
<P class="p883 ft5">Article 26</P>
<P class="p804 ft4">Membership</P>
<P class="p673 ft17"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft203">The Administrative Council shall be composed of the Representatives and the alternate Representatives of the Contracting States. Each Contracting State shall be entitled to appoint one Representative and one alternate Representative to the Administrative Council.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p379 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The members of the Administrative Council may, in accordance with the Rules of Procedure of the Administrative Council, be assisted by advisers or experts.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p884 ft5">Article 27</P>
<P class="p885 ft4">Chairmanship</P>
<P class="p686 ft32"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft127">The Administrative Council shall elect a Chairman and a Deputy Chairman from among the Representatives and alternate Representatives of the Contracting States. The Deputy Chairman shall </SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">ex officio </SPAN>replace the Chairman if he is prevented from carrying out his duties.</P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The terms of office of the Chairman and the Deputy Chairman shall be three years. They may be </SPAN><NOBR>re-elected.</NOBR></P>
<P class="p886 ft5">Article 28</P>
<P class="p546 ft4">Board</P>
<P class="p887 ft8"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft63">When there are at least eight Contracting States, the Administrative Council may set up a Board composed of five of its members.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p888 ft4">262</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_263">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t21">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">(2) The Chairman and the Deputy Chairman of the Administrative</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td140"><P class="p3 ft13">Council shall be members of the Board <SPAN class="ft47">ex officio</SPAN>; the other three</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 6</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">members shall be elected by the Administrative Council.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p889 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The term of office of the members elected by the Administrative Council shall be three years. They may not be re- elected.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The Board shall perform the duties assigned to it by the Administrative Council in accordance with the Rules of Procedure.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p890 ft5">Article 29</P>
<P class="p891 ft4">Meetings</P>
<P class="p682 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Meetings of the Administrative Council shall be convened by its Chairman.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The President of the European Patent Office shall take part in the deliberations of the Administrative Council.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The Administrative Council shall hold an ordinary meeting once each year. In addition, it shall meet on the initiative of its Chairman or at the request of </SPAN><NOBR>one-third</NOBR> of the Contracting States.</P>
<P class="p892 ft8"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft63">The deliberations of the Administrative Council shall be based on an agenda, and shall be held in accordance with its Rules of Procedure.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p451 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(5)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The provisional agenda shall contain any question whose inclusion is requested by any Contracting State in accordance with the Rules of Procedure.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p683 ft5">Article 30</P>
<P class="p893 ft4">Attendance of observers</P>
<P class="p481 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The World Intellectual Property Organization shall be represented at the meetings of the Administrative Council, in accordance with an agreement between the Organisation and the World Intellectual Property Organization.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Other intergovernmental organisations entrusted with carrying out international procedures in the field of patents, with which the Organisation has concluded an agreement, shall be represented at the meetings of the Administrative Council, in accordance with such agreement.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Any other intergovernmental and international </SPAN><NOBR>non-governmental</NOBR> organisations carrying out an activity of interest to the Organisation may be invited by the Administrative Council to be represented at its meetings during any discussion of matters of mutual interest.</P>
<P class="p683 ft5">Article 31</P>
<P class="p894 ft4">Languages of the Administrative Council</P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The languages used in the deliberations of the Administrative Council shall be English, French and German.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Documents submitted to the Administrative Council, and the minutes of its deliberations, shall be drawn up in the three languages specified in paragraph 1.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p499 ft4">263</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_264">


<DIV>
<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p895 ft5">Article 32</P>
<P class="p896 ft4">Staff, premises and equipment</P>
<P class="p138 ft4">The European Patent Office shall place at the disposal of the Administrative Council, and of any committee established by it, such staff, premises and equipment as may be necessary for the performance of their duties.</P>
<P class="p862 ft5">Article 33</P>
<P class="p897 ft4">Competence of the Administrative Council in certain cases</P>
<P class="p139 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The Administrative Council shall be competent to amend:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p71 ft4">(a) the time limits laid down in this Convention;</P>
<P class="p105 ft4">(b) Parts II to VIII and Part X of this Convention, to bring them into line with an international treaty relating to patents or European Community legislation relating to patents;</P>
<P class="p71 ft4">(c) the Implementing Regulations.</P>
<P class="p393 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The Administrative Council shall be competent, in conformity with this Convention, to adopt or amend:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p339 ft4">(a) the Financial Regulations;</P>
<P class="p263 ft32">(b) the Service Regulations for permanent employees and the conditions of employment of other employees of the European Patent Office, the salary scales of the said permanent and other employees, and also the nature of any supplementary benefits and the rules for granting them;</P>
<P class="p898 ft8">(c) the Pension Scheme Regulations and any appropriate increases in existing pensions to correspond to increases in salaries;</P>
<P class="p343 ft4">(d) the Rules relating to Fees;</P>
<P class="p71 ft4">(e) its Rules of Procedure.</P>
<P class="p263 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">Notwithstanding Article 18, paragraph 2, the Administrative Council shall be competent to decide, in the light of experience, that in certain categories of cases Examining Divisions shall consist of one technically qualified examiner only. Such decision may be rescinded.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p105 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The Administrative Council shall be competent to authorise the President of the European Patent Office to negotiate and, subject to its approval, to conclude agreements on behalf of the European Patent Organisation with States, with intergovernmental organisations and with documentation centres set up on the basis of agreements with such organisations.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p267 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(5)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The Administrative Council may not take a decision under paragraph 1(b):</SPAN></P>
<P class="p899 ft4">– concerning an international treaty, before its entry into force;</P>
<P class="p900 ft4">– concerning European Community legislation, before its entry into force or, where that legislation lays down a period for its implementation, before the expiry of that period.</P>
<P class="p862 ft5">Article 34</P>
<P class="p749 ft4">Voting rights</P>
<P class="p393 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The right to vote in the Administrative Council shall be restricted to the Contracting States.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p267 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Each Contracting State shall have one vote, except where Article 36 applies.</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p515 ft17">Prop. 2006/07:56 Bilaga 6</P>
<P class="p636 ft4">264</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_265">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t63">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td251"><P class="p901 ft26">Article 35</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td251"><P class="p902 ft8">Voting rules</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft4">Bilaga 6</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p672 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The Administrative Council shall take its decisions, other than those referred to in paragraphs 2 and 3, by a simple majority of the Contracting States represented and voting.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">A majority of three quarters of the votes of the Contracting States represented and voting shall be required for the decisions which the Administrative Council is empowered to take under Article 7, Article 11, paragraph 1, Article 33, paragraphs 1(a) and (c), and 2 to 4, Article 39, paragraph 1, Article 40, paragraphs 2 and 4, Article 46, Article 134a, Article 149a, paragraph 2, Article 152, Article 153, paragraph 7, Article 166 and Article 172.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p279 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">Unanimity of the Contracting States voting shall be required for the decisions which the Administrative Council is empowered to take under Article 33, paragraph 1(b). The Administrative Council shall take such decisions only if all the Contracting States are represented. A decision taken on the basis of Article 33, paragraph 1(b), shall not take effect if a Contracting State declares, within twelve months of the date of the decision, that it does not wish to be bound by that decision.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p283 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Abstentions shall not be considered as votes.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p689 ft5">Article 36</P>
<P class="p903 ft4">Weighting of votes</P>
<P class="p673 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">In respect of the adoption or amendment of the Rules relating to Fees and, if the financial contribution to be made by the Contracting States would thereby be increased, the adoption of the budget of the Organisation and of any amending or supplementary budget, any Contracting State may require, following a first ballot in which each Contracting State shall have one vote, and whatever the result of this ballot, that a second ballot be taken immediately, in which votes shall be given to the States in accordance with paragraph 2. The decision shall be determined by the result of this second ballot.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p840 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The number of votes that each Contracting State shall have in the second ballot shall be calculated as follows:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4">(a) the percentage obtained for each Contracting State in respect of the scale for the special financial contributions, pursuant to Article 40, paragraphs 3 and 4, shall be multiplied by the number of Contracting States and divided by five;</P>
<P class="p426 ft4">(b) the number of votes thus given shall be rounded upwards to the next whole number;</P>
<P class="p283 ft4">(c) five additional votes shall be added to this number;</P>
<P class="p174 ft4">(d) nevertheless, no Contracting State shall have more than 30 votes.</P>
<P class="p756 ft4">265</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_266">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t64">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td252"><P class="p692 ft7">Chapter V</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td252"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 6</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td252"><P class="p904 ft4">Financial provisions</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr12 td252"><P class="p904 ft26">Article 37</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr12 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td252"><P class="p692 ft8">Budgetary funding</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p697 ft4">The budget of the Organisation shall be financed:</P>
<P class="p174 ft4"><SPAN class="ft7">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">by the Organisation's own resources;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">by payments made by the Contracting States in respect of renewal fees for European patents levied in these States;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">where necessary, by special financial contributions made by the Contracting States,</SPAN></P>
<P class="p283 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">where appropriate, by the revenue provided for in Article 146;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft7">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">where appropriate, and for tangible assets only, by </SPAN><NOBR>third-party</NOBR> borrowings secured on land or buildings;</P>
<P class="p174 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(f)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft37">where appropriate, by </SPAN><NOBR>third-party</NOBR> funding for specific projects.</P>
<P class="p683 ft5">Article 38</P>
<P class="p905 ft4">The Organisation's own resources</P>
<P class="p5 ft4">The Organisation’s own resources shall comprise:</P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft7">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">all income from fees and other sources and also the reserves of the Organisation;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p279 ft8"><SPAN class="ft8">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft63">the resources of the Pension Reserve Fund, which shall be treated as a special class of asset of the Organisation, designed to support the Organisation's pension scheme by providing the appropriate reserves.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p906 ft5">Article 39</P>
<P class="p907 ft4">Payments by the Contracting States in respect of renewal fees for</P>
<P class="p908 ft4">European patents</P>
<P class="p481 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Each Contracting State shall pay to the Organisation in respect of each renewal fee received for a European patent in that State an amount equal to a proportion of that fee, to be fixed by the Administrative Council; the proportion shall not exceed 75% and shall be the same for all Contracting States. However, if the said proportion corresponds to an amount which is less than a uniform minimum amount fixed by the Administrative Council, the Contracting State shall pay that minimum to the Organisation.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Each Contracting State shall communicate to the Organisation such information as the Administrative Council considers to be necessary to determine the amount of these payments.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p840 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The due dates for these payments shall be determined by the Administrative Council.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">If a payment is not remitted fully by the due date, the Contracting State shall pay interest from the due date on the amount remaining unpaid.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p414 ft4">266</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_267">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t65">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td190"><P class="p909 ft26">Article 40</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td190"><P class="p910 ft7">Level of fees and payments – Special financial contributions</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft4">Bilaga 6</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p672 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The amounts of the fees referred to in Article 38 and the proportion referred to in Article 39 shall be fixed at such a level as to ensure that the revenue in respect thereof is sufficient for the budget of the Organisation to be balanced.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">However, if the Organisation is unable to balance its budget under the conditions laid down in paragraph 1, the Contracting States shall remit to the Organisation special financial contributions, the amount of which shall be determined by the Administrative Council for the accounting period in question.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p279 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">These special financial contributions shall be determined in respect of any Contracting State on the basis of the number of patent applications filed in the last year but one prior to that of entry into force of this Convention, and calculated in the following manner:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4">(a) one half in proportion to the number of patent applications filed in that Contracting State;</P>
<P class="p250 ft4">(b) one half in proportion to the second highest number of patent applications filed in the other Contracting States by natural or legal persons having their residence or principal place of business in that Contracting State.</P>
<P class="p15 ft4">However, the amounts to be contributed by States in which the number of patent applications filed exceeds 25 000 shall then be taken as a whole and a new scale drawn up in proportion to the total number of patent applications filed in these States.</P>
<P class="p279 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">Where the scale position of any Contracting State cannot be established in accordance with paragraph 3, the Administrative Council shall, with the consent of that State, decide its scale position.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(5)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Article 39, paragraphs 3 and 4, shall apply mutatis mutandis to the special financial contributions.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(6)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The special financial contributions shall be repaid with interest at a rate which shall be the same for all Contracting States. Repayments shall be made in so far as it is possible to provide for this purpose in the budget; the amount thus provided shall be distributed among the Contracting States in accordance with the scale referred to in paragraphs 3 and 4.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(7)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The special financial contributions remitted in any accounting period shall be repaid in full before any such contributions or parts thereof remitted in any subsequent accounting period are repaid.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p689 ft5">Article 41</P>
<P class="p911 ft4">Advances</P>
<P class="p481 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">At the request of the President of the European Patent Office, the Contracting States shall grant advances to the Organisation, on account of their payments and contributions, within the limit of the amount fixed by the Administrative Council. The amount of such advances shall be determined in proportion to the amounts due from the Contracting States for the accounting period in question.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p479 ft4">267</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_268">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t11">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">(2) Article 39, paragraphs 3 and 4, shall apply <SPAN class="ft26">mutatis mutandis </SPAN>to the</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td140"><P class="p3 ft13">advances.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 6</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr12 td140"><P class="p678 ft26">Article 42</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr12 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p678 ft7">Budget</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p737 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The budget of the Organisation shall be balanced. It shall be drawn up in accordance with the generally accepted accounting principles laid down in the Financial Regulations. If necessary, there may be amending or supplementary budgets.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The budget shall be drawn up in the unit of account fixed in the Financial Regulations.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p683 ft5">Article 43</P>
<P class="p912 ft4">Authorisation for expenditure</P>
<P class="p481 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The expenditure entered in the budget shall be authorised for the duration of one accounting period, unless the Financial Regulations provide otherwise.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">In accordance with the Financial Regulations, any appropriations, other than those relating to staff costs, which are unexpended at the end of the accounting period may be carried forward, but not beyond the end of the following accounting period.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Appropriations shall be set out under different headings according to type and purpose of the expenditure and subdivided, as far as necessary, in accordance with the Financial Regulations.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p683 ft5">Article 44</P>
<P class="p913 ft4">Appropriations for unforeseeable expenditure</P>
<P class="p682 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The budget of the Organisation may contain appropriations for unforeseeable expenditure.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p837 ft7"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft201">The employment of these appropriations by the Organisation shall be subject to the prior approval of the expenditure Administrative Council.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p906 ft5">Article 45</P>
<P class="p914 ft4">Accounting period</P>
<P class="p681 ft4">The accounting period shall commence on 1 January and end on 31 December.</P>
<P class="p689 ft5">Article 46</P>
<P class="p915 ft4">Preparation and adoption of the budget</P>
<P class="p481 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The President of the European Patent Office shall submit the draft budget to the Administrative Council no later than the date prescribed in the Financial Regulations.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The budget and any amending or supplementary budget shall be adopted by the Administrative Council.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p499 ft4">268</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_269">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t66">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td18"><P class="p916 ft26">Article 47</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td18"><P class="p917 ft7">Provisional budget</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft4">Bilaga 6</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p672 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">If, at the beginning of the accounting period, the budget has not been adopted by the Administrative Council, expenditures may be effected on a monthly basis per heading or other division of the budget, in accordance with the Financial Regulations, up to one- twelfth of the budget appropriations for the preceding accounting period, provided that the appropriations thus made available to the President of the European Patent Office shall not exceed </SPAN><NOBR>one-twelfth</NOBR> of those provided for in the draft budget.</P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The Administrative Council may, subject to the observance of the other provisions laid down in paragraph 1, authorise expenditure in excess of one- twelfth of the appropriations.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p279 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">The payments referred to in Article 37(b), shall continue to be made, on a provisional basis, under the conditions determined under Article 39 for the year preceding that to which the draft budget relates.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The Contracting States shall pay each month, on a provisional basis and in accordance with the scale referred to in Article 40, paragraphs 3 and 4, any special financial contributions necessary to ensure implementation of paragraphs 1 and 2. Article 39, paragraph 4, shall apply </SPAN><SPAN class="ft5">mutatis mutandis </SPAN>to these contributions.</P>
<P class="p683 ft5">Article 48</P>
<P class="p918 ft4">Budget implementation</P>
<P class="p481 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The President of the European Patent Office shall implement the budget and any amending or supplementary budget on his own responsibility and within the limits of the allocated appropriations.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Within the budget, the President of the European Patent Office may, in accordance with the Financial Regulations, transfer funds between the various headings or </SPAN><NOBR>sub-headings.</NOBR></P>
<P class="p683 ft5">Article 49</P>
<P class="p871 ft4">Auditing of accounts</P>
<P class="p672 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The income and expenditure account and a balance sheet of the Organisation shall be examined by auditors whose independence is beyond doubt, appointed by the Administrative Council for a period of five years, which shall be renewable or extensible.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The audit shall be based on vouchers and shall take place, if necessary, </SPAN><SPAN class="ft5">in situ</SPAN>. The audit shall ascertain whether all income has been received and all expenditure effected in a lawful and proper manner and whether the financial management is sound. The auditors shall draw up a report containing a signed audit opinion after the end of each accounting period.</P>
<P class="p279 ft32"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft127">The President of the European Patent Office shall annually submit to the Administrative Council the accounts of the preceding accounting period in respect of the budget and the balance sheet showing the assets and liabilities of the Organisation together with the report of the auditors.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p716 ft4">269</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_270">


<P class="p257 ft4">(4) The Administrative Council shall approve the annual accounts Prop. 2006/07:56 together with the report of the auditors and shall discharge the President Bilaga 6</P>
<P class="p426 ft4">of the European Patent Office in respect of the implementation of the budget.</P>
<P class="p683 ft5">Article 50</P>
<P class="p919 ft4">Financial Regulations</P>
<P class="p5 ft4">The Financial Regulations shall lay down</P>
<P class="p837 ft8"><SPAN class="ft7">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft20">the arrangements relating to the establishment and implementation of the budget and for the rendering and auditing of accounts;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p451 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">the method and procedure whereby the payments and contributions provided for in Article 37 and the advances provided for in Article 41 are to be made available to the Organisation by the Contracting States; in particular:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p840 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">the rules concerning the responsibilities of authorising and accounting officers and the arrangements for their supervision;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">the rates of interest provided for in Articles 39, 40 and 47;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p840 ft4"><SPAN class="ft7">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">the method of calculating the contributions payable by virtue of Article146;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p837 ft7"><SPAN class="ft8">(f)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft182">the composition of and duties to be assigned to a Budget and Finance Committee which should be set up by the Administrative Council;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p450 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(g)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">the generally accepted accounting principles on which the budget and the annual financial statements shall be based.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p683 ft5">Article 51</P>
<P class="p920 ft4">Fees</P>
<P class="p681 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The European Patent Office may levy fees for any official task or procedure carried out under this Convention.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p840 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Time limits for the payment of fees other than those fixed by this Convention shall be laid down in the Implementing Regulations.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Where the Implementing Regulations provide that a fee shall be paid, they shall also lay down the legal consequences of failure to pay such fee in due time.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The Rules relating to Fees shall determine in particular the amounts of the fees and the ways in which they are to be paid.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p921 ft4">270</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_271">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t67">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr8 td253"><P class="p922 ft4">PART II</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr8 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td253"><P class="p3 ft12">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 6</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td253"><P class="p922 ft4">SUBSTANTIVE PATENT LAW</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr12 td253"><P class="p923 ft8">Chapter I</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr12 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr11 td253"><P class="p923 ft4">Patentability</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr11 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr11 td253"><P class="p922 ft26">Article 52</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr11 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td253"><P class="p923 ft7">Patentable inventions</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p737 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">European patents shall be granted for any inventions, in all fields of technology, provided that they are new, involve an inventive step and are susceptible of industrial application.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p840 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The following in particular shall not be regarded as inventions within the meaning of paragraph 1:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft4">(a) discoveries, scientific theories and mathematical methods;</P>
<P class="p174 ft4">(b) aesthetic creations;</P>
<P class="p840 ft4">(c) schemes, rules and methods for performing mental acts, playing games or doing business, and programs for computers;</P>
<P class="p174 ft4">(d) presentations of information.</P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Paragraph 2 shall exclude the patentability of the </SPAN><NOBR>subject-matter</NOBR> or activities referred to therein only to the extent to which a European patent application or European patent relates to such <NOBR>subject-matter</NOBR> or activities as such.</P>
<P class="p683 ft5">Article 53</P>
<P class="p130 ft4">Exceptions to patentability</P>
<P class="p5 ft4">European patents shall not be granted in respect of:</P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft7">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">inventions the commercial exploitation of which would be contrary to </SPAN><SPAN class="ft5">ordre public </SPAN>or morality; such exploitation shall not be deemed to be so contrary merely because it is prohibited by law or regulation in some or all of the Contracting States;</P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">plant or animal varieties or essentially biological processes for the production of plants or animals; this provision shall not apply to microbiological processes or the products thereof;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">methods for treatment of the human or animal body by surgery or therapy and diagnostic methods practised on the human or animal body; this provision shall not apply to products, in particular substances or compositions, for use in any of these methods.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p683 ft5">Article 54</P>
<P class="p924 ft4">Novelty</P>
<P class="p481 ft4">(1) An invention shall be considered to be new if it does not form part of the state of the art.</P>
<P class="p320 ft6">(2) The state of the art shall be held to comprise everything made available to the public by means of a written or oral description, by use, or in any other way, before the date of filing of the European patent</P>
<P class="p174 ft135">application.</P>
<P class="p390 ft4">271</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_272">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t52">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p3 ft8">(3) Additionally, the content of European patent applications as filed, the</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td140"><P class="p3 ft13">dates of filing of which are prior to the date referred to in paragraph 2</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 6</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft8">and which were published on or after that date, shall be considered as</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">comprised in the state of the art.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p451 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Paragraphs 2 and 3 shall not exclude the patentability of any substance or composition, comprised in the state of the art, for use in a method referred to in Article 53(c), provided that its use for any such method is not comprised in the state of the art.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(5)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Paragraphs 2 and 3 shall also not exclude the patentability of any substance or composition referred to in paragraph 4 for any specific use in a method referred to in Article 53(c), provided that such use is not comprised in the state of the art.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p683 ft5">Article 55</P>
<P class="p111 ft4"><NOBR>Non-prejudicial</NOBR> disclosures</P>
<P class="p481 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">For the application of Article 54, a disclosure of the invention shall not be taken into consideration if it occurred no earlier than six months preceding the filing of the European patent application and if it was due to, or in consequence of:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p840 ft4">(a) an evident abuse in relation to the applicant or his legal predecessor, or</P>
<P class="p233 ft4">(b) the fact that the applicant or his legal predecessor has displayed the invention at an official, or officially recognised, international exhibition falling within the terms of the Convention on international exhibitions signed at Paris on 22 November 1928 and last revised on 30 November 1972.</P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">In the case of paragraph 1(b), paragraph 1 shall apply only if the applicant states, when filing the European patent application, that the invention has been so displayed and files a supporting certificate within the time limit and under the conditions laid down in the Implementing Regulations.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p683 ft5">Article 56</P>
<P class="p925 ft4">Inventive step</P>
<P class="p673 ft6">An invention shall be considered as involving an inventive step if, having regard to the state of the art, it is not obvious to a person skilled in the art. If the state of the art also includes documents within the meaning of Article 54, paragraph 3, these documents shall not be considered in deciding whether there has been an inventive step.</P>
<P class="p683 ft5">Article 57</P>
<P class="p872 ft4">Industrial application</P>
<P class="p686 ft8">An invention shall be considered as susceptible of industrial application if it can be made or used in any kind of industry, including agriculture.</P>
<P class="p926 ft4">272</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_273">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t68">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td254"><P class="p3 ft4">Chapter II</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td254"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft4">Bilaga 6</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p790 ft4">Persons entitled to apply for and obtain a European patent –</P>
<P class="p927 ft4">Mention of the inventor</P>
<P class="p683 ft5">Article 58</P>
<P class="p928 ft4">Entitlement to file a European patent application</P>
<P class="p481 ft4">A European patent application may be filed by any natural or legal person, or any body equivalent to a legal person by virtue of the law governing it.</P>
<P class="p683 ft5">Article 59</P>
<P class="p580 ft4">Multiple applicants</P>
<P class="p686 ft32">A European patent application may also be filed either by joint applicants or by two or more applicants designating different Contracting States.</P>
<P class="p683 ft5">Article 60</P>
<P class="p130 ft4">Right to a European patent</P>
<P class="p481 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The right to a European patent shall belong to the inventor or his successor in title. If the inventor is an employee the right to a European patent shall be determined in accordance with the law of the State in which the employee is mainly employed; if the State in which the employee is mainly employed cannot be determined, the law to be applied shall be that of the State in which the employer has the place of business to which the employee is attached.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">If two or more persons have made an invention independently of each other, the right to a European patent therefor shall belong to the person whose European patent application has the earliest date of filing, provided that this first application has been published.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p892 ft7"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft201">In proceedings before the European Patent Office, the applicant shall be deemed to be entitled to exercise the right to a European patent.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p906 ft5">Article 61</P>
<P class="p929 ft4">European patent applications filed by <NOBR>non-entitled</NOBR> persons</P>
<P class="p481 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">If by a final decision it is adjudged that a person other than the applicant is entitled to the grant of the European patent, that person may, in accordance with the Implementing Regulations:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4">(a) prosecute the European patent application as his own application in place of the applicant;</P>
<P class="p840 ft4">(b) file a new European patent application in respect of the same invention; or</P>
<P class="p174 ft4">(c) request that the European patent application be refused.</P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Article 76, paragraph 1, shall apply </SPAN><SPAN class="ft5">mutatis mutandis </SPAN>to a new European patent application filed under paragraph 1(b).</P>
<P class="p414 ft4">273</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_274">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t61">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p678 ft26">Article 62</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td140"><P class="p679 ft7">Right of the inventor to be mentioned</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 6</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr11 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">The inventor shall have the right, <NOBR>vis-à-vis</NOBR> the applicant for or proprietor</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr11 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">of a European patent, to be mentioned as such before the European</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">Patent Office.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr38 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">Chapter III</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr38 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p930 ft4">Effects of the European patent and the</P>
<P class="p931 ft4">European patent application</P>
<P class="p683 ft5">Article 63</P>
<P class="p721 ft4">Term of the European patent</P>
<P class="p681 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The term of the European patent shall be 20 years from the date of filing of the application.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Nothing in the preceding paragraph shall limit the right of a Contracting State to extend the term of a European patent, or to grant corresponding protection which follows immediately on expiry of the term of the patent, under the same conditions as those applying to national patents:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4">(a) in order to take account of a state of war or similar emergency conditions affecting that State;</P>
<P class="p250 ft4">(b) if the <NOBR>subject-matter</NOBR> of the European patent is a product or a process for manufacturing a product or a use of a product which has to undergo an administrative authorisation procedure required by law before it can be put on the market in that State.</P>
<P class="p892 ft8"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft63">Paragraph 2 shall apply </SPAN><SPAN class="ft26">mutatis mutandis </SPAN>to European patents granted jointly for a group of Contracting States in accordance with Article 142.</P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">A Contracting State which makes provision for extension of the term or corresponding protection under paragraph 2(b) may, in accordance with an agreement concluded with the Organisation, entrust to the European Patent Office tasks associated with implementation of the relevant provisions.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p890 ft5">Article 64</P>
<P class="p740 ft4">Rights conferred by a European patent</P>
<P class="p481 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">A European patent shall, subject to the provisions of paragraph 2, confer on its proprietor from the date on which the mention of its grant is published in the European Patent Bulletin, in each Contracting State in respect of which it is granted, the same rights as would be conferred by a national patent granted in that State.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">If the </SPAN><NOBR>subject-matter</NOBR> of the European patent is a process, the protection conferred by the patent shall extend to the products directly obtained by such process.</P>
<P class="p840 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Any infringement of a European patent shall be dealt with by national law.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p634 ft4">274</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_275">


<P class="p14 ft4">Prop. 2006/07:56</P>
<P class="p932 ft4"><SPAN class="ft5">Article 65</SPAN><SPAN style="padding-left:229px;">Bilaga 6 Translation of the European patent</SPAN></P>
<P class="p686 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">Any Contracting State may, if the European patent as granted, amended or limited by the European Patent Office is not drawn up in one of its official languages, prescribe that the proprietor of the patent shall supply to its central industrial property office a translation of the patent as granted, amended or limited in one of its official languages at his option or, where that State has prescribed the use of one specific official language, in that language. The period for supplying the translation shall end three months after the date on which the mention of the grant, maintenance in amended form or limitation of the European patent is published in the European Patent Bulletin, unless the State concerned prescribes a longer period.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p451 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Any Contracting State which has adopted provisions pursuant to paragraph 1 may prescribe that the proprietor of the patent must pay all or part of the costs of publication of such translation within a period laid down by that State.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p279 ft8"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft63">Any Contracting State may prescribe that in the event of failure to observe the provisions adopted in accordance with paragraphs 1 and 2, the European patent shall be deemed to be void </SPAN><SPAN class="ft26">ab initio </SPAN>in that State.</P>
<P class="p933 ft5">Article 66</P>
<P class="p934 ft4">Equivalence of European filing with national filing</P>
<P class="p481 ft4">A European patent application which has been accorded a date of filing shall, in the designated Contracting States, be equivalent to a regular national filing, where appropriate with the priority claimed for the European patent application.</P>
<P class="p683 ft5">Article 67</P>
<P class="p935 ft4">Rights conferred by a European patent application after publication</P>
<P class="p686 ft6">(1) A European patent application shall, from the date of its publication, provisionally confer upon the applicant the protection provided for by Article 64, in the Contracting States designated in the application.</P>
<P class="p279 ft4">(2) Any Contracting State may prescribe that a European patent application shall not confer such protection as is conferred by Article 64. However, the protection attached to the publication of the European patent application may not be less than that which the laws of the State concerned attach to the compulsory publication of unexamined national patent applications. In any event, each State shall ensure at least that, from the date of publication of a European patent application, the applicant can claim compensation reasonable in the circumstances from any person who has used the invention in that State in circumstances where that person would be liable under national law for infringement of a national patent.</P>
<P class="p728 ft17">(3) Any Contracting State which does not have as an official language the language of the proceedings may prescribe that provisional protection</P>
<P class="p174 ft92">in accordance with paragraphs 1 and 2 above shall not be effective until</P>
<P class="p390 ft4">275</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_276">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t61">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p3 ft8">such time as a translation of the claims in one of its official languages at</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td140"><P class="p3 ft8">the option of the applicant or, where that State has prescribed the use of</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 6</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">one specific official language, in that language:</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p889 ft4"><SPAN class="ft7">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">has been made available to the public in the manner prescribed by national law, or</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">has been communicated to the person using the invention in the said State.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p279 ft32">(4) The European patent application shall be deemed never to have had the effects set out in paragraphs 1 and 2 when it has been withdrawn, deemed to be withdrawn or finally refused. The same shall apply in respect of the effects of the European patent application in a Contracting State the designation of which is withdrawn or deemed to be withdrawn.</P>
<P class="p683 ft5">Article 68</P>
<P class="p936 ft4">Effect of revocation or limitation of the European patent</P>
<P class="p686 ft6">The European patent application and the resulting European patent shall be deemed not to have had, from the outset, the effects specified in Articles 64 and 67, to the extent that the patent has been revoked or limited in opposition, limitation or revocation proceedings.</P>
<P class="p683 ft5">Article 69</P>
<P class="p8 ft4">Extent of protection</P>
<P class="p672 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The extent of the protection conferred by a European patent or a European patent application shall be determined by the claims. Nevertheless, the description and drawings shall be used to interpret the claims.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">For the period up to grant of the European patent, the extent of the protection conferred by the European patent application shall be determined by the claims contained in the application as published. However, the European patent as granted or as amended in opposition, limitation or revocation proceedings shall determine retroactively the protection conferred by the application, in so far as such protection is not thereby extended.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p937 ft5">Article 70</P>
<P class="p938 ft4">Authentic text of a European patent application or</P>
<P class="p939 ft4">European patent</P>
<P class="p481 ft4">(1) The text of a European patent application or a European patent in the language of the proceedings shall be the authentic text in any proceedings before the European Patent Office and in any Contracting State.</P>
<P class="p250 ft4">(2) If, however, the European patent application has been filed in a language which is not an official language of the European Patent Office, that text shall be the application as filed within the meaning of this Convention.</P>
<P class="p283 ft4">(3) Any Contracting State may provide that a translation into one of its</P>
<P class="p174 ft76">official languages, as prescribed by it according to this Convention, shall</P>
<P class="p390 ft4">276</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_277">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t61">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p3 ft8">in that State be regarded as authentic, except for revocation proceedings,</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td140"><P class="p3 ft8">in the event of the European patent application or European patent in the</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 6</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft8">language of the translation conferring protection which is narrower than</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">that conferred by it in the language of the proceedings.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p38 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Any Contracting State which adopts a provision under paragraph 3:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p320 ft6">(a) shall allow the applicant for or proprietor of the patent to file a corrected translation of the European patent application or European patent. Such corrected translation shall not have any legal effect until any conditions established by the Contracting State under Article 65, paragraph 2, or Article 67, paragraph 3, have been complied with;</P>
<P class="p250 ft4">(b) may prescribe that any person who, in that State, in good faith has used or has made effective and serious preparations for using an invention the use of which would not constitute infringement of the application or patent in the original translation, may, after the corrected translation takes effect, continue such use in the course of his business or for the needs thereof without payment.</P>
<P class="p764 ft4">Chapter IV</P>
<P class="p940 ft4">The European patent application as an object of property</P>
<P class="p689 ft5">Article 71</P>
<P class="p941 ft4">Transfer and constitution of rights</P>
<P class="p672 ft4">A European patent application may be transferred or give rise to rights for one or more of the designated Contracting States.</P>
<P class="p689 ft5">Article 72</P>
<P class="p885 ft4">Assignment</P>
<P class="p672 ft4">An assignment of a European patent application shall be made in writing and shall require the signature of the parties to the contract.</P>
<P class="p689 ft5">Article 73</P>
<P class="p872 ft4">Contractual licensing</P>
<P class="p673 ft8">A European patent application may be licensed in whole or in part for the whole or part of the territories of the designated Contracting States.</P>
<P class="p933 ft5">Article 74</P>
<P class="p730 ft4">Law applicable</P>
<P class="p672 ft4">Unless this Convention provides otherwise, the European patent application as an object of property shall, in each designated Contracting State and with effect for such State, be subject to the law applicable in that State to national patent applications.</P>
<P class="p723 ft4">277</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_278">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t69">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr8 td255"><P class="p942 ft4">PART III</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr8 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td255"><P class="p3 ft12">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 6</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td255"><P class="p943 ft4">THE EUROPEAN PATENT APPLICATION</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr12 td255"><P class="p943 ft8">Chapter I</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr12 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr11 td255"><P class="p943 ft4">Filing and requirements of the European patent application</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr11 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr11 td255"><P class="p944 ft26">Article 75</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr11 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td255"><P class="p944 ft7">Filing of a European patent application</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p697 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">A European patent application may be filed:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p283 ft4">(a) with the European Patent Office, or</P>
<P class="p233 ft4">(b) if the law of a Contracting State so permits, and subject to Article 76, paragraph 1, with the central industrial property office or other competent authority of that State. Any application filed in this way shall have the same effect as if it had been filed on the same date with the European Patent Office.</P>
<P class="p840 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Paragraph 1 shall not preclude the application of legislative or regulatory provisions which, in any Contracting State:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4">(a) govern inventions which, owing to the nature of their <NOBR>subject-matter,</NOBR> may not be communicated abroad without the prior authorisation of the competent authorities of that State, or</P>
<P class="p233 ft4">(b) prescribe that any application is to be filed initially with a national authority, or make direct filing with another authority subject to prior authorisation.</P>
<P class="p683 ft5">Article 76</P>
<P class="p895 ft4">European divisional applications</P>
<P class="p672 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">A European divisional application shall be filed directly with the European Patent Office in accordance with the Implementing Regulations. It may be filed only in respect of </SPAN><NOBR>subject-matter</NOBR> which does not extend beyond the content of the earlier application as filed; in so far as this requirement is complied with, the divisional application shall be deemed to have been filed on the date of filing of the earlier application and shall enjoy any right of priority.</P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">All the Contracting States designated in the earlier application at the time of filing of a European divisional application shall be deemed to be designated in the divisional application.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p689 ft5">Article 77</P>
<P class="p945 ft4">Forwarding of European patent applications</P>
<P class="p481 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The central industrial property office of a Contracting State shall forward to the European Patent Office any European patent application filed with it or any other competent authority in that State, in accordance with the Implementing Regulations.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p840 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">A European patent application the subject of which has been made secret shall not be forwarded to the European Patent Office.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p716 ft4">278</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_279">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t11">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p679 ft7">(3) A European patent application not forwarded to the European Patent</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td140"><P class="p3 ft13">Office in due time shall be deemed to be withdrawn.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 6</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr12 td140"><P class="p678 ft26">Article 78</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr12 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft7">Requirements of a European patent application</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p697 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">A European patent application shall contain:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft4">(a) a request for the grant of a European patent;</P>
<P class="p174 ft4">(b) a description of the invention;</P>
<P class="p174 ft4">(c) one or more claims;</P>
<P class="p174 ft4">(d) any drawings referred to in the description or the claims;</P>
<P class="p174 ft4">(e) an abstract,</P>
<P class="p283 ft4">and satisfy the requirements laid down in the Implementing Regulations.</P>
