<P class="p320 ft8"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft63">A European patent application shall be subject to the payment of the filing fee and the search fee. If the filing fee or the search fee is not paid in due time, the application shall be deemed to be withdrawn.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p906 ft5">Article 79</P>
<P class="p946 ft4">Designation of Contracting States</P>
<P class="p481 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">All the Contracting States party to this Convention at the time of filing of the European patent application shall be deemed to be designated in the request for grant of a European patent.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The designation of a Contracting State may be subject to the payment of a designation fee.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p840 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The designation of a Contracting State may be withdrawn at any time up to the grant of the European patent.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p689 ft5">Article 80</P>
<P class="p947 ft4">Date of filing</P>
<P class="p672 ft4">The date of filing of a European patent application shall be the date on which the requirements laid down in the Implementing Regulations are fulfilled.</P>
<P class="p689 ft5">Article 81</P>
<P class="p948 ft4">Designation of the inventor</P>
<P class="p481 ft4">The European patent application shall designate the inventor. If the applicant is not the inventor or is not the sole inventor, the designation shall contain a statement indicating the origin of the right to the European patent.</P>
<P class="p683 ft5">Article 82</P>
<P class="p715 ft4">Unity of invention</P>
<P class="p481 ft4">The European patent application shall relate to one invention only or to a group of inventions so linked as to form a single general inventive concept.</P>
<P class="p499 ft4">279</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_280">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t11">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p949 ft5">Article 83</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">Disclosure of the invention</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 6</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr11 td140"><P class="p679 ft7">The European patent application shall disclose the invention in a manner</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr11 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">sufficiently clear and complete for it to be carried out by a person skilled</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">in the art.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr11 td140"><P class="p678 ft26">Article 84</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr11 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft7">Claims</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr12 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">The claims shall define the matter for which protection is sought. They</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr12 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">shall be clear and concise and be supported by the description.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr11 td140"><P class="p678 ft26">Article 85</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr11 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft7">Abstract</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr12 td140"><P class="p679 ft7">The abstract shall serve the purpose of technical information only; it may</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr12 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft4">not be taken into account for any other purpose, in particular for</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">interpreting the scope of the protection sought or applying Article 54,</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">paragraph 3.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr11 td140"><P class="p678 ft26">Article 86</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr11 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td140"><P class="p678 ft7">Renewal fees for the European patent application</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p737 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Renewal fees for the European patent application shall be paid to the European Patent Office in accordance with the Implementing Regulations. These fees shall be due in respect of the third year and each subsequent year, calculated from the date of filing of the application. If a renewal fee is not paid in due time, the application shall be deemed to be withdrawn.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The obligation to pay renewal fees shall terminate with the payment of the renewal fee due in respect of the year in which the mention of the grant of the European patent is published in the European Patent Bulletin.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p950 ft4">Chapter II</P>
<P class="p951 ft4">Priority</P>
<P class="p683 ft5">Article 87</P>
<P class="p952 ft4">Priority right</P>
<P class="p174 ft4">(1) Any person who has duly filed, in or for</P>
<P class="p840 ft4"><SPAN class="ft7">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">any State party to the Paris Convention for the Protection of Industrial Property or</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">any Member of the World Trade Organization,</SPAN></P>
<P class="p320 ft6">an application for a patent, a utility model or a utility certificate, or his successor in title, shall enjoy, for the purpose of filing a European patent application in respect of the same invention, a right of priority during a period of twelve months from the date of filing of the first application.</P>
<P class="p283 ft4">(2) Every filing that is equivalent to a regular national filing under the</P>
<P class="p174 ft76">national law of the State where it was made or under bilateral or</P>
<P class="p390 ft4">280</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_281">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t21">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">multilateral agreements, including this Convention, shall be recognised</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">as giving rise to a right of priority.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft4">Bilaga 6</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">A regular national filing shall mean any filing that is sufficient to establish the date on which the application was filed, whatever the outcome of the application may be.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p320 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">A subsequent application in respect of the same </SPAN><NOBR>subject-matter</NOBR> as a previous first application and filed in or for the same State shall be considered as the first application for the purposes of determining priority, provided that, at the date of filing the subsequent application, the previous application has been withdrawn, abandoned or refused, without being open to public inspection and without leaving any rights outstanding, and has not served as a basis for claiming a right of priority. The previous application may not thereafter serve as a basis for claiming a right of priority.</P>
<P class="p728 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(5)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">If the first filing has been made with an industrial property authority which is not subject to the Paris Convention for the Protection of Industrial Property or the Agreement Establishing the World Trade Organization, paragraphs 1 to 4 shall apply if that authority, according to a communication issued by the President of the European Patent Office, recognises that a first filing made with the European Patent Office gives rise to a right of priority under conditions and with effects equivalent to those laid down in the Paris Convention.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p683 ft5">Article 88</P>
<P class="p953 ft4">Claiming priority</P>
<P class="p686 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">An applicant desiring to take advantage of the priority of a previous application shall file a declaration of priority and any other document required, in accordance with the Implementing Regulations.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p320 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">Multiple priorities may be claimed in respect of a European patent application, notwithstanding the fact that they originated in different countries. Where appropriate, multiple priorities may be claimed for any one claim. Where multiple priorities are claimed, time limits which run from the date of priority shall run from the earliest date of priority.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">If one or more priorities are claimed in respect of a European patent application, the right of priority shall cover only those elements of the European patent application which are included in the application or applications whose priority is claimed.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p279 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">If certain elements of the invention for which priority is claimed do not appear among the claims formulated in the previous application, priority may nonetheless be granted, provided that the documents of the previous application as a whole specifically disclose such elements.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p683 ft5">Article 89</P>
<P class="p954 ft4">Effect of priority right</P>
<P class="p686 ft32">The right of priority shall have the effect that the date of priority shall count as the date of filing of the European patent application for the purposes of Article 54, paragraphs 2 and 3, and Article 60, paragraph 2.</P>
<P class="p499 ft4">281</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_282">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t70">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr8 td256"><P class="p955 ft4">PART IV</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr8 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td256"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 6</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td256"><P class="p956 ft8">PROCEDURE UP TO GRANT</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr12 td256"><P class="p956 ft26">Article 90</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr12 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td256"><P class="p956 ft7">Examination on filing and examination as to formal requirements</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p737 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The European Patent Office shall examine, in accordance with the Implementing Regulations, whether the application satisfies the requirements for the accordance of a date of filing.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">If a date of filing cannot be accorded following the examination under paragraph 1, the application shall not be dealt with as a European patent application.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p279 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">If the European patent application has been accorded a date of filing, the European Patent Office shall examine, in accordance with the Implementing Regulations, whether the requirements in Articles 14, 78 and 81, and, where applicable, Article 88, paragraph 1, and Article 133, paragraph 2, as well as any other requirement laid down in the Implementing Regulations, have been satisfied.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p279 ft8"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft63">Where the European Patent Office in carrying out the examination under paragraphs 1 or 3 notes that there are deficiencies which may be corrected, it shall give the applicant an opportunity to correct them.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p379 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(5)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">If any deficiency noted in the examination under paragraph 3 is not corrected, the European patent application shall be refused unless a different legal consequence is provided for by this Convention. Where the deficiency concerns the right of priority, this right shall be lost for the application.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p683 ft5">Article 91</P>
<P class="p957 ft4">Examination as to formal requirements (deleted)</P>
<P class="p683 ft5">Article 92</P>
<P class="p841 ft4">Drawing up of the European search report</P>
<P class="p481 ft4">The European Patent Office shall, in accordance with the Implementing Regulations, draw up and publish a European search report in respect of the European patent application on the basis of the claims, with due regard to the description and any drawings.</P>
<P class="p683 ft5">Article 93</P>
<P class="p958 ft4">Publication of the European patent application</P>
<P class="p672 ft4">(1) The European Patent Office shall publish the European patent application as soon as possible</P>
<P class="p233 ft4">(a) after the expiry of a period of eighteen months from the date of filing or, if priority has been claimed, from the date of priority, or</P>
<P class="p174 ft4">(b) at the request of the applicant, before the expiry of that period.</P>
<P class="p320 ft32">(2) The European patent application shall be published at the same time as the specification of the European patent when the decision to grant the patent becomes effective before the expiry of the period referred to in</P>
<P class="p174 ft135">paragraph 1(a).</P>
<P class="p390 ft4">282</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_283">


<P class="p14 ft4">Prop. 2006/07:56</P>
<P class="p959 ft4"><SPAN class="ft5">Article 94</SPAN><SPAN style="padding-left:229px;">Bilaga 6 Examination of the European patent application</SPAN></P>
<P class="p481 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The European Patent Office shall, in accordance with the Implementing Regulations, examine on request whether the European patent application and the invention to which it relates meet the requirements of this Convention. The request shall not be deemed to be filed until the examination fee has been paid.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p840 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">If no request for examination has been made in due time, the application shall be deemed to be withdrawn.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">If the examination reveals that the application or the invention to which it relates does not meet the requirements of this Convention, the Examining Division shall invite the applicant, as often as necessary, to file his observations and, subject to Article 123, paragraph 1, to amend the application.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">If the applicant fails to reply in due time to any communication from the Examining Division, the application shall be deemed to be withdrawn.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p683 ft5">Article 95</P>
<P class="p960 ft4">Extension of the period within which requests for examination may be</P>
<P class="p925 ft4">filed (deleted)</P>
<P class="p683 ft5">Article 96</P>
<P class="p961 ft4">Examination of the European patent application (deleted)</P>
<P class="p689 ft5">Article 97</P>
<P class="p962 ft4">Grant or refusal</P>
<P class="p673 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">If the Examining Division is of the opinion that the European patent application and the invention to which it relates meet the requirements of this Convention, it shall decide to grant a European patent, provided that the conditions laid down in the Implementing Regulations are fulfilled.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">If the Examining Division is of the opinion that the European patent application or the invention to which it relates does not meet the requirements of this Convention, it shall refuse the application unless this Convention provides for a different legal consequence.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The decision to grant a European patent shall take effect on the date on which the mention of the grant is published in the European Patent Bulletin.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p683 ft5">Article 98</P>
<P class="p761 ft4">Publication of the specification of the European patent</P>
<P class="p686 ft32">The European Patent Office shall publish the specification of the European patent as soon as possible after the mention of the grant of the European patent has been published in the European Patent Bulletin.</P>
<P class="p499 ft4">283</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_284">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t71">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr8 td257"><P class="p963 ft4">PART V</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr8 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td257"><P class="p3 ft12">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 6</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td257"><P class="p964 ft4">OPPOSITION AND LIMITATION PROCEDURE</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr12 td257"><P class="p965 ft26">Article 99</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr12 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td257"><P class="p965 ft7">Opposition</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p737 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Within nine months of the publication of the mention of the grant of the European patent in the European Patent Bulletin, any person may give notice to the European Patent Office of opposition to that patent, in accordance with the Implementing Regulations. Notice of opposition shall not be deemed to have been filed until the opposition fee has been paid.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p840 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The opposition shall apply to the European patent in all the Contracting States in which that patent has effect.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Opponents shall be parties to the opposition proceedings as well as the proprietor of the patent.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Where a person provides evidence that in a Contracting State, following a final decision, he has been entered in the patent register of such State instead of the previous proprietor, such person shall, at his request, replace the previous proprietor in respect of such State. Notwithstanding Article 118, the previous proprietor and the person making the request shall not be regarded as joint proprietors unless both so request.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p792 ft5">Article 100</P>
<P class="p966 ft4">Grounds for opposition</P>
<P class="p5 ft4">Opposition may only be filed on the grounds that:</P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft7">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">the </SPAN><NOBR>subject-matter</NOBR> of the European patent is not patentable under Articles 52 to 57;</P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">the European patent does not disclose the invention in a manner sufficiently clear and complete for it to be carried out by a person skilled in the art;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">the </SPAN><NOBR>subject-matter</NOBR> of the European patent extends beyond the content of the application as filed, or, if the patent was granted on a divisional application or on a new application filed under Article 61, beyond the content of the earlier application as filed.</P>
<P class="p764 ft5">Article 101</P>
<P class="p829 ft4">Examination of the opposition – Revocation or maintenance</P>
<P class="p688 ft4">of the European patent</P>
<P class="p673 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">If the opposition is admissible, the Opposition Division shall examine, in accordance with the Implementing Regulations, whether at least one ground for opposition under Article 100 prejudices the maintenance of the European patent. During this examination, the Opposition Division shall invite the parties, as often as necessary, to file observations on communications from another party or issued by itself.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p499 ft4">284</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_285">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t21">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">(2) If the Opposition Division is of the opinion that at least one ground</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td140"><P class="p3 ft8">for opposition prejudices the maintenance of the European patent, it shall</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 6</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">revoke the patent. Otherwise, it shall reject the opposition.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p451 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">If the Opposition Division is of the opinion that, taking into consideration the amendments made by the proprietor of the European patent during the opposition proceedings, the patent and the invention to which it relates</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4">(a) meet the requirements of this Convention, it shall decide to maintain the patent as amended, provided that the conditions laid down in the Implementing Regulations are fulfilled;</P>
<P class="p426 ft4">(b) do not meet the requirements of this Convention, it shall revoke the patent.</P>
<P class="p764 ft5">Article 102</P>
<P class="p829 ft4">Revocation or maintenance of the European patent (deleted)</P>
<P class="p753 ft5">Article 103</P>
<P class="p961 ft4">Publication of a new specification of the European patent</P>
<P class="p672 ft4">If the European patent is maintained as amended under Article 101, paragraph 3(a), the European Patent Office shall publish a new specification of the European patent as soon as possible after the mention of the opposition decision has been published in the European Patent Bulletin.</P>
<P class="p764 ft5">Article 104</P>
<P class="p967 ft4">Costs</P>
<P class="p481 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Each party to the opposition proceedings shall bear the costs it has incurred, unless the Opposition Division, for reasons of equity, orders, in accordance with the Implementing Regulations, a different apportionment of costs.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p840 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The procedure for fixing costs shall be laid down in the Implementing Regulations.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Any final decision of the European Patent Office fixing the amount of costs shall be dealt with, for the purpose of enforcement in the Contracting States, in the same way as a final decision given by a civil court of the State in which enforcement is to take place. Verification of such decision shall be limited to its authenticity.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p764 ft5">Article 105</P>
<P class="p817 ft4">Intervention of the assumed infringer</P>
<P class="p672 ft4">(1) Any third party may, in accordance with the Implementing Regulations, intervene in opposition proceedings after the opposition period has expired, if the third party proves that</P>
<P class="p233 ft4">(a) proceedings for infringement of the same patent have been instituted against him, or</P>
<P class="p279 ft8">(b) following a request of the proprietor of the patent to cease alleged infringement, the third party has instituted proceedings for a ruling that</P>
<P class="p174 ft92">he is not infringing the patent.</P>
<P class="p390 ft4">285</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_286">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t11">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">(2) An admissible intervention shall be treated as an opposition.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td140"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 6</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft26">Article 105a</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft7">Request for limitation or revocation</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p737 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">At the request of the proprietor, the European patent may be revoked or be limited by an amendment of the claims. The request shall be filed with the European Patent Office in accordance with the Implementing Regulations. It shall not be deemed to have been filed until the limitation or revocation fee has been paid.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p840 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The request may not be filed while opposition proceedings in respect of the European patent are pending.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p968 ft5">Article 105b</P>
<P class="p738 ft4">Limitation or revocation of the European patent</P>
<P class="p481 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The European Patent Office shall examine whether the requirements laid down in the Implementing Regulations for limiting or revoking the European patent have been met.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p279 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">If the European Patent Office considers that the request for limitation or revocation of the European patent meets these requirements, it shall decide to limit or revoke the European patent in accordance with the Implementing Regulations. Otherwise, it shall reject the request.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p320 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The decision to limit or revoke the European patent shall apply to the European patent in all the Contracting States in respect of which it has been granted. It shall take effect on the date on which the mention of the decision is published in the European Patent Bulletin.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p968 ft5">Article 105c</P>
<P class="p969 ft4">Publication of the amended specification of the European patent</P>
<P class="p672 ft4">If the European patent is limited under Article 105b, paragraph 2, the European Patent Office shall publish the amended specification of the European patent as soon as possible after the mention of the limitation has been published in the European Patent Bulletin.</P>
<P class="p950 ft4">PART VI</P>
<P class="p970 ft4">APPEALS PROCEDURE</P>
<P class="p753 ft5">Article 106</P>
<P class="p111 ft4">Decisions subject to appeal</P>
<P class="p672 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">An appeal shall lie from decisions of the Receiving Section, Examining Divisions, Opposition Divisions and the Legal Division. It shall have suspensive effect.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">A decision which does not terminate proceedings as regards one of the parties can only be appealed together with the final decision, unless the decision allows a separate appeal.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p499 ft4">286</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_287">


<P class="p257 ft4">(3) The right to file an appeal against decisions relating to the Prop. 2006/07:56 apportionment or fixing of costs in opposition proceedings may be Bilaga 6 restricted in the Implementing Regulations.</P>
<P class="p753 ft5">Article 107</P>
<P class="p907 ft4">Persons entitled to appeal and to be parties to appeal proceedings</P>
<P class="p672 ft4">Any party to proceedings adversely affected by a decision may appeal. Any other parties to the proceedings shall be parties to the appeal proceedings as of right.</P>
<P class="p764 ft5">Article 108</P>
<P class="p971 ft4">Time limit and form</P>
<P class="p686 ft32">Notice of appeal shall be filed, in accordance with the Implementing Regulations, at the European Patent Office within two months of notification of the decision. Notice of appeal shall not be deemed to have been filed until the fee for appeal has been paid. Within four months of notification of the decision, a statement setting out the grounds of appeal shall be filed in accordance with the Implementing Regulations.</P>
<P class="p764 ft5">Article 109</P>
<P class="p972 ft4">Interlocutory revision</P>
<P class="p673 ft17"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft203">If the department whose decision is contested considers the appeal to be admissible and well founded, it shall rectify its decision. This shall not apply where the appellant is opposed by another party to the proceedings.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p451 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">If the appeal is not allowed within three months of receipt of the statement of grounds, it shall be remitted to the Board of Appeal without delay, and without comment as to its merit.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p764 ft5">Article 110</P>
<P class="p768 ft4">Examination of appeals</P>
<P class="p481 ft4">If the appeal is admissible, the Board of Appeal shall examine whether the appeal is allowable. The examination of the appeal shall be conducted in accordance with the Implementing Regulations.</P>
<P class="p764 ft5">Article 111</P>
<P class="p835 ft4">Decision in respect of appeals</P>
<P class="p481 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Following the examination as to the allowability of the appeal, the Board of Appeal shall decide on the appeal. The Board of Appeal may either exercise any power within the competence of the department which was responsible for the decision appealed or remit the case to that department for further prosecution.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p279 ft8"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft63">If the Board of Appeal remits the case for further prosecution to the department whose decision was appealed, that department shall be bound by the </SPAN><SPAN class="ft26">ratio decidendi </SPAN>of the Board of Appeal, in so far as the facts are the same. If the decision under appeal was taken by the Receiving</P>
<P class="p652 ft4">287</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_288">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t21">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p679 ft4">Section, the Examining Division shall also be bound by the <SPAN class="ft5">ratio</SPAN></P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td140"><P class="p3 ft13"><SPAN class="ft47">decidendi </SPAN>of the Board of Appeal.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 6</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr12 td140"><P class="p679 ft26">Article 112</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr12 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p678 ft7">Decision or opinion of the Enlarged Board of Appeal</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p680 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">In order to ensure uniform application of the law, or if a point of law of fundamental importance arises:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p320 ft6">(a) the Board of Appeal shall, during proceedings on a case and either of its own motion or following a request from a party to the appeal, refer any question to the Enlarged Board of Appeal if it considers that a decision is required for the above purposes. If the Board of Appeal rejects the request, it shall give the reasons in its final decision;</P>
<P class="p250 ft4">(b) the President of the European Patent Office may refer a point of law to the Enlarged Board of Appeal where two Boards of Appeal have given different decisions on that question.</P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">In the cases referred to in paragraph 1(a) the parties to the appeal proceedings shall be parties to the proceedings before the Enlarged Board of Appeal.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The decision of the Enlarged Board of Appeal referred to in paragraph 1(a) shall be binding on the Board of Appeal in respect of the appeal in question.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p973 ft5">Article 112a</P>
<P class="p974 ft4">Petition for review by the Enlarged Board of Appeal</P>
<P class="p481 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Any party to appeal proceedings adversely affected by the decision of the Board of Appeal may file a petition for review of the decision by the Enlarged Board of Appeal.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The petition may only be filed on the grounds that:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft7">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">a member of the Board of Appeal took part in the decision in breach of Article 24, paragraph 1, or despite being excluded pursuant to a decision under Article 24, paragraph 4;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">the Board of Appeal included a person not appointed as a member of the Boards of Appeal;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">a fundamental violation of Article 113 occurred;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p840 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">any other fundamental procedural defect defined in the Implementing Regulations occurred in the appeal proceedings; or</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft7">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">a criminal act established under the conditions laid down in the Implementing Regulations may have had an impact on the decision.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft4">(3) The petition for review shall not have suspensive effect.</P>
<P class="p233 ft4">(4) The petition for review shall be filed in a reasoned statement, in accordance with the Implementing Regulations. If based on paragraph 2(a) to (d), the petition shall be filed within two months of notification of the decision of the Board of Appeal. If based on paragraph 2(e), the petition shall be filed within two months of the date on which the criminal act has been established and in any event no later than five years from notification of the decision of the Board of Appeal. The petition shall not be deemed to have been filed until after the prescribed fee has been paid.</P>
<P class="p474 ft4">288</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_289">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t61">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">(5) The Enlarged Board of Appeal shall examine the petition for review</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td140"><P class="p3 ft13">in accordance with the Implementing Regulations. If the petition is</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 6</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft8">allowable, the Enlarged Board of Appeal shall set aside the decision and</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft8">shall <NOBR>re-open</NOBR> proceedings before the Boards of Appeal in accordance</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">with the Implementing Regulations.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(6)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Any person who, in a designated Contracting State, has in good faith used or made effective and serious preparations for using an invention which is the subject of a published European patent application or a European patent in the period between the decision of the Board of Appeal and publication in the European Patent Bulletin of the mention of the decision of the Enlarged Board of Appeal on the petition, may without payment continue such use in the course of his business or for the needs thereof.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p792 ft4">PART VII</P>
<P class="p157 ft4">COMMON PROVISIONS</P>
<P class="p975 ft4">Chapter I</P>
<P class="p976 ft4">Common provisions governing procedure</P>
<P class="p753 ft5">Article 113</P>
<P class="p977 ft4">Right to be heard and basis of decisions</P>
<P class="p672 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The decisions of the European Patent Office may only be based on grounds or evidence on which the parties concerned have had an opportunity to present their comments.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p320 ft32"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft127">The European Patent Office shall examine, and decide upon, the European patent application or the European patent only in the text submitted to it, or agreed, by the applicant or the proprietor of the patent.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p753 ft5">Article 114</P>
<P class="p746 ft4">Examination by the European Patent of its own motion</P>
<P class="p686 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">In proceedings before it, the European Patent Office shall examine the facts; it shall not be restricted in this examination to the facts, evidence and arguments provided by the parties and the relief sought.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p840 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The European Patent Office may disregard facts or evidence which are not submitted in due time by the parties concerned.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p978 ft5">Article 115</P>
<P class="p712 ft4">Observations by third parties</P>
<P class="p481 ft4">In proceedings before the European Patent Office, following the publication of the European patent application, any third party may, in accordance with the Implementing Regulations, present Office of its own motion observations concerning the patentability of the invention to which the application or patent relates. That person shall not be a party to the proceedings.</P>
<P class="p478 ft4">289</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_290">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t72">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td258"><P class="p979 ft26">Article 116</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td258"><P class="p980 ft7">Oral proceedings</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft4">Bilaga 6</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p672 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Oral proceedings shall take place either at the instance of the European Patent Office if it considers this to be expedient or at the request of any party to the proceedings. However, the European Patent Office may reject a request for further oral proceedings before the same department where the parties and the subject of the proceedings are the same.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Nevertheless, oral proceedings shall take place before the Receiving Section at the request of the applicant only where the Receiving Section considers this to be expedient or where it intends to refuse the European patent application.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p840 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Oral proceedings before the Receiving Section, the Examining Divisions and the Legal Division shall not be public.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p320 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">Oral proceedings, including delivery of the decision, shall be public, as regards the Boards of Appeal and the Enlarged Board of Appeal, after publication of the European patent application, and also before the Opposition Divisions, in so far as the department before which the proceedings are taking place does not decide otherwise in cases where admission of the public could have serious and unjustified disadvantages, in particular for a party to the proceedings.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p764 ft5">Article 117</P>
<P class="p788 ft4">Means and taking of evidence</P>
<P class="p681 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">In proceedings before the European Patent Office the means of giving or obtaining evidence shall include the following:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft4">(a) hearing the parties;</P>
<P class="p174 ft4">(b) requests for information;</P>
<P class="p283 ft4">(c) production of documents;</P>
<P class="p174 ft4">(d) hearing witnesses;</P>
<P class="p174 ft4">(e) opinions by experts;</P>
<P class="p174 ft4">(f) inspection;</P>
<P class="p174 ft4">(g) sworn statements in writing.</P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The procedure for taking such evidence shall be laid down in the Implementing Regulations.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p764 ft5">Article 118</P>
<P class="p726 ft4">Unity of the European patent application or European patent</P>
<P class="p481 ft4">Where the applicants for or proprietors of a European patent are not the same in respect of different designated Contracting States, they shall be regarded as joint applicants or proprietors for the purposes of proceedings before the European Patent Office. The unity of the application or patent in these proceedings shall not be affected; in particular the text of the application or patent shall be uniform for all designated Contracting States, unless this Convention provides otherwise.</P>
<P class="p455 ft4">290</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_291">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t73">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td259"><P class="p901 ft26">Article 119</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td259"><P class="p901 ft4">Notification</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft4">Bilaga 6</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p673 ft6">Decisions, summonses, notices and communications shall be notified by the European Patent Office of its own motion in accordance with the Implementing Regulations. Notification may, where exceptional circumstances so require, be effected through the intermediary of the central industrial property offices of the Contracting States.</P>
<P class="p832 ft5">Article 120</P>
<P class="p891 ft4">Time limits</P>
<P class="p480 ft4">The Implementing Regulations shall specify:</P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft7">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">the time limits which are to be observed in proceedings before the European Patent Office and are not fixed by this Convention;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">the manner of computation of time limits and the conditions under which time limits may be extended;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">the minima and maxima for time limits to be determined by the European Patent Office.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p764 ft5">Article 121</P>
<P class="p981 ft4">Further processing of the European patent application</P>
<P class="p481 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">If an applicant fails to observe a time limit </SPAN><NOBR>vis-à-vis</NOBR> the European Patent Office, he may request further processing of the European patent application.</P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The European Patent Office shall grant the request, provided that the requirements laid down in the Implementing Regulations are met. Otherwise, it shall reject the request.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">If the request is granted, the legal consequences of the failure to observe the time limit shall be deemed not to have</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Further processing shall be ruled out in respect of the time limits in . ensued. Article 87, paragraph 1, Article 108 and Article 112a, paragraph 4, as well as the time limits for requesting further processing or re- establishment of rights. The Implementing Regulations may rule out further processing for other time limits.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p764 ft5">Article 122</P>
<P class="p86 ft4"><NOBR>Re-establishment</NOBR> of rights</P>
<P class="p686 ft6">(1) An applicant for or proprietor of a European patent who, in spite of all due care required by the circumstances having been taken, was unable to observe a time limit <NOBR>vis-à-vis</NOBR> the European Patent Office shall have his rights <NOBR>re-established</NOBR> upon request if the <NOBR>non-observance</NOBR> of this time limit has the direct consequence of causing the refusal of the European patent application or of a request, or the deeming of the application to have been withdrawn, or the revocation of the European patent, or the loss of any other right or means of redress.</P>
<P class="p728 ft8">(2) The European Patent Office shall grant the request, provided that the conditions of paragraph 1 and any other requirements laid down in the</P>
<P class="p174 ft92">Implementing Regulations are met. Otherwise, it shall reject the request.</P>
<P class="p390 ft4">291</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_292">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t21">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">(3) If the request is granted, the legal consequences of the failure to</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">observe the time limit shall be deemed not to have ensued.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft4">Bilaga 6</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p279 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><NOBR><SPAN class="ft27">Re-establishment</SPAN></NOBR> of rights shall be ruled out in respect of the time limit for requesting <NOBR>re-establishment</NOBR> of rights. The Implementing Regulations may rule out <NOBR>re-establishment</NOBR> for other time limits.</P>
<P class="p320 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(5)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">Any person who, in a designated Contracting State, has in good faith used or made effective and serious preparations for using an invention which is the subject of a published European patent application or a European patent in the period between the loss of rights referred to in paragraph 1 and publication in the European Patent Bulletin of the mention of </SPAN><NOBR>re-establishment</NOBR> of those rights, may without payment continue such use in the course of his business or for the needs thereof</P>
<P class="p728 ft17"><SPAN class="ft8">(6)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft203">Nothing in this Article shall limit the right of a Contracting State to grant re- establishment of rights in respect of time limits provided for in this Convention and to be observed </SPAN><NOBR>vis-à-vis</NOBR> the authorities of such State.</P>
<P class="p792 ft5">Article 123</P>
<P class="p758 ft4">Amendments</P>
<P class="p673 ft32"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft127">The European patent application or European patent may be amended in proceedings before the European Patent Office, in accordance with the Implementing Regulations. In any event, the applicant shall be given at least one opportunity to amend the application of his own volition.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The European patent application or European patent may not be amended in such a way that it contains </SPAN><NOBR>subject-matter</NOBR> which extends beyond the content of the application as filed.</P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The European patent may not be amended in such a way as to extend the protection it confers.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p753 ft5">Article 124</P>
<P class="p982 ft4">Information on prior art</P>
<P class="p481 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The European Patent Office may, in accordance with the Implementing Regulations, invite the applicant to provide information on prior art taken into consideration in national or regional patent proceedings and concerning an invention to which the European patent application relates.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">If the applicant fails to reply in due time to an invitation under paragraph 1, the European patent application shall be deemed to be withdrawn.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p753 ft5">Article 125</P>
<P class="p983 ft4">Reference to general principles</P>
<P class="p481 ft4">In the absence of procedural provisions in this Convention, the European Patent Office shall take into account the principles of procedural law generally recognised in the Contracting States.</P>
<P class="p782 ft4">292</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_293">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t74">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td260"><P class="p984 ft26">Article 126</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td260"><P class="p984 ft7">Termination of financial obligations (deleted)</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft4">Bilaga 6</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p985 ft8">Chapter II</P>
<P class="p986 ft26">Information to the public or to official authorities</P>
<P class="p987 ft5">Article 127</P>
<P class="p927 ft4">European Patent Register</P>
<P class="p481 ft4">The European Patent Office shall keep a European Patent Register, in which the particulars specified in the Implementing Regulations shall be recorded. No entry shall be made in the European Patent Register before the publication of the European patent application. The European Patent Register shall be open to public inspection.</P>
<P class="p764 ft5">Article 128</P>
<P class="p156 ft4">Inspection of files</P>
<P class="p672 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Files relating to European patent applications which have not yet been published shall not be made available for inspection without the consent of the applicant.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Any person who can prove that the applicant has invoked the rights under the European patent application against him may obtain inspection of the files before the publication of that application and without the consent of the applicant.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p279 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">Where a European divisional application or a new European patent application filed under Article 61, paragraph 1, is published, any person may obtain inspection of the files of the earlier application before the publication of that application and without the consent of the applicant.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">After the publication of the European patent application, the files relating to the application and the resulting European patent may be inspected on request, subject to the restrictions laid down in the Implementing Regulations.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(5)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Even before the publication of the European patent application, the European Patent Office may communicate to third parties or publish the particulars specified in the Implementing Regulations.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p764 ft5">Article 129</P>
<P class="p988 ft4">Periodical publications</P>
<P class="p5 ft4">The European Patent Office shall periodically publish:</P>
<P class="p320 ft6"><SPAN class="ft7">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft178">a European Patent Bulletin containing the particulars the publication of which is prescribed by this Convention, the Implementing Regulations or the President of the European Patent Office;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">an Official Journal containing notices and information of a general character issued by the President of the European Patent Office, as well as any other information relevant to this Convention or its implementation.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p989 ft4">293</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_294">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t75">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td261"><P class="p990 ft26">Article 130</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td261"><P class="p990 ft8">Exchange of information</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft4">Bilaga 6</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p672 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Unless this Convention or national laws provide otherwise, the European Patent Office and the central industrial property office of any Contracting State shall, on request, communicate to each other any useful information regarding European or national patent applications and patents and any proceedings concerning them.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p892 ft8"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft63">Paragraph 1 shall apply to the communication of information by virtue of working agreements between the European Patent Office and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p38 ft4">(a) the central industrial property offices of other States;</P>
<P class="p426 ft4">(b) any intergovernmental organisation entrusted with the task of granting patents;</P>
<P class="p283 ft4">(c) any other organisation.</P>
<P class="p320 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">Communications under paragraphs 1 and 2(a) and (b) shall not be subject to the restrictions laid down in Article 128. The Administrative Council may decide that communications under paragraph 2(c) shall not be subject to such restrictions, provided that the organisation concerned treats the information communicated as confidential until the European patent application has been published.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p764 ft5">Article 131</P>
<P class="p781 ft4">Administrative and legal <NOBR>co-operation</NOBR></P>
<P class="p673 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">Unless this Convention or national laws provide otherwise, the European Patent Office and the courts or authorities of Contracting States shall on request give assistance to each other by communicating information or opening files for inspection. Where the European Patent Office makes files available for inspection by courts, Public Prosecutors' Offices or central industrial property offices, the inspection shall not be subject to the restrictions laid down in Article 128.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">At the request of the European Patent Office, the courts or other competent authorities of Contracting States shall undertake, on behalf of the Office and within the limits of their jurisdiction, any necessary enquiries or other legal measures.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p764 ft5">Article 132</P>
<P class="p927 ft4">Exchange of publications</P>
<P class="p481 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The European Patent Office and the central industrial property offices of the Contracting States shall despatch to each other on request and for their own use one or more copies of their respective publications free of charge.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p840 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The European Patent Office may conclude agreements relating to the exchange or supply of publications.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p991 ft4">294</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_295">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t76">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td247"><P class="p992 ft8">Chapter III</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td247"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 6</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td247"><P class="p993 ft8">Representation</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr12 td247"><P class="p992 ft26">Article 133</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr12 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td247"><P class="p992 ft7">General principles of representation</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p737 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Subject to paragraph 2, no person shall be compelled to be represented by a professional representative in proceedings established by this Convention.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p320 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">Natural or legal persons not having their residence or principal place of business in a Contracting State shall be represented by a professional representative and act through him in all proceedings established by this Convention, other than in filing a European patent application; the Implementing Regulations may permit other exceptions.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p279 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">Natural or legal persons having their residence or principal place of business in a Contracting State may be represented in proceedings established by this Convention by an employee, who need not be a professional representative but who shall be authorised in accordance with the Implementing Regulations. The Implementing Regulations may provide whether and under what conditions an employee of a legal person may also represent other legal persons which have their principal place of business in a Contracting State and which have economic connections with the first legal person.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p994 ft8"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft63">The Implementing Regulations may lay down special provisions concerning the common representation of parties acting in common.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p792 ft5">Article 134</P>
<P class="p995 ft4">Representation before the European Patent Office</P>
<P class="p672 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Representation of natural or legal persons in proceedings established by this Convention may only be undertaken by professional representatives whose names appear on a list maintained for this purpose by the European Patent Office.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Any natural person who</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft4"><SPAN class="ft7">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">is a national of a Contracting State,</SPAN></P>
<P class="p283 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">has his place of business or employment in a Contracting State and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">has passed the European qualifying examination</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft4">may be entered on the list of professional representatives.</P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">During a period of one year from the date on which the accession of a State to this Convention takes effect, entry on that list may also be requested by any natural person who</SPAN></P>
<P class="p283 ft4">(a) is a national of a Contracting State,</P>
<P class="p426 ft4">(b) has his place of business or employment in the State having acceded to the Convention and</P>
<P class="p233 ft4">(c) is entitled to represent natural or legal persons in patent matters before the central industrial property office of that State. Where such entitlement is not conditional upon the requirement of special professional qualifications, the person shall have regularly so acted in that State for at least five years.</P>
<P class="p479 ft4">295</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_296">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t21">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">(4) Entry shall be effected upon request, accompanied by certificates</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft8">indicating that the conditions laid down in paragraph 2 or 3 are fulfilled.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft4">Bilaga 6</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(5)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Persons whose names appear on the list of professional representatives shall be entitled to act in all proceedings established by this Convention.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p320 ft32"><SPAN class="ft8">(6)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft127">For the purpose of acting as a professional representative, any person whose name appears on the list of professional representatives shall be entitled to establish a place of business in any Contracting State in which proceedings established by this Convention may be conducted, having regard to the Protocol on Centralisation annexed to this Convention. The authorities of such State may remove that entitlement in individual cases only in application of legal provisions adopted for the purpose of protecting public security and law and order. Before such action is taken, the President of the European Patent Office shall be consulted.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p840 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(7)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The President of the European Patent Office may grant exemption from:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft4">(a) the requirement of paragraphs 2(a) or 3(a) in special circumstances;</P>
<P class="p233 ft4">(b) the requirement of paragraph 3(c), second sentence, if the applicant furnishes proof that he has acquired the requisite qualification in another way.</P>
<P class="p279 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(8)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Representation in proceedings established by this Convention may also be undertaken, in the same way as by a professional representative, by any legal practitioner qualified in a Contracting State and having his place of business in that State, to the extent that he is entitled in that State to act as a professional representative in patent matters. Paragraph 6 shall apply </SPAN><SPAN class="ft5">mutatis mutandis</SPAN>.</P>
<P class="p968 ft5">Article 134a</P>
<P class="p996 ft4">Institute of Professional Representatives before</P>
<P class="p997 ft4">the European Patent Office</P>
<P class="p682 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The Administrative Council shall be competent to adopt and amend provisions governing:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4">(a) the Institute of Professional Representatives before the European Patent Office, hereinafter referred to as the Institute;</P>
<P class="p233 ft4">(b) the qualifications and training required of a person for admission to the European qualifying examination and the conduct of such examination;</P>
<P class="p840 ft4">(c) the disciplinary power exercised by the Institute or the European Patent Office in respect of professional representatives;</P>
<P class="p320 ft4">(d) the obligation of confidentiality on the professional representative and the privilege from disclosure in proceedings before the European Patent Office in respect of communications between a professional representative and his client or any other person.</P>
<P class="p892 ft7"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft201">Any person entered on the list of professional representatives referred to in Article 134, paragraph 1, shall be a member of the Institute.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p998 ft4">296</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_297">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t77">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr8 td262"><P class="p999 ft4">PART VIII</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr8 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td262"><P class="p3 ft12">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 6</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td262"><P class="p999 ft4">IMPACT ON NATIONAL LAW</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr12 td262"><P class="p999 ft8">Chapter I</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr12 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr11 td262"><P class="p1000 ft4">Conversion into a national patent application</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr11 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr11 td262"><P class="p999 ft26">Article 135</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr11 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td262"><P class="p999 ft7">Request for conversion</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p737 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The central industrial property office of a designated Contracting State shall, at the request of the applicant for or proprietor of a European patent, apply the procedure for the grant of a national patent in the following circumstances:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p840 ft4">(a) where the European patent application is deemed to be withdrawn under Article 77, paragraph 3;</P>
<P class="p320 ft6">(b) in such other cases as are provided for by the national law, in which the European patent application is refused or withdrawn or deemed to be withdrawn, or the European patent is revoked under this Convention.</P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">In the case referred to in paragraph 1(a), the request for conversion shall be filed with the central industrial property office with which the European patent application has been filed. That office shall, subject to the provisions governing national security, transmit the request directly to the central industrial property offices of the Contracting States specified therein.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p279 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">In the cases referred to in paragraph 1(b), the request for conversion shall be submitted to the European Patent Office in accordance with the Implementing Regulations. It shall not be deemed to be filed until the conversion fee has been paid. The European Patent Office shall transmit the request to the central industrial property offices of the Contracting States specified therein.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p892 ft8"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft63">The effect of the European patent application referred to in Article 66 shall lapse if the request for conversion is not submitted in due time.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p792 ft5">Article 136</P>
<P class="p1001 ft4">Submission and transmission of the request (deleted)</P>
<P class="p753 ft5">Article 137</P>
<P class="p749 ft4">Formal requirements for conversion</P>
<P class="p481 ft4">(1) A European patent application transmitted in accordance with Article 135, paragraph 2 or 3, shall not be subjected to formal requirements of national law which are different from or additional to those provided for in this Convention.</P>
<P class="p250 ft4">(2) Any central industrial property office to which the European patent application is transmitted may require that the applicant shall, within a period of not less than two months:</P>
<P class="p283 ft4">(a) pay the national application fee; and</P>
<P class="p174 ft4">(b) file a translation of the original text of the European patent</P>
<P class="p174 ft76">application in an official language of the State in question and, where</P>
<P class="p390 ft4">297</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_298">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t21">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">appropriate, of the text as amended during proceedings before the</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td140"><P class="p3 ft8">European Patent Office which the applicant wishes to use as the basis for</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 6</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">the national procedure.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr12 td140"><P class="p1002 ft4">Chapter II</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr12 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p1003 ft4">Revocation and prior rights</P>
<P class="p764 ft5">Article 138</P>
<P class="p1004 ft4">Revocation of European patents</P>
<P class="p681 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Subject to Article 139, a European patent may be revoked with effect for a Contracting State only on the grounds that:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p840 ft4">(a) the <NOBR>subject-matter</NOBR> of the European patent is not patentable under Articles 52 to 57;</P>
<P class="p233 ft4">(b) the European patent does not disclose the invention in a manner sufficiently clear and complete for it to be carried out by a person skilled in the art;</P>
<P class="p250 ft4">(c) the <NOBR>subject-matter</NOBR> of the European patent extends beyond the content of the application as filed or, if the patent was granted on a divisional application or on a new application filed under Article 61, beyond the content of the earlier application as filed;</P>
<P class="p174 ft4">(d) the protection conferred by the European patent has been extended; or</P>
<P class="p426 ft4">(e) the proprietor of the European patent is not entitled under Article 60, paragraph 1.</P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">If the grounds for revocation affect the European patent only in part, the patent shall be limited by a corresponding amendment of the claims and revoked in part.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">In proceedings before the competent court or authority relating to the validity of the European patent, the proprietor of the patent shall have the right to limit the patent by amending the claims. The patent as thus limited shall form the basis for the proceedings.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p764 ft5">Article 139</P>
<P class="p1005 ft4">Prior rights and rights arising on the same date</P>
<P class="p672 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">In any designated Contracting State a European patent application and a European patent shall have with regard to a national patent application and a national patent the same prior right effect as a national patent application and a national patent.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">A national patent application and a national patent in a Contracting State shall have with regard to a European patent designating that Contracting State the same prior right effect as if the European patent were a national patent.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Any Contracting State may prescribe whether and on what terms an invention disclosed in both a European patent application or patent and a national application or patent having the same date of filing or, where priority is claimed, the same date of priority, may be protected simultaneously by both applications or patents.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p499 ft4">298</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_299">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t52">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">Chapter III</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td140"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 6</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">Miscellaneous effects</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr12 td140"><P class="p679 ft26">Article 140</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr12 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">National utility models and utility certificates</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr11 td140"><P class="p679 ft4">Articles 66, 124, 135, 137 and 139 shall apply to utility models and</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr11 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft4">utility certificates and to applications for utility models and utility</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft7">certificates registered or deposited in the Contracting States whose laws</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">make provision for such models or certificates.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr11 td140"><P class="p679 ft26">Article 141</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr11 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p678 ft7">Renewal fees for European patents</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p680 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Renewal fees for a European patent may only be imposed for the years which follow that referred to in Article 86, paragraph 2.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Any renewal fees falling due within two months of the publication in the European Patent Bulletin of the mention of the grant of the European patent shall be deemed to have been validly paid if they are paid within that period. Any additional fee provided for under national law shall not be charged.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1006 ft4">PART IX</P>
<P class="p1007 ft4">SPECIAL AGREEMENTS</P>
<P class="p753 ft5">Article 142</P>
<P class="p1008 ft4">Unitary patents</P>
<P class="p686 ft32"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft127">Any group of Contracting States, which has provided by a special agreement that a European patent granted for those States has a unitary character throughout their territories, may provide that a European patent may only be granted jointly in respect of all those States.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p320 ft17"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft203">Where any group of Contracting States has availed itself of the authorisation given in paragraph 1, the provisions of this Part shall apply.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p764 ft5">Article 143</P>
<P class="p814 ft4">Special departments of the European Patent Office</P>
<P class="p681 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The group of Contracting States may give additional tasks to the European Patent Office.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft26">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Special departments common to the Contracting States in the group may be set up within the European Patent Office in order to carry out the additional tasks. The President of the European Patent Office shall direct such special departments; Article 10, paragraphs 2 and 3, shall apply </SPAN><SPAN class="ft5">mutatis mutandis.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1009 ft4">299</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_300">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t11">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p679 ft26">Article 144</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td140"><P class="p679 ft7">Representation before special departments</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 6</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr11 td140"><P class="p679 ft4">The group of Contracting States may lay down special provisions to</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr11 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">govern representation of parties before the departments referred to in</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">Article 143, paragraph 2.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr11 td140"><P class="p679 ft26">Article 145</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr11 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft7">Select committee of the Administrative Council</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p737 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The group of Contracting States may set up a select committee of the Administrative Council for the purpose of supervising the activities of the special departments set up under Article 143, paragraph 2; the European Patent Office shall place at its disposal such staff, premises and equipment as may be necessary for the performance of its duties. The President of the European Patent Office shall be responsible for the activities of the special departments to the select committee of the Administrative Council.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p889 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The composition, powers and functions of the select committee shall be determined by the group of Contracting States.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p753 ft5">Article 146</P>
<P class="p1010 ft4">Cover for expenditure for carrying out special tasks</P>
<P class="p672 ft4">Where additional tasks have been given to the European Patent Office under Article 143, the group of Contracting States shall bear the expenses incurred by the Organisation in carrying out these tasks. Where special departments have been set up in the European Patent Office to carry out these additional tasks, the group shall bear the expenditure on staff, premises and equipment chargeable in respect of these departments. Article 39, paragraphs 3 and 4, Article 41 and Article 47 shall apply <SPAN class="ft5">mutatis mutandis</SPAN>.</P>
<P class="p764 ft5">Article 147</P>
<P class="p1011 ft4">Payments in respect of renewal fees for unitary patents</P>
<P class="p673 ft8">If the group of Contracting States has fixed a common scale of renewal fees in respect of European patents the proportion referred to in Article 39, paragraph 1, shall be calculated on the basis of the common scale; the minimum amount referred to in Article 39, paragraph 1, shall apply to the unitary patent. Article 39, paragraphs 3 and 4, shall apply <SPAN class="ft26">mutatis</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1012 ft5">mutandis.</P>
<P class="p764 ft5">Article 148</P>
<P class="p855 ft4">The European patent application as an object of property</P>
<P class="p481 ft4">(1) Article 74 shall apply unless the group of Contracting States has specified otherwise.</P>
<P class="p279 ft8">(2) The group of Contracting States may provide that a European patent application for which these Contracting States are designated may only</P>
<P class="p174 ft92">be transferred, mortgaged or subjected to any legal means of execution in</P>
<P class="p390 ft4">300</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_301">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t11">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p679 ft7">respect of all the Contracting States of the group and in accordance with</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td140"><P class="p3 ft13">the provisions of the special agreement.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 6</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr12 td140"><P class="p679 ft26">Article 149</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr12 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft7">Joint designation</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
