<P class="p737 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The group of Contracting States may provide that these States may only be designated jointly, and that the designation of one or some only of such States shall be deemed to constitute the designation of all the States of the group.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p320 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Where the European Patent Office acts as a designated Office under Article 153, paragraph 1, paragraph 1 shall apply if the applicant has indicated in the international application that he wishes to obtain a European patent for one or more of the designated States of the group. The same shall apply if the applicant designates in the international application one of the Contracting States in the group, whose national law provides that the designation of that State shall have the effect of the application being for a European patent.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1013 ft5">Article 149a</P>
<P class="p1014 ft4">Other agreements between the Contracting States</P>
<P class="p481 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Nothing in this Convention shall be construed as limiting the right of some or all of the Contracting States to conclude special agreements on any matters concerning European patent applications or European patents which under this Convention are subject to and governed by national law, such as, in particular</SPAN></P>
<P class="p840 ft4">(a) an agreement establishing a European patent court common to the Contracting States party to it;</P>
<P class="p233 ft4">(b) an agreement establishing an entity common to the Contracting States party to it to deliver, at the request of national courts or <NOBR>quasi-judicial</NOBR> authorities, opinions on issues of European or harmonised national patent law;</P>
<P class="p892 ft32">(c) an agreement under which the Contracting States party to it dispense fully or in part with translations of European patents under Article 65;</P>
<P class="p320 ft6">(d) an agreement under which the Contracting States party to it provide that translations of European patents as required under Article 65 may be filed with, and published by, the European Patent Office.</P>
<P class="p283 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The Administrative Council shall be competent to decide that:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft7">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">the members of the Boards of Appeal or the Enlarged Board of Appeal may serve on a European patent court or a common entity and take part in proceedings before that court or entity in accordance with any such agreement;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">the European Patent Office shall provide a common entity with such support staff, premises and equipment as may be necessary for the performance of its duties, and the expenses incurred by that entity shall be borne fully or in part by the Organisation.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p782 ft4">301</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_302">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t78">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td255"><P class="p943 ft4">PART X</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td255"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 6</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td255"><P class="p944 ft4">INTERNATIONAL APPLICATIONS UNDER THE PATENT</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td255"><P class="p944 ft8">COOPERATION TREATY – <NOBR>EURO-PCT</NOBR> APPLICATIONS</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr12 td255"><P class="p943 ft26">Article 150</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr12 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td255"><P class="p943 ft7">Application of the Patent Cooperation Treaty</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p737 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The Patent Cooperation Treaty of 19 June 1970, hereinafter referred to as the PCT, shall be applied in accordance with the provisions of this Part.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">International applications filed under the PCT may be the subject of proceedings before the European Patent Office. In such proceedings, the provisions of the PCT and its Regulations shall be applied, supplemented by the provisions of this Convention. In case of conflict, the provisions of the PCT or its Regulations shall prevail.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p764 ft5">Article 151</P>
<P class="p1015 ft4">The European Patent Office as a receiving Office</P>
<P class="p481 ft4">The European Patent Office shall act as a receiving Office within the meaning of the PCT, in accordance with the Implementing Regulations. Article 75, paragraph 2, shall apply.</P>
<P class="p764 ft5">Article 152</P>
<P class="p1016 ft4">The European Patent Office as an International Searching Authority or</P>
<P class="p996 ft4">International Preliminary Examining Authority</P>
<P class="p686 ft6">The European Patent Office shall act as an International Searching Authority and International Preliminary Examining Authority within the meaning of the PCT, in accordance with an agreement between the Organisation and the International Bureau of the World Intellectual Property Organization, for applicants who are residents or nationals of a State party to this Convention. This agreement may provide that the European Patent Office shall also act for other applicants.</P>
<P class="p792 ft5">Article 153</P>
<P class="p1017 ft4">The European Patent Office as designated Office or elected Office</P>
<P class="p5 ft4">(1) The European Patent Office shall be</P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft7">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">a designated Office for any State party to this Convention in respect of which the PCT is in force, which is designated in the international application and for which the applicant wishes to obtain a European patent, and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p840 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">an elected Office, if the applicant has elected a State designated pursuant to letter (a).</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4">(2) An international application for which the European Patent Office is a designated or elected Office, and which has been accorded an international date of filing, shall be equivalent to a regular European application <NOBR>(Euro-PCT</NOBR> application).</P>
<P class="p479 ft4">302</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_303">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t61">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p3 ft8">(3) The international publication of a <NOBR>Euro-PCT</NOBR> application in an official</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td140"><P class="p3 ft13">language of the European Patent Office shall take the place of the</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 6</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft8">publication of the European patent application and shall be mentioned in</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">the European Patent Bulletin.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p728 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">If the </SPAN><NOBR>Euro-PCT</NOBR> application is published in another language, a translation into one of the official languages shall be filed with the European Patent Office, which shall publish it. Subject to Article 67, paragraph 3, the provisional protection under Article 67, paragraphs 1 and 2, shall be effective from the date of that publication.</P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(5)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The </SPAN><NOBR>Euro-PCT</NOBR> application shall be treated as a European patent application and shall be considered as comprised in the state of the art under Article 54, paragraph 3, if the conditions laid down in paragraph 3 or 4 and in the Implementing Regulations are fulfilled.</P>
<P class="p279 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(6)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">The international search report drawn up in respect of a </SPAN><NOBR>Euro-PCT</NOBR> application or the declaration replacing it, and their international publication, shall take the place of the European search report and the mention of its publication in the European Patent Bulletin.</P>
<P class="p320 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(7)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">A supplementary European search report shall be drawn up in respect of any </SPAN><NOBR>Euro-PCT</NOBR> application under paragraph 5. The Administrative Council may decide that the supplementary search report is to be dispensed with or that the search fee is to be reduced.</P>
<P class="p764 ft5">Article 154</P>
<P class="p1018 ft4">The European Patent Office as an International Searching Authority</P>
<P class="p1019 ft4">(deleted)</P>
<P class="p753 ft5">Article 155</P>
<P class="p1020 ft4">The European Patent Office as an International Preliminary Examining</P>
<P class="p580 ft4">Authority (deleted)</P>
<P class="p764 ft5">Article 156</P>
<P class="p1021 ft4">The European Patent Office as an elected Office (deleted)</P>
<P class="p753 ft5">Article 157</P>
<P class="p766 ft4">International search report (deleted)</P>
<P class="p764 ft5">Article 158</P>
<P class="p757 ft4">Publication of the international application and its supply to the</P>
<P class="p769 ft4">European Patent Office (deleted)</P>
<P class="p1022 ft26">PART XI</P>
<P class="p1023 ft8">TRANSITIONAL PROVISIONS (deleted)</P>
<P class="p1024 ft4">303</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_304">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t79">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td263"><P class="p1025 ft26">PART XII</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td263"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 6</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td263"><P class="p1025 ft8">FINAL PROVISIONS</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr11 td263"><P class="p1025 ft26">Article 164</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr11 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td263"><P class="p1025 ft7">Implementing Regulations and Protocols</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p445 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">The Implementing Regulations, the Protocol on Recognition, the Protocol on Privileges and Immunities, the Protocol on Centralisation, the Protocol on the Interpretation of Article 69 and the Protocol on Staff Complement shall be integral parts of this Convention.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">In case of conflict between the provisions of this Convention and those of the Implementing Regulations, the provisions of this Convention shall prevail.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p764 ft5">Article 165</P>
<P class="p818 ft4">Signature – Ratification</P>
<P class="p481 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">This Convention shall be open for signature until 5 April 1974 by the States which took part in the </SPAN><NOBR>Inter-Governmental</NOBR> Conference for the setting up of a European System for the Grant of Patents or were informed of the holding of that conference and offered the option of taking part therein.</P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">This Convention shall be subject to ratification; instruments of ratification shall be deposited with the Government of the Federal Republic of Germany.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p764 ft5">Article 166</P>
<P class="p776 ft4">Accession</P>
<P class="p5 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">This Convention shall be open to accession by:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft4">(a) the States referred to in Article 165, paragraph 1;</P>
<P class="p426 ft4">(b) any other European State at the invitation of the Administrative Council.</P>
<P class="p279 ft8"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft63">Any State which has been a party to the Convention and has ceased to be so as a result of the application of Article 172, paragraph 4, may again become a party to the Convention by acceding to it.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p450 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Instruments of accession shall be deposited with the Government of the Federal Republic of Germany.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p764 ft5">Article 167</P>
<P class="p954 ft4">Reservations (deleted)</P>
<P class="p753 ft5">Article 168</P>
<P class="p912 ft4">Territorial field of application</P>
<P class="p673 ft6">(1) Any Contracting State may declare in its instrument of ratification or accession, or may inform the Government of the Federal Republic of Germany by written notification at any time thereafter, that this Convention shall be applicable to one or more of the territories for the</P>
<P class="p174 ft92">external relations of which it is responsible. European patents granted for</P>
<P class="p390 ft4">304</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_305">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t21">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">that Contracting State shall also have effect in the territories for which</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">such a declaration has taken effect.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft4">Bilaga 6</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p279 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">If the declaration referred to in paragraph 1 is contained in the instrument of ratification or accession, it shall take effect on the same date as the ratification or accession; if the declaration is notified after the deposit of the instrument of ratification or accession, such notification shall take effect six months after the date of its receipt by the Government of the Federal Republic of Germany.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p279 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">Any Contracting State may at any time declare that the Convention shall cease to apply to some or to all of the territories in respect of which it has given notification pursuant to paragraph 1. Such declaration shall take effect one year after the date on which the Government of the Federal Republic of Germany received notification thereof.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p764 ft5">Article 169</P>
<P class="p962 ft4">Entry into force</P>
<P class="p481 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">This Convention shall enter into force three months after the deposit of the last instrument of ratification or accession by six States on whose territory the total number of patent applications filed in 1970 amounted to at least 180 000 for all the said States.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Any ratification or accession after the entry into force of this Convention shall take effect on the first day of the third month after the deposit of the instrument of ratification or accession.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p764 ft5">Article 170</P>
<P class="p1026 ft4">Initial contribution</P>
<P class="p481 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Any State which ratifies or accedes to this Convention after its entry into force shall pay to the Organisation an initial contribution, which shall not be refunded.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p279 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">The initial contribution shall be 5% of an amount calculated by applying the percentage obtained for the State in question, on the date on which ratification or accession takes effect, in accordance with the scale provided for in Article 40, paragraphs 3 and 4, to the sum of the special financial contributions due from the other Contracting States in respect of the accounting periods preceding the date referred to above.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p279 ft32"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft127">In the event that special financial contributions were not required in respect of the accounting period immediately preceding the date referred to in paragraph 2, the scale of contributions referred to in that paragraph shall be the scale that would have been applicable to the State concerned in respect of the last year for which financial contributions were required.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p753 ft5">Article 171</P>
<P class="p1027 ft4">Duration of the Convention</P>
<P class="p5 ft4">The present Convention shall be of unlimited duration.</P>
<P class="p782 ft4">305</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_306">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t80">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td264"><P class="p1028 ft26">Article 172</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td264"><P class="p1028 ft7">Revision</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft4">Bilaga 6</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p682 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">This Convention may be revised by a Conference of the Contracting States.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p320 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">The Conference shall be prepared and convened by the Administrative Council. The Conference shall not be validly constituted unless at least three- quarters of the Contracting States are represented at it. Adoption of the revised required. text shall require a majority of three- quarters of the Contracting States represented and voting at the Conference. Abstentions shall not be considered as votes.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The revised text shall enter into force when it has been ratified or acceded to by the number of Contracting States specified by the Conference, and at the time specified by that Conference.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Such States as have not ratified or acceded to the revised text of the Convention at the time of its entry into force shall cease to be parties to this Convention as from that time.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p764 ft5">Article 173</P>
<P class="p812 ft4">Disputes between Contracting States</P>
<P class="p481 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Any dispute between Contracting States concerning the interpretation or application of the present Convention which is not settled by negotiation shall be submitted, at the request of one of the States concerned, to the Administrative Council, which shall endeavour to bring about agreement between the States</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">If such agreement is not reached within six months from the date when the dispute was referred to the Administrative Council, any one of the States concerned may submit the dispute to the International Court of Justice for a binding decision.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p764 ft5">Article 174</P>
<P class="p947 ft4">Denunciation</P>
<P class="p481 ft4">Any Contracting State may at any time denounce this Convention. Denunciation shall be notified to the Government of the Federal Republic of Germany. It shall take effect one year after the date of receipt of such notification. concerned.</P>
<P class="p764 ft5">Article 175</P>
<P class="p931 ft4">Preservation of acquired rights</P>
<P class="p672 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">In the event of a State ceasing to be party to this Convention in accordance with Article 172, paragraph 4, or Article 174, rights already acquired pursuant to this Convention shall not be impaired.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p320 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">A European patent application which is pending when a designated State ceases to be party to the Convention shall be processed by the European Patent Office, as far as that State is concerned, as if the Convention in force thereafter were applicable to that State.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p499 ft4">306</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_307">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t52">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p3 ft8">(3) Paragraph 2 shall apply to European patents in respect of which, on</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td140"><P class="p3 ft13">the date mentioned in that paragraph, an opposition is pending or the</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 6</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">opposition period has not expired.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p451 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Nothing in this Article shall affect the right of any State that has ceased to be a party to this Convention to treat any European patent in accordance with the text to which it was a party.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p764 ft5">Article 176</P>
<P class="p1029 ft4">Financial rights and obligations of former Contracting States</P>
<P class="p686 ft32"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft127">Any State which has ceased to be a party to this Convention in accordance with Article 172, paragraph 4, or Article 174, shall have the special financial contributions which it has paid pursuant to Article 40, paragraph 2, refunded to it by the Organisation only at the time when and under the conditions whereby the Organisation refunds special financial contributions paid by other States during the same accounting period.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The State referred to in paragraph 1 shall, even after ceasing to be a party to this Convention, continue to pay the proportion pursuant to Article 39 of renewal fees in respect of European patents remaining in force in that State, at the rate current on the date on which it ceased to be a party.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p764 ft5">Article 177</P>
<P class="p1030 ft4">Languages of the Convention</P>
<P class="p672 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">This Convention, drawn up in a single original, in the English, French and German languages, shall be deposited in the archives of the Government of the Federal Republic of Germany, the three texts being equally authentic.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p320 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">The texts of this Convention drawn up in official languages of Contracting States other than those specified in paragraph 1 shall, if they have been approved by the Administrative Council, be considered as official texts. In the event of disagreement on the interpretation of the various texts, the texts referred to in paragraph 1 shall be authentic.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p764 ft5">Article 178</P>
<P class="p1031 ft4">Transmission and notifications</P>
<P class="p481 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The Government of the Federal Republic of Germany shall draw up certified true copies of this Convention and shall transmit them to the Governments of all signatory or acceding States.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The Government of the Federal Republic of Germany shall notify to the Governments of the States referred to in paragraph 1:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p283 ft4">(a) the deposit of any instrument of ratification or accession;</P>
<P class="p174 ft4">(b) any declaration or notification received pursuant to Article 168;</P>
<P class="p426 ft4">(c) any denunciation received pursuant to Article 174 and the date on which such denunciation comes into force.</P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The Government of the Federal Republic of Germany shall register this Convention with the Secretariat of the United Nations.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p499 ft4">307</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_308">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t81">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr8 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">2. Protocol on the Interpretation of Article 69 EPC</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr8 td20"><P class="p3 ft4">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td140"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td20"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 6</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p678 ft26">Article 1</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td20"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft7">General principles</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td20"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr12 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">Article 69 should not be interpreted as meaning that the extent of the</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr12 td20"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">protection conferred by a European patent is to be understood as that</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td20"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">defined by the strict, literal meaning of the wording used in the claims,</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td20"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">the description and drawings being employed only for the purpose of</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td20"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft4">resolving an ambiguity found in the claims. Nor should it be taken to</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td20"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td140"><P class="p679 ft4">mean that the claims serve only as a guideline and that the actual</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td20"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">protection conferred may extend to what, from a consideration of the</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td20"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft4">description and drawings by a person skilled in the art, the patent</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td20"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">proprietor has contemplated. On the contrary, it is to be interpreted as</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td20"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft4">defining a position between these extremes which combines a fair</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td20"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">protection for the patent proprietor with a reasonable degree of legal</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td20"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">certainty for third parties.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td20"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr11 td140"><P class="p678 ft26">Article 2</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr11 td20"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft7">Equivalents</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td20"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr11 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">For the purpose of determining the extent of protection conferred by a</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr11 td20"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">European patent, due account shall be taken of any element which is</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td20"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">equivalent to an element specified in the claims.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td20"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr11 td140"><P class="p678 ft8">3. Protocol on the Staff Complement of the European Patent Office</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr11 td20"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p678 ft8">at The Hague</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td20"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">(Protocol on Staff Complement)</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td20"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr11 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">The European Patent Organisation shall ensure that the proportion of</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr11 td20"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft7">European Patent Office posts assigned to the duty station at The Hague</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td20"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft7">as defined under the 2000 establishment plan and table of posts remains</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td20"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft7">substantially unchanged. Any change in the number of posts assigned to</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td20"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">the duty station at The Hague resulting in a deviation of more than ten</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td20"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td140"><P class="p679 ft4">per cent of that proportion, which proves necessary for the proper</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td20"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">functioning of the European Patent Office, shall be subject to a decision</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td20"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft7">by the Administrative Council of the Organisation on a proposal from the</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td20"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft4">President of the European Patent Office after consultation with the</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td20"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">Governments of the Federal Republic of Germany and the Kingdom of</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td20"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">the Netherlands.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td20"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr12 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">4. Protocol on the Centralisation of the European Patent System and</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr12 td20"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft4">on its Introduction (Protocol on Centralisation)</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td20"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr11 td140"><P class="p679 ft7">Section I</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr11 td20"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr11 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">(1) (a) Upon entry into force of the Convention, States parties thereto</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr11 td20"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td140"><P class="p679 ft7">which are also members of the International Patent Institute set up by the</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td20"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft7">Hague Agreement of 6 June 1947 shall take all necessary steps to ensure</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td20"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft7">the transfer to the European Patent Office, no later than the date referred</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td20"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft4">to in <SPAN class="ft5">Article 162, paragraph 1</SPAN>, of the Convention, of all assets and</P></TD>
	<TD rowspan=2 class="tr30 td20"><P class="p17 ft4">308</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr39 td140"><P class="p3 ft204">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_309">


<DIV>
<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p163 ft4">liabilities and all staff members of the International Patent Institute. Such transfer shall be effected by an agreement between the International Patent Institute and the European Patent Organisation. The above States and the other States parties to the Convention shall take all necessary steps to ensure that that agreement shall be implemented no later than the date referred to in <SPAN class="ft5">Article 162, paragraph 1</SPAN>, of the Convention. Upon implementation of the agreement, those Member States of the International Patent Institute which are also parties to the Convention further undertake to terminate their participation in the Hague Agreement.</P>
<P class="p190 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">The States parties to the Convention shall take all necessary steps to ensure that all the assets and liabilities and all the staff members of the International Patent Institute are taken into the European Patent Office in accordance with the agreement referred to in </SPAN><NOBR>sub-paragraph</NOBR> (a). After the implementation of that agreement the tasks incumbent upon the International Patent Institute at the date on which the Convention is opened for signature, and in particular those carried out <NOBR>vis-à-vis</NOBR> its Member States, whether or not they become parties to the Convention, and such tasks as it has undertaken at the time of the entry into force of the Convention to carry out <NOBR>vis-à-vis</NOBR> States which, at that date, are both members of the International Patent Institute and parties to the Convention, shall be assumed by the European Patent Office. In addition, the Administrative Council of the European Patent Organisation may allocate further duties in the field of searching to the European Patent Office.</P>
<P class="p1032 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">The above obligations shall also apply </SPAN><SPAN class="ft5">mutatis mutandis </SPAN>to the sub- office set up under the Hague Agreement under the conditions set out in the agreement between the International Patent Institute and the Government of the Contracting State concerned. This Government hereby undertakes to make a new agreement with the European Patent Organisation in place of the one already made with the International Patent Institute to harmonise the clauses concerning the organisation, operation and financing of the <NOBR>sub-office</NOBR> with the provisions of this Protocol.</P>
<P class="p336 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Subject to the provisions of Section III, the States parties to the Convention shall, on behalf of their central industrial property offices, renounce in favour of the European Patent Office any activities as International Searching Authorities under the Patent Cooperation Treaty as from the date referred to in Article 162, paragraph 1, of the Convention.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p336 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">(a) A </SPAN><NOBR>sub-office</NOBR> of the European Patent Office shall be set up in Berlin as from the date referred to in Article 162, paragraph 1, of the Convention. It shall operate under the direction of the branch at The Hague.</P>
<P class="p190 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">The Administrative Council shall determine the duties to be allocated to the </SPAN><NOBR>sub-office</NOBR> in Berlin in the light of general considerations and of the requirements of the European Patent Office.</P>
<P class="p81 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft178">At least at the beginning of the period following the progressive expansion of the field of activity of the European Patent Office, the amount of work assigned to that </SPAN><NOBR>sub-office</NOBR> shall be sufficient to enable the examining staff of the Berlin Annex of the German Patent Office, as</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p599 ft17">Prop. 2006/07:56 Bilaga 6</P>
<P class="p636 ft4">309</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_310">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t21">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p3 ft8">it stands at the date on which the Convention is opened for signature, to</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">be fully employed.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft4">Bilaga 6</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The Federal Republic of Germany shall bear any additional costs incurred by the European Patent Organisation in setting up and maintaining the </SPAN><NOBR>sub-office</NOBR> in Berlin.</P>
<P class="p1033 ft4">Section II</P>
<P class="p686 ft6">Subject to the provisions of Sections III and IV, the States parties to the Convention shall, on behalf of their central industrial property offices, renounce in favour of the European Patent Office any activities as International Preliminary Examining Authorities under the Patent Cooperation Treaty. This obligation shall apply only to the extent to which the European Patent Office may examine European patent applications in accordance with <SPAN class="ft33">Article 162, paragraph 2</SPAN>, of the Convention and shall not apply until two years after the date on which the European Patent Office has begun examining activities in the areas of technology concerned, on the basis of a <NOBR>five-year</NOBR> plan which shall progressively extend the activities of the European Patent Office to all areas of technology and which may be amended only by decision of the Administrative Council. The procedures for implementing this obligation shall be determined by decision of the Administrative Council.</P>
<P class="p676 ft4">Section III</P>
<P class="p673 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">The central industrial property office of any State party to the Convention in which the official language is not one of the official languages of the European Patent Office, shall be authorised to act as an International Searching Authority and as an International Preliminary Examining Authority under the Patent Cooperation Treaty. Such authorisation shall be subject to an undertaking by the State concerned to restrict such activities to international applications filed by nationals or residents of such State and by nationals or residents of States parties to the Convention which are adjacent to that State. The Administrative Council may decide to authorise the central industrial property office of any State party to the Convention to extend such activities to cover such international applications as may be filed by nationals or residents of any </SPAN><NOBR>non-Contracting</NOBR> State having the same official language as the Contracting State in question and drawn up in that language.</P>
<P class="p728 ft32"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft127">For the purpose of harmonising search activities under the Patent Cooperation Treaty within the framework of the European system for the grant of patents, </SPAN><NOBR>co-operation</NOBR> shall be established between the European Patent Office and any central industrial property office authorised under this Section. Such co- operation shall be based on a special agreement which may cover e.g. search procedures and methods, qualifications required for the recruitment and training of examiners, guidelines for the exchange of search and other services between the offices as well as other measures needed to establish the required control and supervision.</P>
<P class="p414 ft4">310</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_311">


<DIV>
<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p736 ft4">Section IV</P>
<P class="p483 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft173">(a) For the purpose of facilitating the adaptation of the national patent offices of the States parties to the Convention to the European patent system, the Administrative Council may, if it considers it desirable, and subject to the conditions set out below, entrust the central industrial property offices of such of those States in which it is possible to conduct the proceedings in one of the official languages of the European Patent Office with tasks concerning the examination of European patent applications drawn up in that language which, pursuant to Article 18, paragraph 2, of the Convention, shall, as a general rule, be entrusted to a member of the Examining Division. Such tasks shall be carried out within the framework of the proceedings for grant laid down in the Convention; decisions on such applications shall be taken by the Examining Division composed in accordance with Article 18, paragraph 2.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p304 ft32">(b) Tasks entrusted under sub- paragraph (a) shall not be in respect of more than 40% of the total number of European patent applications filed; tasks entrusted to any one State shall not be in respect of more than one- third of the total number of European patent applications filed. These tasks shall be entrusted for a period of 15 years from the opening of the European Patent Office and shall be reduced progressively (in principle by 20% a year) to zero during the last 5 years of the period.</P>
<P class="p105 ft4">(c) The Administrative Council shall decide, while taking into account the provisions of <NOBR>sub-paragraph</NOBR> (b), upon the nature, origin and number of the European patent applications in respect of which examining tasks may be entrusted to the central industrial property office of each of the Contracting States mentioned above.</P>
<P class="p493 ft6">(d) The above implementing procedures shall be set out in a special agreement between the central industrial property office of the Contracting State concerned and the European Patent Organisation.</P>
<P class="p493 ft8">(e) An office with which such a special agreement has been concluded may act as an International Preliminary Examining Authority under the Patent Cooperation Treaty, until the expiry of the period of 15 years.</P>
<P class="p264 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft173">(a) If the Administrative Council considers that it is compatible with the proper functioning of the European Patent Office, and in order to alleviate the difficulties which may arise for certain Contracting States from the application of Section I, paragraph 2, it may entrust searching in respect of European patent applications to the central industrial property offices of those States in which the official language is one of the official languages of the European Patent Office, provided that these offices possess the necessary qualifications for appointment as an International Searching Authority in accordance with the conditions laid down in the Patent Cooperation Treaty.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p845 ft4">(b) In carrying out such work, undertaken under the responsibility of the European Patent Office, the central industrial property offices concerned shall adhere to the guidelines applicable to the drawing up of the European search report.</P>
<P class="p267 ft4">(c) The provisions of paragraph 1(b), second sentence, and sub- paragraph (d)of this Section shall apply to this paragraph.</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p515 ft17">Prop. 2006/07:56 Bilaga 6</P>
<P class="p636 ft4">311</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_312">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t82">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td265"><P class="p3 ft4">Section V</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td265"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft4">Bilaga 6</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The </SPAN><NOBR>sub-office</NOBR> referred to in Section I, paragraph 1(c), shall be authorised to carry out searches, among the documentation which is at its disposal and which is in the official language of the State in which the <NOBR>sub-office</NOBR> is located, in respect of European patent applications filed by nationals and residents of that State. This authorisation shall be on the understanding that the procedure for the grant of European patents will not be delayed and that additional costs will not be incurred for the European Patent Organisation.</P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The </SPAN><NOBR>sub-office</NOBR> referred to in paragraph 1 shall be authorised to carry out, at the option of an applicant for a European patent and at his expense, a search on his patent application among the documentation referred to in paragraph 1. This authorisation shall be effective until the search provided for in Article 92 of the Convention has been extended, in accordance with Section VI, to cover such documentation and shall be on the understanding that the procedure for the grant of European patents will not be delayed.</P>
<P class="p451 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The Administrative Council may also extend the authorisations provided for in paragraphs 1 and 2, under the conditions of those paragraphs, to the central industrial property office of a Contracting State which does not have as an official language one of the official languages of the European Patent Office.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1034 ft4">Section VI</P>
<P class="p481 ft4">The search provided for in Article 92 of the Convention shall, in principle, be extended, in respect of all European patent applications, to published patents, published patent applications and other relevant documents of Contracting States not included in the search documentation of the European Patent Office on the date referred to in Article 162, paragraph 1, of the Convention. The extent, conditions and timing of any such extension shall be determined by the Administrative Council on the basis of a study concerning particularly the technical and financial aspects.</P>
<P class="p1035 ft4">Section VII</P>
<P class="p481 ft4">The provisions of this Protocol shall prevail over any contradictory provisions of the Convention.</P>
<P class="p973 ft4">Section VIII</P>
<P class="p672 ft4">The decisions of the Administrative Council provided for in this Protocol shall require a <NOBR>three-quarters</NOBR> majority (Article 35, paragraph 2, of the Convention). The provisions governing the weighting of votes (Article 36 of the Convention) shall apply.</P>
<P class="p782 ft4">312</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_313">


<DIV id="id_1">
<DIV id="id_1_1">
<P class="p1036 ft1">Tillämpningsföreskrifter till den europeiska patentkonventionen i lydelse enligt förvaltningsrådets beslut den 7 december 2006</P>
<P class="p1037 ft4">PART I</P>
<P class="p1038 ft4">IMPLEMENTING REGULATIONS TO PART I OF THE</P>
<P class="p778 ft4">CONVENTION</P>
<P class="p1039 ft4">Chapter I</P>
<P class="p1040 ft4">General provisions</P>
<P class="p1041 ft5">Rule 1</P>
<P class="p1042 ft4">Written proceedings</P>
<P class="p504 ft4">In written proceedings before the European Patent Office, the requirement to use the written form shall be satisfied if the content of the documents can be reproduced in a legible form on paper.</P>
<P class="p1041 ft5">Rule 2</P>
<P class="p829 ft4">Filing of and formal requirements for</P>
<P class="p736 ft4">documents</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_1_2">
<P class="p71 ft17">Prop. 2006/07:56 Bilaga 7</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">In proceedings before the European Patent Office, documents may be filed by delivery by hand, by post or by technical means of communication. The President of the European Patent Office shall lay down the details and conditions and, where appropriate, any special formal or technical requirements for the filing of documents. In particular, he may specify that confirmation must be supplied. If such confirmation is not supplied in due time, the European patent application shall be refused; documents filed subsequently shall be deemed not to have been received.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p728 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft178">Where the Convention provides that a document must be signed, the authenticity of the document may be confirmed by handwritten signature or other appropriate means the use of which has been permitted by the President of the European Patent Office. A document authenticated by such other means shall be deemed to meet the legal requirements of signature in the same way as a document bearing a handwritten signature which has been filed in paper form.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1043 ft5">Rule 3</P>
<P class="p895 ft4">Language in written proceedings</P>
<P class="p672 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">In written proceedings before the European Patent Office, any party may use any official language of the European Patent Office. The translation referred to in Article 14, paragraph 4, may be filed in any official language of the European Patent Office.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p479 ft4">313</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_314">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t21">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">(2) Amendments to a European patent application or European patent</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">shall be filed in the language of the proceedings.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft4">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p279 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">Documentary evidence and, in particular, publications may be filed in any language. The European Patent Office may, however, require that a translation in one of its official languages be filed, within a period to be specified. If a required translation is not filed in due time, the European Patent Office may disregard the document in question.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1043 ft5">Rule 4</P>
<P class="p1030 ft4">Language in oral proceedings</P>
<P class="p686 ft32"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft127">Any party to oral proceedings before the European Patent Office may use an official language of the European Patent Office other than the language of the proceedings, if such party gives notice to the European Patent Office at least one month before the date of such oral proceedings or provides for interpretation into the language of the proceedings. Any party may use an official language of a Contracting State, if he provides for interpretation into the language of the proceedings. The European Patent Office may permit derogations from these provisions.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">In the course of oral proceedings, employees of the European Patent Office may use an official language of the European Patent Office other than the language of the proceedings.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p320 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">Where evidence is taken, any party, witness or expert to be heard who is unable to express himself adequately in an official language of the European Patent Office or of a Contracting State may use another language. Where evidence is taken upon request of a party, parties, witnesses or experts expressing themselves in a language other than an official language of the European Patent Office shall be heard only if that party provides for interpretation into the language of the proceedings. The European Patent Office may, however, permit interpretation into one of its other official languages.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p889 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">If the parties and the European Patent Office agree, any language may be used.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(5)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft35">The European Patent Office shall, if necessary, provide at its own expense interpretation into the language of the proceedings, or, where appropriate, into its other official languages, unless such interpretation is the responsibility of one of the parties.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(6)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft87">Statements by employees of the European Patent Office, parties, witnesses or experts, made in an official language of the European Patent Office, shall be entered in the minutes in that language. Statements made in any other language shall be entered in the official language into which they are translated. Amendments to a European patent application or European patent shall be entered in the minutes in the language of the proceedings.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1043 ft5">Rule 5</P>
<P class="p111 ft4">Certification of translations</P>
<P class="p731 ft8">Where the translation of a document is required, the European Patent Office may require that a certificate that the translation corresponds to</P>
<P class="p174 ft92">the original text be filed within a period to be specified. If the certificate</P>
<P class="p390 ft4">314</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_315">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t11">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p679 ft7">is not filed in due time, such document shall be deemed not to have been</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td140"><P class="p3 ft13">filed, unless otherwise provided.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr12 td140"><P class="p679 ft26">Rule 6</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr12 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft7">Filing of translations and reduction of fees</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p680 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">A translation under Article 14, paragraph 2, shall be filed within two months of filing the European patent application.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">A translation under Article 14, paragraph 4, shall be filed within one month of filing the document. This shall also apply to requests under Article 105a. Where the document is a notice of opposition or appeal, or a statement of grounds of appeal, or a petition for review, the translation may be filed within the period for filing such a notice or statement or petition, if that period expires later.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft153">Where a person referred to in Article 14, paragraph 4, files a European patent application, a request for examination, an opposition, an appeal, a petition for review or a request for limitation or revocation in a language admitted in that provision, the filing fee, examination fee, opposition fee, appeal fee, fee for the petition for review or the limitation or revocation fee shall be reduced in accordance with the Rules relating to Fees.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1043 ft5">Rule 7</P>
<P class="p1016 ft4">Legal authenticity of the translation of the European patent application</P>
<P class="p673 ft4">Unless evidence is provided to the contrary, the European Patent Office shall assume, for the purpose of determining whether the <NOBR>subject-matter</NOBR> of the European patent application or European patent extends beyond the content of the application as filed, that the translation filed under Article 14, paragraph 2, or Rule 40, paragraph 3, is in conformity with the original text of the application.</P>
<P class="p1044 ft4">Chapter II</P>
<P class="p1045 ft4">Organisation of the European Patent Office</P>
<P class="p975 ft4">Section 1</P>
<P class="p1046 ft4">General matters</P>
<P class="p1047 ft5">Rule 8</P>
<P class="p1048 ft4">Patent classification</P>
<P class="p481 ft4">The European Patent Office shall use the classification referred to in Article 1 of the Strasbourg Agreement concerning the International Patent Classification of 24 March 1971, hereinafter referred to as the international classification.</P>
<P class="p1049 ft4">315</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_316">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t83">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td266"><P class="p1050 ft26">Rule 9</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td266"><P class="p1050 ft7">Administrative structure of the European Patent Office</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft4">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p672 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft37">The European Patent Office shall be divided administratively into </SPAN><NOBR>Directorates-General,</NOBR> to which the departments specified in Article 15, and the services set up to deal with legal matters and the internal administration of the Office, shall be assigned.</P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">Each </SPAN><NOBR>Directorate-General</NOBR> shall be directed by a <NOBR>Vice-President.</NOBR> The assignment of a <NOBR>Vice-President</NOBR> to a <NOBR>Directorate-General</NOBR> shall be decided by the Administrative Council, after the President of the European Patent Office has been consulted.</P>
<P class="p884 ft5">Rule 10</P>
<P class="p1051 ft4">Responsibility of the Receiving Section and the Examining Division</P>
<P class="p481 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft35">The Receiving Section shall be responsible for the examination on filing and the examination as to formal requirements of a European patent application up to the time when the Examining Division becomes responsible for the examination of the European patent application under Article 94, paragraph 1.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft87">Subject to paragraphs 3 and 4, the Examining Division shall be responsible for the examination of a European patent application under Article 94, paragraph 1, from the time when a request for examination is filed.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p279 ft17"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft203">If a request for examination is filed before the European search report has been transmitted to the applicant, the Examining Division shall, subject to paragraph 4, be responsible from the time when the European Patent Office receives the indication under Rule 70, paragraph 2.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p379 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">If a request for examination is filed before the European search report has been transmitted to the applicant, and if the applicant has waived the right under Rule 70, paragraph 2, the Examining Division shall be responsible from the time when the search report is transmitted to the applicant.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p884 ft5">Rule 11</P>
<P class="p746 ft4">Allocation of duties to the departments of first instance</P>
<P class="p673 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft86">Technically qualified examiners acting as members of Search, Examining or Opposition Divisions shall be assigned to Directorates. The President of the European Patent Office shall allocate duties to these Directorates by reference to the international classification.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft37">The President of the European Patent Office may allocate further duties to the Receiving Section, the Search, Examining and Opposition Divisions, and the Legal Division, in addition to the responsibilities vested in them under the Convention.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft175">The President of the European Patent Office may entrust to employees who are not technically or legally qualified examiners the execution of duties falling to the Search, Examining or Opposition Divisions and involving no technical or legal difficulties.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p472 ft4">316</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_317">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t84">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td267"><P class="p3 ft4">Section 2</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td267"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft4">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p547 ft4">Organisation of the Boards of Appeal and the Enlarged Board of</P>
<P class="p1052 ft4">Appeal</P>
<P class="p884 ft5">Rule 12</P>
<P class="p1053 ft4">Presidium of the Boards of Appeal</P>
<P class="p686 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">The autonomous authority within the organisational unit comprising the Boards of Appeal (the "Presidium of the Boards of Appeal") shall consist of the </SPAN><NOBR>Vice-President</NOBR> in charge of the Boards of Appeal, who shall act as chairman, and twelve members of the Boards of Appeal, six being Chairmen and six being other members.</P>
<P class="p279 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft178">All members of the Presidium shall be elected by the Chairmen and members of the Boards of Appeal for two working years. If the full composition of the Presidium cannot be reached, the vacancies shall be filled by designating the most senior Chairmen and members.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p320 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft189">The Presidium shall adopt the Rules of Procedure of the Boards of Appeal and the Rules of Procedure for the election and designation of its members. The Presidium shall further advise the </SPAN><NOBR>Vice-President</NOBR> in charge of the Boards of Appeal with regard to matters concerning the functioning of the Boards of Appeal in general.</P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">Before the beginning of each working year, the Presidium, extended to include all Chairmen, shall allocate duties to the Boards of Appeal. In the same composition, it shall decide on conflicts regarding the allocation of duties between two or more Boards of Appeal. The extended Presidium shall designate the regular and alternate members of the various Boards of Appeal. Any member of a Board of Appeal may be designated as a member of more than one Board of Appeal. These measures may, where necessary, be amended during the course of the working year in question.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p728 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(5)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">The Presidium may only take a decision if at least five of its members are present; these must include the </SPAN><NOBR>Vice-President</NOBR> in charge of the Boards of Appeal or his deputy, and the Chairmen of two Boards of Appeal. Where the tasks mentioned in paragraph 4 are concerned, nine members must be present, including the <NOBR>Vice-President</NOBR> in charge of the Boards of Appeal or his deputy, and the Chairmen of three Boards of Appeal. Decisions shall be taken by a majority vote; in the event of parity of votes, the Chairman or his deputy shall have the casting vote. Abstentions shall not be considered as votes.</P>
<P class="p840 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(6)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">The Administrative Council may allocate duties under Article 134a, paragraph 1(c), to the Boards of Appeal.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p884 ft5">Rule 13</P>
<P class="p1054 ft4">Business distribution scheme for the Enlarged Board of Appeal and</P>
<P class="p941 ft4">adoption of its Rules of Procedure</P>
<P class="p686 ft32">(1) Before the beginning of each working year, the members of the Enlarged Board of Appeal appointed under Article 11, paragraph 3, shall designate the regular and alternate members of the Enlarged Board of</P>
<P class="p174 ft135">Appeal in proceedings under Article 22, paragraph 1(a) and (b), and the</P>
<P class="p390 ft4">317</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_318">


<DIV>
<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p393 ft4">regular and alternate members in proceedings under Article 22, paragraph 1(c).</P>
<P class="p138 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft87">The members of the Enlarged Board of Appeal appointed under Article 11, paragraph 3, shall adopt the Rules of Procedure of the Enlarged Board of Appeal.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p138 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">Decisions on matters mentioned in paragraphs 1 and 2 may only be taken if at least five members are present, including the Chairman of the Enlarged Board of Appeal or his deputy; in the event of parity of votes, the Chairman or his deputy shall have the casting vote. Abstentions shall not be considered as votes.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1039 ft4">PART II</P>
<P class="p1055 ft4">IMPLEMENTING REGULATIONS TO PART II OF THE</P>
<P class="p778 ft4">CONVENTION</P>
<P class="p1056 ft4">Chapter I</P>
<P class="p1057 ft4">Procedure where the applicant is not entitled</P>
<P class="p1058 ft5">Rule 14</P>
<P class="p747 ft4">Stay of proceedings</P>
<P class="p483 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft178">If a third party provides evidence that he has instituted proceedings against the applicant seeking a decision within the meaning of Article 61, paragraph 1, the proceedings for grant shall be stayed unless the third party communicates to the European Patent Office in writing his consent to the continuation of such proceedings. Such consent shall be irrevocable. However, proceedings for grant shall not be stayed before the publication of the European patent application.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p304 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft178">Where evidence is provided that a final decision within the meaning of Article 61, paragraph 1, has been taken, the European Patent Office shall inform the applicant and any other party that the proceedings for grant shall be resumed as from the date stated in the communication, unless a new European patent application under Article 61, paragraph 1(b), has been filed for all the designated Contracting States. If the decision is in favour of the third party, the proceedings may not be resumed earlier than three months after the decision has become final, unless the third party requests the resumption.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p493 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft189">Upon staying the proceedings for grant, or thereafter, the European Patent Office may set a date on which it intends to resume the proceedings for grant, regardless of the stage reached in the national proceedings instituted under paragraph 1. It shall communicate this date to the third party, the applicant and any other party. If no evidence has been provided by that date that a final decision has been taken, the European Patent Office may resume proceedings.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p493 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">All periods other than those for the payment of renewal fees, running at the date of the stay of proceedings, shall be interrupted by such stay. The time which has not yet elapsed shall begin to run from the date on which proceedings are resumed. However, the time still to run after such resumption shall not be less than two months.</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p515 ft17">Prop. 2006/07:56 Bilaga 7</P>
<P class="p516 ft4">318</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_319">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t11">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p679 ft26">Rule 15</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">Limitation on withdrawals</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr11 td140"><P class="p679 ft4">From the date on which a third party provides evidence that he has</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr11 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td140"><P class="p679 ft7">instituted national proceedings under Rule 14, paragraph 1, and up to the</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft4">date on which the proceedings for grant are resumed, neither the</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft7">European patent application nor the designation of any Contracting State</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">may be withdrawn.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr12 td140"><P class="p679 ft26">Rule 16</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr12 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p678 ft7">Procedure under Article 61, paragraph 1</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p680 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft35">A person entitled to the grant of a European patent may only avail himself of the remedies under Article 61, paragraph 1, if:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4">(a) he does so no later than three months after the decision recognising his entitlement has become final, and</P>
<P class="p174 ft4">(b) the European patent has not yet been granted.</P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft87">Such remedies shall only apply in respect of Contracting States designated in the European patent application in which the decision has been taken or recognised or must be recognised on the basis of the Protocol on Recognition.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p884 ft5">Rule 17</P>
<P class="p1059 ft4">Filing of a new European patent application by the entitled person</P>
<P class="p672 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft35">Where the person adjudged by a final decision to be entitled to the grant of the European patent files a new European patent application under Article 61, paragraph 1(b), the original application shall be deemed to be withdrawn on the date of filing the new application for the Contracting States designated therein in which the decision has been taken or recognised or must be recognised on the basis of the Protocol on Recognition.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The filing fee and search fee shall be paid within one month of filing the new application. If the filing fee or search fee is not paid in due time, the application shall be deemed to be withdrawn.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">The designation fees shall be paid within six months of the date on which the European Patent Bulletin mentions the publication of the European search report drawn up in respect of the new application. Rule 39, paragraphs 2 and 3, shall apply.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p884 ft5">Rule 18</P>
<P class="p1060 ft4">Partial transfer of the right to the European patent</P>
<P class="p672 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">If a final decision determines that a third party is entitled to the grant of a European patent in respect of only part of the </SPAN><NOBR>subject-matter</NOBR> disclosed in the original European patent application, Article 61 and Rules 16 and 17 shall apply to such part.</P>
<P class="p320 ft32"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft205">Where appropriate, the original European patent application shall contain, for the designated Contracting States in which the decision was taken or recognised or must be recognised on the basis of the Protocol on</SPAN></P>
<P class="p518 ft4">319</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_320">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t52">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p3 ft8">Recognition, claims, a description and drawings which are different from</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td140"><P class="p3 ft13">those for the other designated Contracting States.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr11 td140"><P class="p1002 ft4">Chapter II</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr11 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p1061 ft5">Mention of the inventor</P>
<P class="p886 ft5">Rule 19</P>
<P class="p111 ft4">Designation of the inventor</P>
<P class="p686 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft188">The request for grant of a European patent shall contain the designation of the inventor. However, if the applicant is not the inventor or is not the sole inventor, the designation shall be filed in a separate document. The designation shall state the family name, given names and full address of the inventor, contain the statement referred to in Article 81 and bear the signature of the applicant or his representative.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p840 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft87">The European Patent Office shall not verify the accuracy of the designation of the inventor.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p279 ft8"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft67">If the applicant is not the inventor or is not the sole inventor, the European Patent Office shall communicate to the designated inventor the information in the document designating him and the following data:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p358 ft4">(a) the number of the European patent application;</P>
<P class="p233 ft4">(b) the date of filing of the European patent application and, if priority has been claimed, the date, State and file number of the previous application;</P>
<P class="p283 ft4">(c) the name of the applicant;</P>
<P class="p174 ft4">(d) the title of the invention;</P>
<P class="p174 ft4">(e) the Contracting States designated.</P>
<P class="p837 ft8"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft67">The applicant and the inventor may invoke neither the omission of the communication under paragraph 3 nor any errors contained therein.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1062 ft5">Rule 20</P>
<P class="p1063 ft4">Publication of the mention of the inventor</P>
<P class="p481 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft175">The designated inventor shall be mentioned in the published European patent application and the European patent specification, unless he informs the European Patent Office in writing that he has waived his right to be thus mentioned.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">Paragraph 1 shall apply where a third party files with the European Patent Office a final decision determining that the applicant for or proprietor of a European patent is required to designate him as an inventor.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p884 ft5">Rule 21</P>
<P class="p1064 ft4">Rectification of the designation of an inventor</P>
<P class="p686 ft32"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft127">An incorrect designation of an inventor shall be rectified upon request and only with the consent of the wrongly designated person and, where such a request is filed by a third party, the consent of the applicant for or proprietor of the patent. Rule 19 shall apply </SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">mutatis mutandis</SPAN>.</P>
<P class="p518 ft4">320</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_321">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t52">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p3 ft8">(2) Where an incorrect designation of the inventor has been recorded in</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td140"><P class="p3 ft13">the European Patent Register or published in the European Patent</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">Bulletin, its rectification or cancellation shall also be recorded or</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">published therein.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr12 td140"><P class="p1065 ft4">Chapter III</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr12 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p1066 ft4">Registration of transfers, licences and other rights</P>
<P class="p886 ft5">Rule 22</P>
<P class="p880 ft4">Registration of transfers</P>
<P class="p673 ft8"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft63">The transfer of a European patent application shall be recorded in the European Patent Register at the request of an interested party, upon production of documents providing evidence of such transfer.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p379 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft86">The request shall not be deemed to have been filed until an administrative fee has been paid. It may be rejected only if paragraph 1 has not been complied with.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">A transfer shall have effect </SPAN><NOBR>vis-à-vis</NOBR> the European Patent Office only at the date when and to the extent that the documents referred to in paragraph 1 have been produced.</P>
<P class="p886 ft5">Rule 23</P>
<P class="p685 ft4">Registration of licences and other rights</P>
<P class="p673 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft37">Rule 22, paragraphs 1 and 2, shall apply </SPAN><SPAN class="ft5">mutatis mutandis </SPAN>to the registration of the grant or transfer of a licence, the establishment or transfer of a right <SPAN class="ft5">in rem </SPAN>in respect of a European patent application and any legal means of execution affecting such an application.</P>
<P class="p320 ft8"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft186">A registration under paragraph 1 shall be cancelled upon request, supported by documents providing evidence that the right has lapsed, or by the written consent of the proprietor of the right to the cancellation of the registration. Rule 22, paragraph 2, shall apply </SPAN><SPAN class="ft26">mutatis mutandis</SPAN>.</P>
<P class="p1067 ft5">Rule 24</P>
<P class="p1068 ft4">Special entries for licence registrations</P>
<P class="p480 ft4">A licence in respect of a European patent application shall be recorded</P>
<P class="p174 ft4"><SPAN class="ft7">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft18">as an exclusive licence if the applicant and the licensee so request;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft35">as a </SPAN><NOBR>sub-licence</NOBR> where it is granted by a licensee whose licence is recorded in the European Patent Register.</P>
<P class="p1069 ft4">321</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_322">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t85">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td268"><P class="p1070 ft8">Chapter IV</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td268"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td268"><P class="p1070 ft4">Certificate of exhibition</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr12 td268"><P class="p1070 ft26">Rule 25</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr12 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td268"><P class="p990 ft8">Certificate of exhibition</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p737 ft4">Within four months of filing the European patent application, the applicant shall file the certificate referred to in Article 55, paragraph 2, which:</P>
