<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft7">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft153">is issued at the exhibition by the authority responsible for the protection of industrial property at that exhibition;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p283 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft18">states that the invention was in fact displayed there;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">states the opening date of the exhibition and, where the invention was disclosed later than on that date, the date on which the invention was first disclosed; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft38">is accompanied by an identification of the invention, duly authenticated by the </SPAN><NOBR>above-mentioned</NOBR> authority.</P>
<P class="p1071 ft4">Chapter V</P>
<P class="p1072 ft4">Biotechnological inventions</P>
<P class="p886 ft5">Rule 26</P>
<P class="p918 ft4">General and definitions</P>
<P class="p481 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft174">For European patent applications and patents concerning biotechnological inventions, the relevant provisions of the Convention shall be applied and interpreted in accordance with the provisions of this Chapter. Directive 98/44/EC of 6 July 1998 on the legal protection of biotechnological inventions shall be used as a supplementary means of interpretation.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1073 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft199">"Biotechnological inventions" are inventions which concern a product consisting of or containing biological material or a process by means of which biological material is produced, processed or used.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft38">"Biological material" means any material containing genetic information and capable of reproducing itself or being reproduced in a biological system.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p279 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft189">"Plant variety" means any plant grouping within a single botanical taxon of the lowest known rank, which grouping, irrespective of whether the conditions for the grant of a plant variety right are fully met, can be:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4">(a) defined by the expression of the characteristics that results from a given genotype or combination of genotypes,</P>
<P class="p840 ft4">(b) distinguished from any other plant grouping by the expression of at least one of the said characteristics, and</P>
<P class="p1074 ft4">(c) considered as a unit with regard to its suitability for being propagated unchanged.</P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(5)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft87">A process for the production of plants or animals is essentially biological if it consists entirely of natural phenomena such as crossing or selection.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p716 ft4">322</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_323">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t11">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p679 ft7">(6) "Microbiological process" means any process involving or performed</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td140"><P class="p3 ft13">upon or resulting in microbiological material.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr12 td140"><P class="p679 ft26">Rule 27</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr12 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p678 ft7">Patentable biotechnological inventions</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p697 ft4">Biotechnological inventions shall also be patentable if they concern:</P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft7">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">biological material which is isolated from its natural environment or produced by means of a technical process even if it previously occurred in nature;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft35">plants or animals if the technical feasibility of the invention is not confined to a particular plant or animal variety;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p892 ft8"><SPAN class="ft8">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft63">a microbiological or other technical process, or a product obtained by means of such a process other than a plant or animal variety.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1075 ft5">Rule 28</P>
<P class="p130 ft4">Exceptions to patentability</P>
<P class="p731 ft8">Under Article 53(a), European patents shall not be granted in respect of biotechnological inventions which, in particular, concern the following:</P>
<P class="p38 ft4"><SPAN class="ft7">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft18">processes for cloning human beings;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft87">processes for modifying the germ line genetic identity of human beings;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft18">uses of human embryos for industrial or commercial purposes;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p279 ft8"><SPAN class="ft8">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft186">processes for modifying the genetic identity of animals which are likely to cause them suffering without any substantial medical benefit to man or animal, and also animals resulting from such processes.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1062 ft5">Rule 29</P>
<P class="p736 ft4">The human body and its elements</P>
<P class="p672 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft86">The human body, at the various stages of its formation and development, and the simple discovery of one of its elements, including the sequence or partial sequence of a gene, cannot constitute patentable inventions.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p320 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">An element isolated from the human body or otherwise produced by means of a technical process, including the sequence or partial sequence of a gene, may constitute a patentable invention, even if the structure of that element is identical to that of a natural element.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p840 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft35">The industrial application of a sequence or a partial sequence of a gene must be disclosed in the patent application.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p884 ft5">Rule 30</P>
<P class="p1076 ft4">Requirements of European patent applications relating to nucleotide and</P>
<P class="p972 ft4">amino acid sequences</P>
<P class="p686 ft32">(1) If nucleotide or amino acid sequences are disclosed in the European patent application, the description shall contain a sequence listing conforming to the rules laid down by the President of the European Patent Office for the standardised representation of nucleotide and amino</P>
<P class="p174 ft135">acid sequences.</P>
<P class="p390 ft4">323</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_324">


<DIV>
<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p393 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">A sequence listing filed after the date of filing shall not form part of the description.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p138 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">Where the applicant has not filed a sequence listing complying with the requirements under paragraph 1 at the date of filing, the European Patent Office shall invite the applicant to furnish such a sequence listing and pay the late furnishing fee. If the applicant does not furnish the required sequence listing and pay the required late furnishing fee within a period of two months after such an invitation, the application shall be refused.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1058 ft5">Rule 31</P>
<P class="p1077 ft4">Deposit of biological material</P>
<P class="p506 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft189">If an invention involves the use of or concerns biological material which is not available to the public and which cannot be described in the European patent application in such a manner as to enable the invention to be carried out by a person skilled in the art, the invention shall only be regarded as being disclosed as prescribed in Article 83 if:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p105 ft4">(a) a sample of the biological material has been deposited with a recognised depositary institution on the same terms as those laid down in the Budapest Treaty on the International Recognition of the Deposit of Microorganisms for the Purposes of Patent Procedure of 28 April 1977 not later than the date of filing of the application;</P>
<P class="p898 ft32">(b) the application as filed gives such relevant information as is available to the applicant on the characteristics of the biological material;</P>
<P class="p267 ft4">(c) the depositary institution and the accession number of the deposited biological material are stated in the application, and</P>
<P class="p263 ft6">(d) where the biological material has been deposited by a person other than the applicant, the name and address of the depositor are stated in the application and a document is submitted to the European Patent Office providing evidence that the depositor has authorised the applicant to refer to the deposited biological material in the application and has given his unreserved and irrevocable consent to the deposited material being made available to the public in accordance with Rule 33.</P>
<P class="p267 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft153">The information referred to in paragraph 1(c) and (d) may be submitted</SPAN></P>
<P class="p105 ft4">(a) within sixteen months after the date of filing of the application or, if priority has been claimed, after the priority date, this period being deemed to have been observed if the information is communicated before completion of the technical preparations for publication of the European patent application;</P>
<P class="p393 ft4">(b) up to the date of submission of a request under Article 93, paragraph 1(b);</P>
<P class="p105 ft4">(c) within one month after the European Patent Office has communicated to the applicant that the right to inspect the files under Article 128, paragraph 2, exists.</P>
<P class="p138 ft4">The ruling period shall be the one which is the first to expire. The communication of this information shall be considered as constituting the unreserved and irrevocable consent of the applicant to the deposited biological material being made available to the public in accordance with Rule 33.</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p515 ft17">Prop. 2006/07:56 Bilaga 7</P>
<P class="p516 ft4">324</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_325">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t86">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td269"><P class="p1078 ft26">Rule 32</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td269"><P class="p1079 ft8">Expert solution</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft4">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p672 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">Until completion of the technical preparations for publication of the European patent application, the applicant may inform the European Patent Office that,</SPAN></P>
<P class="p840 ft4">(a) until the publication of the mention of the grant of the European patent or, where applicable,</P>
<P class="p233 ft4">(b) for twenty years from the date of filing, if the application is refused or withdrawn or deemed to be withdrawn, the availability referred to in Rule 33 shall be effected only by the issue of a sample to an expert nominated by the requester.</P>
<P class="p283 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft18">The following may be nominated as an expert:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft7">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft37">any natural person, provided that the requester furnishes evidence, when filing the request, that the nomination has the approval of the applicant;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft35">any natural person recognised as an expert by the President of the European Patent Office.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4">The nomination shall be accompanied by a declaration from the expert <NOBR>vis-à-vis</NOBR> the applicant in which he enters into the undertaking given under Rule 33 until either the date on which the patent expires in all the designated States or, where the application is refused, withdrawn or deemed to be withdrawn, the date referred to in paragraph 1(b), the requester being regarded as a third party.</P>
<P class="p884 ft5">Rule 33</P>
<P class="p905 ft4">Availability of biological material</P>
<P class="p686 ft4">(1) Biological material deposited in accordance with Rule 31 shall be available upon request to any person from the date of publication of the European patent application and to any person having the right to inspect the files under Article 128, paragraph 2, prior to that date. Subject to Rule 32, such availability shall be effected by the issue of a sample of the biological material to the person making the request (hereinafter referred to as "the requester").</P>
<P class="p279 ft4">(2) Said issue shall be made only if the requester has undertaken <NOBR>vis-à-vis</NOBR> the applicant for or proprietor of the patent not to make the biological material or any biological material derived there from available to any third party and to use that material for experimental purposes only, until such time as the patent application is refused or withdrawn or deemed to be withdrawn, or before the European patent has expired in all the designated States, unless the applicant for or proprietor of the patent expressly waives such an undertaking.</P>
<P class="p451 ft4">The undertaking to use the biological material for experimental purposes only shall not apply in so far as the requester is using that material under a compulsory licence. The term "compulsory licence" shall be construed as including ex officio licences and the right to use patented inventions in the public interest.</P>
<P class="p279 ft8">(3) For the purposes of paragraph 2, derived biological material shall mean any material which still exhibits those characteristics of the</P>
<P class="p174 ft92">deposited material which are essential to carrying out the invention. The</P>
<P class="p390 ft4">325</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_326">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t21">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p3 ft8">undertaking under paragraph 2 shall not impede any deposit of derived</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">biological material necessary for the purpose of patent procedure.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft4">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft87">The request referred to in paragraph 1 shall be submitted to the European Patent Office on a form recognised by that Office. The European Patent Office shall certify on the form that a European patent application referring to the deposit of the biological material has been filed, and that the requester or the expert nominated by him under Rule 32 is entitled to the issue of a sample of that material. After grant of the European patent, the request shall also be submitted to the European Patent Office.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(5)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The European Patent Office shall transmit a copy of the request, with the certification provided for in paragraph 4, to the depositary institution and to the applicant for or the proprietor of the patent.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(6)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft35">The European Patent Office shall publish in its Official Journal the list of depositary institutions and experts recognised for the purpose of Rules 31 to 34.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p886 ft5">Rule 34</P>
<P class="p1080 ft4">New deposit of biological material</P>
<P class="p686 ft32">If biological material deposited in accordance with Rule 31 ceases to be available from the recognised depositary institution, an interruption in availability shall be deemed not to have occurred if a new deposit of that material is made with a recognised depositary institution on the same terms as those laid down in the Budapest Treaty on the International Recognition of the Deposit of Microorganisms for the Purposes of Patent Procedure of 28 April 1977, and if a copy of the receipt of the new deposit issued by the depositary institution is forwarded to the European Patent Office within four months of the date of the new deposit, stating the number of the European patent application or of the European patent.</P>
<P class="p1081 ft4">PART III</P>
<P class="p1082 ft4">IMPLEMENTING REGULATIONS TO PART III OF THE</P>
<P class="p939 ft4">CONVENTION</P>
<P class="p975 ft4">Chapter I</P>
<P class="p1083 ft4">Filing of the European patent application</P>
<P class="p886 ft5">Rule 35</P>
<P class="p903 ft4">General provisions</P>
<P class="p672 ft4">(1) European patent applications may be filed in writing with the European Patent Office in Munich, The Hague or Berlin, or the authorities referred to in Article 75, paragraph 1(b).</P>
<P class="p320 ft6">(2) The authority with which the European patent application is filed shall mark the documents making up the application with the date of their receipt, and issue without delay a receipt to the applicant including at least the application number and the nature, number and date of receipt</P>
<P class="p174 ft135">of the documents.</P>
<P class="p390 ft4">326</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_327">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t52">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p3 ft8">(3) If the European patent application is filed with an authority referred</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td140"><P class="p3 ft13">to in Article 75, paragraph 1(b), such authority shall without delay</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft8">inform the European Patent Office of the receipt of the application, and,</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">in particular, of the nature and date of receipt of the documents, the</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">application number and any priority date claimed.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft87">Upon receipt of a European patent application forwarded by the central industrial property office of a Contracting State, the European Patent Office shall inform the applicant accordingly, indicating the date of its receipt.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p884 ft5">Rule 36</P>
<P class="p895 ft4">European divisional applications</P>
<P class="p682 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft153">The applicant may file a divisional application relating to any pending earlier European patent application.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">A divisional application shall be in the language of the proceedings for the earlier application and shall be filed with the European Patent Office in Munich, The Hague or Berlin.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The filing fee and search fee shall be paid within one month of filing the divisional application. If the filing fee or search fee is not paid in due time, the application shall be deemed to be withdrawn.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">The designation fees shall be paid within six months of the date on which the European Patent Bulletin mentions the publication of the European search report drawn up in respect of the divisional application. Rule 39, paragraphs 2 and 3, shall apply.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p884 ft5">Rule 37</P>
<P class="p789 ft4">Forwarding of European patent</P>
<P class="p839 ft4">applications</P>
<P class="p672 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft37">The central industrial property office of a Contracting State shall forward European patent applications to the European Patent Office in the shortest time compatible with its national law relating to the secrecy of inventions in the interests of the State, and shall take all appropriate steps to ensure such forwarding within:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4">(a) six weeks of filing, where the subject of the application is evidently not liable to secrecy under the national law; or</P>
<P class="p250 ft4">(b) four months of filing or, if priority has been claimed, fourteen months of the date of priority, where the application requires further examination as to its liability to secrecy.</P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft35">A European patent application not received by the European Patent Office within fourteen months of filing or, if priority has been claimed, of the date of priority, shall be deemed to be withdrawn. Any fees paid in respect of this application shall be refunded.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p884 ft5">Rule 38</P>
<P class="p1084 ft4">Filing fee and search fee</P>
<P class="p682 ft4">The filing fee and search fee shall be paid within one month of filing the European patent application.</P>
<P class="p518 ft4">327</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_328">


<DIV>
<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p1085 ft5">Rule 39</P>
<P class="p1086 ft4">Designation fees</P>
<P class="p504 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Designation fees shall be paid within six months of the date on which the European Patent Bulletin mentions the publication of the European search report.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p105 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">Where the designation fee is not paid in due time in respect of any Contracting State, the designation of that State shall be deemed to be withdrawn.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p138 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Where no designation fee is paid in due time or the designations of all the Contracting States are withdrawn, the European patent application shall be deemed to be withdrawn.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p267 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft175">Without prejudice to Rule 37, paragraph 2, second sentence, designation fees shall not be refunded.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p824 ft5">Rule 40</P>
<P class="p816 ft4">Date of filing</P>
<P class="p830 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">The date of filing of a European patent application shall be the date on which the documents filed by the applicant contain:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p71 ft4">(a) an indication that a European patent is sought;</P>
<P class="p393 ft4">(b) information identifying the applicant or allowing the applicant to be contacted; and</P>
<P class="p71 ft4">(c) a description or reference to a previously filed application.</P>
<P class="p105 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft37">A reference to a previously filed application under paragraph 1(c) shall state the filing date and number of that application and the Office with which it was filed. Such reference shall indicate that it replaces the description and any drawings.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p263 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft173">Where the application contains a reference under paragraph 2, a certified copy of the previously filed application shall be filed within two months of filing the application. Where the previously filed application is not in an official language of the European Patent Office, a translation thereof in one of these languages shall be filed within the same period. Rule 53, paragraph 2, shall apply </SPAN><SPAN class="ft33">mutatis mutandis</SPAN>.</P>
<P class="p1087 ft4">Chapter II</P>
<P class="p1088 ft4">Provisions governing the application</P>
<P class="p1058 ft5">Rule 41</P>
<P class="p685 ft4">Request for grant</P>
<P class="p830 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">The request for grant of a European patent shall be filed on a form drawn up by the European Patent Office.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p71 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft18">The request shall contain:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p71 ft4"><SPAN class="ft7">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft18">a petition for the grant of a European patent;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p898 ft8"><SPAN class="ft8">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft20">the title of the invention, which shall clearly and concisely state the technical designation of the invention and shall exclude all fancy names;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p264 ft8"><SPAN class="ft8">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft67">the name, address and nationality of the applicant and the State in which his residence or principal place of business is located. Names of natural persons shall be indicated by the person's family name, followed</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p515 ft17">Prop. 2006/07:56 Bilaga 7</P>
<P class="p516 ft4">328</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_329">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t21">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">by his given names. Names of legal persons, as well as of bodies</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td140"><P class="p3 ft13">equivalent to legal persons under the law governing them, shall be</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft8">indicated by their official designations. Addresses shall be indicated in</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">accordance with applicable customary requirements for prompt postal</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">delivery and shall comprise all the relevant administrative units,</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft8">including the house number, if any. It is recommended that the fax and</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">telephone numbers be indicated;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p994 ft8"><SPAN class="ft8">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft186">if the applicant has appointed a representative, his name and the address of his place of business as prescribed in </SPAN><NOBR>sub-paragraph</NOBR> (c);</P>
<P class="p451 ft4"><SPAN class="ft7">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft37">where appropriate, an indication that the application constitutes a divisional application and the number of the earlier European patent application;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p840 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(f)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft37">in cases covered by Article 61, paragraph 1(b), the number of the original European patent application;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(g)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">where applicable, a declaration claiming the priority of an earlier application and indicating the date on which and the country in or for which the earlier application was filed;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(h)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft18">the signature of the applicant or his representative;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">a list of the documents accompanying the request. This list shall also indicate the number of sheets of the description, claims, drawings and abstract filed with the request;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft4"><SPAN class="ft4">(j)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft18">the designation of the inventor, where the applicant is the inventor.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4">(3) If there is more than one applicant, the request shall preferably contain the appointment of one applicant or representative as common representative.</P>
<P class="p884 ft5">Rule 42</P>
<P class="p765 ft4">Content of the description</P>
<P class="p5 ft4">(1) The description shall:</P>
<P class="p283 ft4"><SPAN class="ft7">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft18">specify the technical field to which the invention relates;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p320 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">indicate the background art which, as far as is known to the applicant, can be regarded as useful to understand the invention, draw up the European search report and examine the European patent application, and, preferably, cite the documents reflecting such art;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft35">disclose the invention, as claimed, in such terms that the technical problem, even if not expressly stated as such, and its solution can be understood, and state any advantageous effects of the invention with reference to the background art;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p283 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft18">briefly describe the figures in the drawings, if any;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft7">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft87">describe in detail at least one way of carrying out the invention claimed, using examples where appropriate and referring to the drawings, if any;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(f)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft37">indicate explicitly, when it is not obvious from the description or nature of the invention, the way in which the invention is industrially applicable.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p320 ft32">(2) The description shall be presented in the manner and order specified in paragraph 1, unless, owing to the nature of the invention, a different presentation would afford a better understanding or be more concise.</P>
<P class="p472 ft4">329</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_330">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t87">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td186"><P class="p1089 ft26">Rule 43</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td186"><P class="p1089 ft7">Form and content of claims</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft4">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p672 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">The claims shall define the matter for which protection is sought in terms of the technical features of the invention. Wherever appropriate, claims shall contain:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4">(a) a statement indicating the designation of the <NOBR>subject-matter</NOBR> of the invention and those technical features which are necessary for the definition of the claimed <NOBR>subject-matter</NOBR> but which, in combination, form part of the prior art;</P>
<P class="p233 ft4">(b) a characterising portion, beginning with the expression "characterised in that" or "characterised by" and specifying the technical features for which, in combination with the features stated under <NOBR>sub-paragraph</NOBR> (a), protection is sought.</P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">Without prejudice to Article 82, a European patent application may contain more than one independent claim in the same category (product, process, apparatus or use) only if the subjectmatter of the application involves one of the following:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p283 ft4">(a) a plurality of interrelated products,</P>
<P class="p174 ft4">(b) different uses of a product or apparatus,</P>
<P class="p426 ft4">(c) alternative solutions to a particular problem, where it is inappropriate to cover these alternatives by a single claim.</P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft87">Any claim stating the essential features of an invention may be followed by one or more claims concerning particular embodiments of that invention.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft86">Any claim which includes all the features of any other claim (dependent claim) shall contain, if possible at the beginning, a reference to the other claim and then state the additional features. A dependent claim directly referring to another dependent claim shall also be admissible. All dependent claims referring back to a single previous claim, and all dependent claims referring back to several previous claims, shall be grouped together to the extent and in the most appropriate way possible.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(5)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The number of claims shall be reasonable with regard to the nature of the invention claimed. The claims shall be numbered consecutively in Arabic numerals.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(6)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft19">Except where absolutely necessary, claims shall not rely on references to the description or drawings in specifying the technical features of the invention. In particular, they shall not contain such expressions as "as described in part. of the description", or "as illustrated in figure . of the drawings".</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(7)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft35">Where the European patent application contains drawings including reference signs, the technical features specified in the claims shall preferably be followed by such reference signs relating to these features, placed in parentheses, if the intelligibility of the claim can thereby be increased. These reference signs shall not be construed as limiting the claim.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p782 ft4">330</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_331">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t88">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td270"><P class="p916 ft26">Rule 44</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td270"><P class="p916 ft8">Unity of invention</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft4">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p673 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft77">Where a group of inventions is claimed in a European patent application, the requirement of unity of invention under Article 82 shall be fulfilled only when there is a technical relationship among those inventions involving one or more of the same or corresponding special technical features. The expression "special technical features" shall mean those features which define a contribution which each of the claimed inventions considered as a whole makes over the prior art.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft35">The determination whether a group of inventions is so linked as to form a single general inventive concept shall be made without regard to whether the inventions are claimed in separate claims or as alternatives within a single claim.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p884 ft5">Rule 45</P>
<P class="p872 ft4">Claims incurring fees</P>
<P class="p672 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft35">Any European patent application comprising more than ten claims shall, in respect of the eleventh and each subsequent claim, incur payment of a claims fee.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">The claims fees shall be paid within one month of filing the first set of claims. If the claims fees have not been paid in due time, they may still be paid within one month of a communication concerning the failure to observe the time limit.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p840 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">If a claims fee is not paid in due time, the claim concerned shall be deemed to be abandoned.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p886 ft5">Rule 46</P>
<P class="p972 ft4">Form of the drawings</P>
<P class="p673 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft87">On sheets containing drawings, the usable surface area shall not exceed 26.2 cm x 17 cm. The usable or used surface shall not be surrounded by frames. The minimum margins shall be as follows:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft4">top 2.5 cm</P>
<P class="p1090 ft4">left side 2.5 cm right side 1.5 cm bottom 1 cm</P>
<P class="p283 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft18">Drawings shall be executed as follows:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft7">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft87">Drawings shall be executed without colourings in durable, black, sufficiently dense and dark, uniformly thick and well defined lines and strokes.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p840 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(b)</SPAN><NOBR><SPAN class="ft153">Cross-sections</SPAN></NOBR> shall be indicated by hatching which should not impede the clear reading of the reference signs and leading lines.</P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The scale of the drawings and their graphical execution shall be such that electronic or photographic reproduction with a linear reduction in size to </SPAN><NOBR>two-thirds</NOBR> will allow all details to be distinguished without difficulty. If, exceptionally, the scale is given on a drawing, it shall be represented graphically.</P>
<P class="p472 ft4">331</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_332">


<DIV>
<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p138 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">All numbers, letters, and reference signs appearing on the drawings shall be simple and clear. Brackets, circles or inverted commas shall not be used in association with numbers and letters.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p393 ft4"><SPAN class="ft7">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft35">Generally, all lines in the drawings shall be drawn with the aid of drafting instruments.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p138 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(f)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft37">Elements of the same figure shall be proportional to one another, unless a difference in proportion is indispensable for the clarity of the figure.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p105 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(g)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">The height of the numbers and letters shall not be less than 0.32 cm. For the lettering of drawings, the Latin and, where customary, the Greek alphabets shall be used.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p263 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(h)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft173">The same sheet of drawings may contain several figures. Where figures drawn on two or more sheets are intended to form a single figure, the figures on the several sheets shall be so arranged that the whole figure can be assembled without concealing any part of the partial figures. The different figures shall be arranged without wasting space, preferably in an upright position, clearly separated from one another. Where the figures are not arranged in an upright position, they shall be presented sideways with the top of the figures at the left side of the sheet. The different figures shall be numbered consecutively in Arabic numerals, independently of the numbering of the sheets.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p845 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">Reference signs not mentioned in the description and claims shall not appear in the drawings, and vice versa. Reference signs to features shall be consistent throughout the application.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p105 ft4"><SPAN class="ft4">(j)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft35">The drawings shall not contain text matter. Where indispensable to understand the drawings, a few short keywords, such as "water", "steam", "open", "closed" or "section on AB", may be included. Any such keywords shall be placed in such a way that, if required, they can be replaced by their translations without interfering with any lines of the drawings.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p339 ft4">(3) Flow sheets and diagrams shall be deemed to be drawings.</P>
<P class="p824 ft5">Rule 47</P>
<P class="p1091 ft4">Form and content of the abstract</P>
<P class="p139 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft18">The abstract shall indicate the title of the invention.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p493 ft32"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft176">The abstract shall contain a concise summary of the disclosure as contained in the description, the claims and any drawings. The summary shall indicate the technical field to which the invention pertains, and shall be drafted in a manner allowing the clear understanding of the technical problem, the gist of the solution of that problem through the invention, and the principal use or uses of the invention. The abstract shall, where applicable, contain the chemical formula which, among those contained in the application, best characterises the invention. It shall not contain statements on the alleged merits or value of the invention or on speculative applications thereof.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p393 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">The abstract shall preferably not contain more than one hundred and fifty words.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p493 ft17"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft206">If the European patent application contains drawings, the applicant shall indicate the figure or, exceptionally, the figures of the drawings which should be published with the abstract. The European Patent Office</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p515 ft17">Prop. 2006/07:56 Bilaga 7</P>
<P class="p516 ft4">332</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_333">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t52">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p3 ft8">may decide to publish one or more other figures if it considers that they</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td140"><P class="p3 ft8">better characterise the invention. Each essential feature mentioned in the</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">abstract and illustrated by a drawing shall be followed by a reference</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">sign placed in parentheses.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p728 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(5)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft189">The abstract shall be drafted in such a manner as to constitute an efficient instrument for the purpose of searching in the particular technical field. In particular, it shall make it possible to assess whether consultation of the European patent application itself is necessary.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p884 ft5">Rule 48</P>
<P class="p874 ft4">Prohibited matter</P>
<P class="p480 ft4">(1) The European patent application shall not contain:</P>
<P class="p174 ft4"><SPAN class="ft7">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft18">statements or other matter contrary to "ordre public" or morality;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">statements disparaging the products or processes of any third party or the merits or validity of the applications or patents of any such party. Mere comparisons with the prior art shall not be considered disparaging </SPAN><SPAN class="ft5">per se</SPAN>;</P>
<P class="p840 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft37">any statement or other matter obviously irrelevant or unnecessary under the circumstances.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4">(2) If the application contains matter prohibited under paragraph 1(a), the European Patent Office may omit such matter from the application as published, indicating the place and number of words or drawings omitted.</P>
<P class="p250 ft4">(3) If the application contains statements referred to in paragraph 1(b), the European Patent Office may omit them from the application as published, indicating the place and number of words omitted. Upon request, the European Patent Office shall furnish a copy of the passages omitted.</P>
<P class="p884 ft5">Rule 49</P>
<P class="p774 ft4">General provisions governing the presentation of the application</P>
<P class="p1092 ft4">documents</P>
<P class="p481 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft87">Any translation filed under Article 14, paragraph 2, or Rule 40, paragraph 3, shall be deemed to be a document making up the European patent application.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p279 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">The documents making up the application shall be presented so as to allow electronic and direct reproduction, in particular by scanning, photography, electrostatic processes, photo offset and microfilming, in an unlimited number of copies. All sheets shall be free from cracks, creases and folds. Only one side of the sheet shall be used.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p279 ft17"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft203">The documents making up the application shall be on A4 paper (29.7 cm x 21 cm) which shall be pliable, strong, white, smooth, matt and durable. Subject to paragraph 10 and Rule 46, paragraph 2(h), each sheet shall be used with its short sides at the top and bottom (upright position).</SPAN></P>
<P class="p379 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft19">Each of the documents making up the application (request, description, claims, drawings and abstract) shall commence on a new sheet. The sheets shall be connected in such a way that they can easily be turned over, separated and joined together again.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p716 ft4">333</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_334">


<DIV>
<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p393 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(5)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft35">Subject to Rule 46, paragraph 1, the minimum margins shall be as follows:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p71 ft4">top: 2 cm</P>
<P class="p71 ft4">left side: 2.5 cm</P>
<P class="p71 ft4">right side: 2 cm</P>
<P class="p71 ft4">bottom: 2 cm</P>
<P class="p594 ft4">The recommended maximum for the margins quoted above is as follows: top: 4 cm</P>
<P class="p71 ft4">left side: 4 cm</P>
<P class="p71 ft4">right side: 3 cm</P>
<P class="p71 ft4">bottom: 3 cm</P>
<P class="p138 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(6)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft87">All the sheets contained in the application shall be numbered in consecutive Arabic numerals. These shall be centred at the top of the sheet, but not placed in the top margin.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p105 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(7)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft37">The lines of each sheet of the description and of the claims shall preferably be numbered in sets of five, the numbers appearing on the left side, to the right of the margin.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p263 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(8)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">The request for grant of a European patent, the description, the claims and the abstract shall be typed or printed. Only graphic symbols and characters and chemical or mathematical formulae may, if necessary, be drawn or written by hand. The typing shall be 1½ spaced. All text matter shall be in characters, the capital letters of which are not less than 0.21 cm high, and shall be in a dark, indelible colour.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p493 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(9)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">The request for grant of a European patent, the description, the claims and the abstract shall not contain drawings. The description, claims and abstract may contain chemical or mathematical formulae. The description and abstract may contain tables. The claims may contain tables only if their </SPAN><NOBR>subject-matter</NOBR> makes the use of tables desirable. Tables and chemical or mathematical formulae may be placed sideways on the sheet if they cannot be presented satisfactorily in an upright position. Tables or chemical or mathematical formulae presented sideways shall be placed so that the tops of the tables or formulae are at the <NOBR>left-hand</NOBR> side of the sheet.</P>
<P class="p845 ft4"><SPAN class="ft7">(10)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft153">Values shall be expressed in units conforming to international standards, wherever appropriate in terms of the metric system using SI units. Any data not meeting this requirement shall also be expressed in units conforming to international standards. Only the technical terms, conventions, formulae, signs and symbols generally accepted in the field in question shall be used.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p267 ft4"><SPAN class="ft7">(11)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft37">The terminology and the signs shall be consistent throughout the European patent application.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p138 ft4"><SPAN class="ft7">(12)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">Each sheet shall be reasonably free from erasures and shall be free from alterations. </SPAN><NOBR>Non-compliance</NOBR> with this rule may be authorised if the authenticity of the content is not impugned and the requirements for good reproduction are not thereby jeopardised.</P>
<P class="p1058 ft5">Rule 50</P>
<P class="p896 ft4">Documents filed subsequently</P>
<P class="p1093 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft153">Rules 42, 43 and 46 to 49 shall apply to documents replacing documents making up the European patent application. Rule 49,</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p515 ft17">Prop. 2006/07:56 Bilaga 7</P>
<P class="p516 ft4">334</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_335">


<DIV>
<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p393 ft4">paragraphs 2 to 12, shall also apply to the translation of the claims referred to in Rule 71.</P>
<P class="p138 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft87">All documents other than those making up the application shall generally be typewritten or printed. There shall be a margin of about 2.5 cm on the </SPAN><NOBR>left-hand</NOBR> side of each page.</P>
<P class="p393 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Documents filed after filing the application shall be signed, with the exception of annexed documents. If a document has not been signed, the European Patent Office shall invite the party concerned to do so within a time limit to be specified. If signed in due time, the document shall retain its original date of receipt; otherwise it shall be deemed not to have been filed.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1094 ft4">Chapter III</P>
<P class="p1095 ft4">Renewal fees</P>
<P class="p824 ft5">Rule 51</P>
<P class="p1096 ft4">Payment of renewal fees</P>
<P class="p1093 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft35">A renewal fee for the European patent application in respect of the coming year shall be due on the last day of the month containing the anniversary of the date of filing of the European patent application. Renewal fees may not be validly paid more than one year before they fall due.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p105 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft35">If a renewal fee is not paid in due time, the fee may still be paid within six months of the due date, provided that an additional fee is also paid within that period.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p138 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft35">Renewal fees already due in respect of an earlier application at the date on which a divisional application is filed shall also be paid for the divisional application and shall be due on its filing. These fees and any renewal fee due within four months of filing the divisional application may be paid within that period without an additional fee. Paragraph 2 shall apply.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p493 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft189">If a European patent application has been refused or deemed to be withdrawn as a result of </SPAN><NOBR>non-observance</NOBR> of a time limit, and if the applicant's rights are <NOBR>re-established</NOBR> under Article 122, a renewal fee</P>
<P class="p105 ft4">(a) which would have fallen due under paragraph 1 in the period starting on the date on which the loss of rights occurred, up to and including the date of the notification of the decision <NOBR>re-establishing</NOBR> the rights shall be due on that latter date.</P>
<P class="p138 ft4">This fee and any renewal fee due within four months from that latter date may still be paid within four months of that latter date without an additional fee. Paragraph 2 shall apply.</P>
<P class="p493 ft6">(b) which, on the date on which the loss of rights has occurred, was already due but the period provided for in paragraph 2 has not yet expired, may still be paid within six months from the date of the notification of the decision <NOBR>re-establishing</NOBR> the rights, provided that the additional fee pursuant to paragraph 2 is also paid within that period.</P>
<P class="p105 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(5)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft87">If the Enlarged Board of Appeal reopens proceedings before the Board of Appeal under Article 112a, paragraph 5, second sentence, a renewal fee</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p515 ft17">Prop. 2006/07:56 Bilaga 7</P>
<P class="p516 ft4">335</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_336">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t61">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p3 ft8">(a) which would have fallen due under paragraph 1 in the period starting</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td140"><P class="p3 ft13">on the date when the decision of the Board of Appeal subject to the</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">petition for review was taken, up to and including the date of the</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft8">notification of the decision of the Enlarged Board of Appeal <NOBR>re-opening</NOBR></P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td140"><P class="p3 ft8">proceedings before the Board of Appeal, shall be due on that latter date.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft8">This fee and any renewal fee due within four months from that latter date</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">may still be paid within four months of that latter date without an</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">additional fee. Paragraph 2 shall apply.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p728 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">which, on the day on which the decision of the Board of Appeal was taken, was already due but the period provided for in paragraph 2 has not yet expired, may still be paid within six months from the date of the notification of the decision of the Enlarged Board of Appeal </SPAN><NOBR>re-opening</NOBR> proceedings before the Board of Appeal, provided that the additional fee pursuant to paragraph 2 is also paid within that period.</P>
<P class="p250 ft4">(6) A renewal fee shall not be payable for a new European patent application filed under Article 61, paragraph 1(b), in respect of the year in which it was filed and any preceding year.</P>
<P class="p764 ft4">Chapter IV</P>
<P class="p951 ft4">Priority</P>
<P class="p886 ft5">Rule 52</P>
<P class="p688 ft4">Declaration of priority</P>
<P class="p673 ft8"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft63">The declaration of priority referred to in Article 88, paragraph 1, shall indicate the date of the previous filing, the State party to the Paris Convention or Member of the World Trade Organization in or for which it was made and the file number. In the case referred to in Article 87, paragraph 5, the first sentence shall apply </SPAN><SPAN class="ft26">mutatis mutandis</SPAN>.</P>
<P class="p1097 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft37">The declaration of priority shall preferably be made on filing the European patent application. It may still be made within sixteen months from the earliest priority date claimed.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft35">The applicant may correct the declaration of priority within sixteen months from the earliest priority date claimed, or, where the correction would cause a change in the earliest priority date claimed, within sixteen months from the corrected earliest priority date, whichever sixteen- month period expires first, provided that such a correction may be submitted until the expiry of four months from the date of filing accorded to the European patent application.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p840 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">However, a declaration of priority may not be made or corrected after a request under Article 93, paragraph 1(b), has been filed.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(5)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft87">The particulars of the declaration of priority shall appear in the published European patent application and the European patent specification.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p886 ft5">Rule 53</P>
<P class="p903 ft4">Priority documents</P>
<P class="p480 ft4">(1) An applicant claiming priority shall file a copy of the previous</P>
<P class="p174 ft76">application within sixteen months of the earliest priority date claimed.</P>
<P class="p390 ft4">336</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_337">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t21">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">This copy and the date of filing of the previous application shall be</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft8">certified as correct by the authority with which that application was filed.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft4">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p279 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">The copy of the previous application shall be deemed to be duly filed if a copy of that application available to the European Patent Office is to be included in the file of the European patent application under the conditions determined by the President of the European Patent Office.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">Where the previous application is not in an official language of the European Patent Office and the validity of the priority claim is relevant to the determination of the patentability of the invention concerned, the European Patent Office shall invite the applicant for or proprietor of the European patent to file a translation of that application into one of the official languages within a period to be specified. Alternatively, a declaration may be submitted that the European patent application is a complete translation of the previous application. Paragraph 2 shall apply </SPAN><SPAN class="ft5">mutatis mutandis</SPAN>.</P>
<P class="p884 ft5">Rule 54</P>
<P class="p130 ft4">Issuing priority documents</P>
<P class="p673 ft6">On request, the European Patent Office shall issue to the applicant a certified copy of the European patent application (priority document), under the conditions determined by the President of the European Patent Office, including the form of the priority document and the circumstances under which an administrative fee shall be paid.</P>
<P class="p1071 ft4">PART IV</P>
<P class="p1098 ft4">IMPLEMENTING REGULATIONS TO PART IV OF THE</P>
<P class="p939 ft4">CONVENTION</P>
<P class="p975 ft4">Chapter I</P>
<P class="p1099 ft4">Examination by the Receiving Section</P>
<P class="p886 ft5">Rule 55</P>
<P class="p919 ft4">Examination on filing</P>
<P class="p672 ft4">If the examination under Article 90, paragraph 1, reveals that the application fails to meet the requirements laid down in Rule 40, paragraph 1(a) or (c), paragraph 2 or paragraph 3, first sentence, the European Patent Office shall inform the applicant of any deficiencies and advise him that the application will not be dealt with as a European patent application unless such deficiencies are remedied within two months. If the applicant does this, he shall be informed of the date of filing accorded by the Office.</P>
<P class="p991 ft4">337</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_338">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t89">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td271"><P class="p1100 ft26">Rule 56</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td271"><P class="p1100 ft7">Missing parts of the description</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td271"><P class="p1100 ft7">or missing drawings</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p445 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">If the examination under Article 90, paragraph 1, reveals that parts of the description, or drawings referred to in the description or in the claims, appear to be missing, the European Patent Office shall invite the applicant to file the missing parts within two months. The applicant may not invoke the omission of such a communication.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p279 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft178">If missing parts of the description or missing drawings are filed later than the date of filing, but within two months of the date of filing or, if a communication is issued under paragraph 1, within two months of that communication, the application shall be </SPAN><NOBR>re-dated</NOBR> to the date on which the missing parts of the description or missing drawings were filed. The European Patent Office shall inform the applicant accordingly.</P>
<P class="p279 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft178">If the missing parts of the description or missing drawings are filed within the period under paragraph 2, and the application claims priority of an earlier application, the date of filing shall, provided that the missing parts of the description or the missing drawings are completely contained in the earlier application, remain the date on which the requirements laid down in Rule 40, paragraph 1, were fulfilled, where the applicant so requests and files, within the period under paragraph 2:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p840 ft4">(a) a copy of the earlier application, unless such copy is available to the European Patent Office under Rule 53, paragraph 2;</P>
<P class="p250 ft4">(b) where the earlier application is not in an official language of the European Patent Office, a translation thereof in one of these languages, unless such copy is available to the European Patent Office under Rule 53, paragraph 3; and</P>
<P class="p233 ft4">(c) an indication as to where the missing parts of the description or the missing drawings are completely contained in the earlier application and, where applicable, in the translation thereof.</P>
<P class="p283 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft18">If the applicant:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft7">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft153">fails to file the missing parts of the description or the missing drawings within the period under paragraph 1 or 2, or</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">withdraws under paragraph 6 any missing part of the description or missing drawing filed under paragraph 2, any references referred to in paragraph 1 shall be deemed to be deleted, and any filing of the missing parts of the description or missing drawings shall be deemed not to have been made. The European Patent Office shall inform the applicant accordingly.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4">(5) If the applicant fails to comply with the requirements referred to in paragraph 3(a) to (c) within the period under paragraph 2, the application shall be <NOBR>re–dated</NOBR> to the date on which the missing parts of the description or missing drawings were filed. The European Patent Office shall inform the applicant accordingly.</P>
<P class="p250 ft4">(6) Within one month of the notification referred to in paragraph 2 or 5, last sentence, the applicant may withdraw the missing parts of the description or the missing drawings filed, in which case the <NOBR>re–dating</NOBR> shall be deemed not to have been made. The European Patent Office shall inform the applicant accordingly.</P>
<P class="p716 ft4">338</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_339">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t90">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td216"><P class="p1101 ft26">Rule 57</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td216"><P class="p1102 ft7">Examination as to formal requirements</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft4">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p672 ft4">If the European patent application has been accorded a date of filing, the European Patent Office shall examine, in accordance with Article 90, paragraph 3, whether:</P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft7">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">a translation of the application required under Article 14, paragraph 2, or under Rule 40, paragraph 3, second sentence, has been filed in due time;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">the request for grant of a European patent satisfies the requirements of Rule 41;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft87">the application contains one or more claims in accordance with Article 78, paragraph 1(c), or a reference to a previously filed application in accordance with Rule 40, paragraphs 1(c), 2 and 3, indicating that it replaces also the claims;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p283 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft18">the application contains an abstract</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft4">in accordance with Article 78, paragraph 1(e);</P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft7">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft35">the filing fee and the search fee have been paid in accordance with Rule 17, paragraph 2, Rule 36, paragraph 3, or Rule 38;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p840 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(f)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft37">the designation of the inventor has been made in accordance with Rule 19, paragraph 1;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(g)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft35">where appropriate, the requirements laid down in Rules 52 and 53 concerning the claim to priority have been satisfied;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(h)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">where appropriate, the requirements of Article 133, paragraph 2, have been satisfied;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p840 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">the application meets the requirements laid down in Rule 46 and Rule 49, paragraphs 1 to 9 and 12.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft4">(j)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">the application meets the requirements laid down in Rule 30 or Rule 163, paragraph 3.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p884 ft5">Rule 58</P>
<P class="p1091 ft4">Correction of deficiencies in the application documents</P>
<P class="p686 ft32">If the European patent application does not comply with the requirements of Rule 57(a) to (d), (h) and (i), the European Patent Office shall inform the applicant accordingly and invite him to correct the deficiencies noted within two months. The description, claims and drawings may be amended only to an extent sufficient to remedy such deficiencies.</P>
<P class="p884 ft5">Rule 59</P>
<P class="p1103 ft4">Deficiencies in claiming priority</P>
<P class="p673 ft32">If the file number of the previous application under Rule 52, paragraph 1, or the copy of that application under Rule 53, paragraph 1, have not been filed in due time, the European Patent Office shall inform the applicant accordingly and invite him to file them within a period to be specified.</P>
<P class="p1104 ft4">339</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_340">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t90">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td216"><P class="p1101 ft26">Rule 60</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td216"><P class="p1102 ft7">Subsequent designation of the inventor</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft4">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p672 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft35">If the designation of the inventor has not been made in accordance with Rule 19, the European Patent Office shall inform the applicant that the European patent application will be refused unless the designation is made within sixteen months of the date of filing of the application or, if priority is claimed, of the date of priority, this period being deemed to have been observed if the information is communicated before completion of the technical preparations for the publication of the European patent application.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p279 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft178">Where, in a divisional application or a new application under Article 61, paragraph 1(b), the designation of the inventor has not been made in accordance with Rule 19, the European Patent Office shall invite the applicant to make the designation within a period to be specified.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1071 ft4">Chapter II</P>
<P class="p1105 ft4">European search report</P>
<P class="p884 ft5">Rule 61</P>
<P class="p795 ft4">Content of the European search report</P>
<P class="p481 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The European search report shall mention those documents, available to the European Patent Office at the time of drawing up the report, which may be taken into consideration in deciding whether the invention to which the European patent application relates is new and involves an inventive step.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p892 ft17"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft203">Each citation shall be referred to the claims to which it relates. Where appropriate, relevant parts of the documents cited shall be identified.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p728 ft8"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft207">The European search report shall distinguish between cited documents published before the date of priority claimed, between such date of priority and the date of filing, and on or after the date of filing.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p299 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft178">Any document which refers to an oral disclosure, a use or any other means of disclosure which took place before the date of filing of the European patent application shall be mentioned in the European search report, together with an indication of the date of publication, if any, of the document and the date of the nonwritten disclosure.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p840 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(5)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">The European search report shall be drawn up in the language of the proceedings.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(6)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft37">The European search report shall contain the classification of the subjectmatter of the European patent application in accordance with the international classification.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p884 ft5">Rule 62</P>
<P class="p1106 ft4">Extended European search report</P>
<P class="p686 ft32">(1) The European search report shall be accompanied by an opinion on whether the application and the invention to which it relates seem to meet the requirements of this Convention, unless a communication under</P>
<P class="p174 ft135">Rule 71, paragraph 1 or 3, can be issued.</P>
<P class="p390 ft4">340</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_341">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t61">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">(2) The opinion under paragraph 1 shall not be published together with</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td140"><P class="p3 ft13">the search report.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr12 td140"><P class="p679 ft26">Rule 63</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr12 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p678 ft7">Incomplete search</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr11 td140"><P class="p679 ft4">If the European Patent Office considers that the European patent</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr11 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">application does not comply with this Convention to such an extent that</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">it is impossible to carry out a meaningful search into the state of the art</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">on the basis of all or some of the <NOBR>subject-matter</NOBR> claimed, it shall either</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td140"><P class="p679 ft7">issue a reasoned declaration to that effect or, as far as is practicable, draw</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">up a partial search report. The declaration or the partial report shall be</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft7">considered, for the purposes of subsequent proceedings, as the European</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">search report.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr12 td140"><P class="p679 ft26">Rule 64</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr12 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft7">European search report where theinvention lacks unity</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p445 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft68">If the European Patent Office considers that the European patent application does not comply with the requirement of unity of invention, it shall draw up a partial search report on those parts of the application which relate to the invention, or the group of inventions within the meaning of Article 82, first mentioned in the claims. It shall inform the applicant that for the European search report to cover the other inventions, a further search fee must be paid, in respect of each invention involved, within a period to be specified, which shall neither be shorter than two weeks nor exceed six weeks. The European search report shall be drawn up for the parts of the application relating to inventions in respect of which search fees have been paid.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft37">Any fee paid under paragraph 1 shall be refunded if, during the examination of the European patent application, the applicant requests a refund and the Examining Division finds that the communication under paragraph 1 was not justified.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p884 ft5">Rule 65</P>
<P class="p1063 ft4">Transmittal of the European search report</P>
<P class="p672 ft4">Immediately after it has been drawn up, the European search report shall be transmitted to the applicant together with copies of any cited documents.</P>
<P class="p886 ft5">Rule 66</P>
<P class="p1107 ft4">Definitive content of the abstract</P>
<P class="p481 ft4">Upon drawing up the European search report, the European Patent Office shall determine the definitive content of the abstract and transmit it to the applicant together with the search report.</P>
<P class="p1108 ft4">341</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_342">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t91">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td272"><P class="p3 ft4">Chapter III</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td272"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft4">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p1109 ft4">Publication of the European patent application</P>
<P class="p886 ft5">Rule 67</P>
<P class="p795 ft4">Technical preparations for publication</P>
<P class="p672 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The President of the European Patent Office shall determine when the technical preparations for publication of the European patent application are deemed to have been completed.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The application shall not be published if it has been finally refused or withdrawn or is deemed to be withdrawn before the termination of the technical preparations for publication.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p884 ft5">Rule 68</P>
<P class="p1016 ft4">Form of the publication of European patent applications and European</P>
<P class="p1110 ft4">search reports</P>
<P class="p673 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft178">The publication of the European patent application shall contain the description, the claims and any drawings as filed, and the abstract, or, if these documents making up the application were not filed in an official language of the European Patent Office, a translation in the language of the proceedings, and, in an annex, the European search report, where it is available before the termination of the technical preparations for publication. If the search report or the abstract is not published at the same time as the application, it shall be published separately.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The President of the European Patent Office shall determine the form of the publication of the application and the data to be included. The same shall apply where the European search report and the abstract are published separately.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p840 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The designated Contracting States shall be indicated in the published application.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft87">If the patent claims were not filed on the date of filing of the application, this shall be indicated when the application is published. If, before the termination of the technical preparations for publication of the application, the claims have been amended under Rule 137, paragraph 2, the new or amended claims shall be included in the publication in addition to the claims as filed.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p884 ft5">Rule 69</P>
<P class="p835 ft4">Information about publication</P>
<P class="p672 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">The European Patent Office shall inform the applicant of the date on which the European Patent Bulletin mentions the publication of the European search report and shall draw his attention to Rule 70, paragraph 1, and Article 94, paragraph 2.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p320 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft68">The applicant may not invoke the omission of the communication under paragraph 1. If a later date of publication is specified in the communication, that later date shall be the decisive date as regards the period for filing the request for examination, unless the error is obvious.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p716 ft4">342</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_343">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t92">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td273"><P class="p1111 ft26">Rule 70</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td273"><P class="p1112 ft7">Request for examination</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft4">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
