<P class="p672 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft153">The applicant may request examination of the European patent application up to six months after the date on which the European Patent Bulletin mentions the publication of the European search report. The request may not be withdrawn.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p279 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft68">If the request for examination has been filed before the European search report has been transmitted to the applicant, the European Patent Office shall invite the applicant to indicate, within a period to be specified, whether he wishes to proceed further with the application, and shall give him the opportunity to comment on the search report and to amend, where appropriate, the description, claims and drawings.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p840 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft37">If the applicant fails to reply in due time to the invitation under paragraph 2, the application shall be deemed to be withdrawn.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p753 ft4">Chapter IV</P>
<P class="p1113 ft4">Examination by the Examining Division</P>
<P class="p884 ft5">Rule 71</P>
<P class="p768 ft4">Examination procedure</P>
<P class="p481 ft4">(1) In any communication under Article 94, paragraph 3, the Examining Division shall, where appropriate, invite the applicant to correct any deficiencies noted and to amend the description, claims and drawings within a period to be specified.</P>
<P class="p250 ft4">(2) Any communication under Article 94, paragraph 3, shall contain a reasoned statement covering, where appropriate, all the grounds against the grant of the European patent.</P>
<P class="p250 ft4">(3) Before the Examining Division decides to grant the European patent, it shall inform the applicant of the text in which it intends to grant it, and shall invite him to pay the fees for grant and printing and to file a translation of the claims in the two official languages of the European Patent Office other than the language of the proceedings within a period of four months. If the applicant pays the fees and files the translation within this period, he shall be deemed to have approved the text intended for grant.</P>
<P class="p279 ft32">(4) If the applicant, within the period laid down in paragraph 3, requests amendments under Rule 137, paragraph 3, or the correction of errors under Rule 139, he shall, where the claims are amended or corrected, file a translation of the claims as amended or corrected. If the applicant pays the fees and files the translation within this period, he shall be deemed to have approved the grant of the patent as amended or corrected.</P>
<P class="p279 ft32">(5) If the Examining Division does not consent to an amendment or correction requested under paragraph 4, it shall, before taking a decision, give the applicant an opportunity to submit, within a period to be specified, his observations and any amendments considered necessary by the Examining Division, and, where the claims are amended, a translation of the claims as amended. If the applicant submits such</P>
<P class="p174 ft135">amendments, he shall be deemed to have approved the grant of the patent</P>
<P class="p390 ft4">343</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_344">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t61">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p3 ft8">as amended. If the European patent application is refused, withdrawn or</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td140"><P class="p3 ft8">deemed to be withdrawn, the fees for grant and printing, and any claims</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">fees paid under paragraph 6, shall be refunded.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p728 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(6)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft173">If the European patent application in the text intended for grant comprises more than ten claims, the Examining Division shall invite the applicant to pay claims fees in respect of each additional claim within the period under paragraph 3, and, where applicable, paragraph 5, unless the said fees have already been paid under Rule 45 or Rule 162.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(7)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">If the fees for grant and printing or the claims fees are not paid in due time, or if the translation is not filed in due time, the European patent application shall be deemed to be withdrawn.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(8)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft35">If the designation fees become due after the communication under paragraph 3, the mention of the grant of the European patent shall not be published until the designation fees have been paid. The applicant shall be informed accordingly.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(9)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft86">If a renewal fee becomes due after the communication under paragraph 3 and before the next possible date for publication of the mention of the grant of the European patent, the mention shall not be published until the renewal fee has been paid. The applicant shall be informed accordingly.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft7">(10)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">The communication under paragraph 3 shall indicate the designated Contracting States which require a translation under Article 65, paragraph 1.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft7">(11)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">The decision to grant the European patent shall state which text of the European patent application forms the basis for the decision.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p884 ft5">Rule 72</P>
<P class="p1010 ft4">Grant of the European patent to different applicants</P>
<P class="p481 ft4">Where different persons are recorded in the European Patent Register as applicants in respect of different Contracting States, the European Patent Office shall grant the European patent for each Contracting State accordingly.</P>
<P class="p1071 ft4">Chapter V</P>
<P class="p1095 ft4">The European patent specification</P>
<P class="p884 ft5">Rule 73</P>
<P class="p817 ft4">Content and form of the specification</P>
<P class="p481 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The specification of the European patent shall include the description, the claims and any drawings. It shall also indicate the period for opposing the European patent.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p892 ft8"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft63">The President of the European Patent Office shall determine the form of the publication of the specification and the data to be included.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p889 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft19">The designated Contracting States shall be indicated in the specification.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1049 ft4">344</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_345">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t11">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p679 ft26">Rule 74</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td140"><P class="p678 ft7">Certificate for a European patent</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr11 td140"><P class="p679 ft7">As soon as the specification of the European patent has been published,</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr11 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">the European Patent Office shall issue to the proprietor of the patent a</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">certificate for a European patent. The President of the European Patent</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">Office shall prescribe the content, form and means of communication of</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft4">the certificate and determine the circumstances in which an</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">administrative fee is payable.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p1114 ft4">PART V</P>
<P class="p1115 ft4">IMPLEMENTING REGULATIONS TO PART V OF THE</P>
<P class="p939 ft4">CONVENTION</P>
<P class="p674 ft4">Chapter I</P>
<P class="p1116 ft4">Opposition procedure</P>
<P class="p884 ft5">Rule 75</P>
<P class="p1117 ft4">Surrender or lapse of the patent</P>
<P class="p481 ft4">An opposition may be filed even if the European patent has been surrendered in all the designated Contracting States or has lapsed in all those States.</P>
<P class="p884 ft5">Rule 76</P>
<P class="p775 ft4">Form and content of the opposition</P>
<P class="p5 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft18">Notice of opposition shall be filed in a written reasoned statement.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p283 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft18">The notice of opposition shall contain:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft4"><SPAN class="ft7">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft18">particulars of the opponent as provided in Rule 41, paragraph 2(c);</SPAN></P>
<P class="p837 ft8"><SPAN class="ft8">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft20">the number of the European patent against which opposition is filed, the name of the proprietor of the patent and the title of the invention;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p728 ft32"><SPAN class="ft8">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft127">a statement of the extent to which the European patent is opposed and of the grounds on which the opposition is based, as well as an indication of the facts and evidence presented in support of these grounds;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">if the opponent has appointed a representative, particulars as provided in Rule 41, paragraph 2(d).</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1118 ft4">(3) Part III of the Implementing Regulations shall apply <SPAN class="ft5">mutatis mutandis </SPAN>to the notice of opposition.</P>
<P class="p884 ft5">Rule 77</P>
<P class="p1042 ft4">Rejection of the opposition as inadmissible</P>
<P class="p686 ft6">(1) If the Opposition Division notes that the notice of opposition does not comply with the provisions of Article 99, paragraph 1, or Rule 76, paragraph 2(c), or does not sufficiently identify the patent against which opposition has been filed, it shall reject the opposition as inadmissible, unless these deficiencies have been remedied before expiry of the</P>
<P class="p174 ft135">opposition period.</P>
<P class="p390 ft4">345</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_346">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t52">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p3 ft8">(2) If the Opposition Division notes that the notice of opposition does not</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td140"><P class="p3 ft13">comply with provisions other than those referred to in paragraph 1, it</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">shall communicate this to the opponent and shall invite him to remedy</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft8">the deficiencies noted within a period to be specified. If the deficiencies</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">are not remedied in due time, the Opposition Division shall reject the</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">opposition as inadmissible.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p451 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft86">The decision to reject an opposition as inadmissible shall be communicated to the proprietor of the patent, together with a copy of the notice of opposition.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p886 ft5">Rule 78</P>
<P class="p1119 ft4">Procedure where the proprietor of the patent is not entitled</P>
<P class="p673 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft178">If a third party provides evidence, during opposition proceedings or during the opposition period, that he has instituted proceedings against the proprietor of the European patent, seeking a decision within the meaning of Article 61, paragraph 1, opposition proceedings shall be stayed unless the third party communicates to the European Patent Office in writing his consent to the continuation of such proceedings. Such consent shall be irrevocable. However, proceedings shall not be stayed until the Opposition Division has deemed the opposition admissible. Rule 14, paragraphs 2 to 4, shall apply </SPAN><SPAN class="ft33">mutatis mutandis</SPAN>.</P>
<P class="p320 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft178">Where a third party has, in accordance with Article 99, paragraph 4, replaced the previous proprietor for one or some of the designated Contracting States, the patent as maintained in opposition proceedings may, for these States, contain claims, a description and drawings different from those for the other designated States.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p884 ft5">Rule 79</P>
<P class="p957 ft4">Preparation of the examination of the opposition</P>
<P class="p673 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft178">The Opposition Division shall communicate the notice of opposition to the proprietor of the patent and shall give him the opportunity to file his observations and to amend, where appropriate, the description, claims and drawings within a period to be specified.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft87">If several notices of opposition have been filed, the Opposition Division shall communicate them to the other opponents at the same time as the communication under paragraph 1.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft37">The Opposition Division shall communicate any observations and amendments filed by the proprietor of the patent to the other parties, and shall invite them, if it considers this expedient, to reply within a period to be specified.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p840 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft87">In the case of an intervention under Article 105, the Opposition Division may dispense with the application of paragraphs 1 to 3.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p886 ft5">Rule 80</P>
<P class="p766 ft4">Amendment of the European patent</P>
<P class="p731 ft17">Without prejudice to Rule 138, the description, claims and drawings may be amended, provided that the amendments are occasioned by a ground</P>
<P class="p479 ft4">346</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_347">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t21">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p679 ft4">for opposition under Article 100, even if that ground has not been</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td140"><P class="p3 ft13">invoked by the opponent.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr12 td140"><P class="p679 ft26">Rule 81</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr12 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p678 ft7">Examination of opposition</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p445 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft178">The Opposition Division shall examine those grounds for opposition which are invoked in the opponent's statement under Rule 76, paragraph 2(c). Grounds for opposition not invoked by the opponent may be examined by the Opposition Division of its own motion if they would prejudice the maintenance of the European patent.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft37">Communications under Article 101, paragraph 1, second sentence, and all replies thereto shall be sent to all parties. If the opposition division considers this expedient, it shall invite the parties to reply within a period to be specified.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft86">In any communication under Article 101, paragraph 1, second sentence, the proprietor of the European patent shall, where necessary, be given the opportunity to amend, where appropriate, the description, claims and drawings. Where necessary, the communication shall contain a reasoned statement covering the grounds against the maintenance of the European patent.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p884 ft5">Rule 82</P>
<P class="p981 ft4">Maintenance of the European patent in amended form</P>
<P class="p672 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft37">Before the Opposition Division decides to maintain the European patent as amended, it shall inform the parties of the text in which it intends to maintain the patent, and shall invite them to file their observations within two months if they disapprove of that text.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft35">If a party disapproves of the text communicated by the Opposition Division, examination of the opposition may be continued. Otherwise, the Opposition Division shall, on expiry of the period under paragraph 1, invite the proprietor of the patent to pay the prescribed fee and to file a translation of any amended claims in the official languages of the European Patent Office other than the language of the proceedings, within a period of three months. This invitation shall indicate the designated Contracting States which require a translation under Article 65, paragraph 1.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p728 ft32"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft127">If the acts required under paragraph 2 are not performed in due time, they may still be performed within two months of a communication concerning the failure to observe the time limit, provided that a surcharge is paid within this period. Otherwise, the patent shall be revoked.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">The decision to maintain the European patent as amended shall state which text of the patent forms the basis for the decision.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p886 ft5">Rule 83</P>
<P class="p966 ft4">Request for documents</P>
<P class="p731 ft17">Documents referred to by a party to opposition proceedings shall be filed together with the notice of opposition or the written submissions. If such</P>
<P class="p174 ft92">documents are neither enclosed nor filed in due time upon invitation by</P>
<P class="p390 ft4">347</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_348">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t11">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">the European Patent Office, it may decide not to take into account any</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td140"><P class="p3 ft13">arguments based on them.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr12 td140"><P class="p679 ft26">Rule 84</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr12 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p678 ft7">Continuation of the opposition proceedings by the European Patent</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">Office of its own motion</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p737 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft37">If the European patent has been surrendered in all the designated Contracting States or has lapsed in all those States, the opposition proceedings may be continued at the request of the opponent filed within two months of a communication from the European Patent Office informing him of the surrender or lapse.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p279 ft17"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft16">In the event of the death or legal incapacity of an opponent, the opposition proceedings may be continued by the European Patent Office of its own motion, even without the participation of the heirs or legal representatives. The same shall apply where the opposition is withdrawn.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1062 ft5">Rule 85</P>
<P class="p1120 ft4">Transfer of the European patent</P>
<P class="p481 ft4">Rule 22 shall apply to any transfer of the European patent made during the opposition period or during opposition proceedings.</P>
<P class="p886 ft5">Rule 86</P>
<P class="p1121 ft4">Documents in opposition proceedings</P>
<P class="p481 ft4">Part III of the Implementing Regulations shall apply <SPAN class="ft5">mutatis mutandis </SPAN>to documents filed in opposition proceedings.</P>
<P class="p886 ft5">Rule 87</P>
<P class="p1122 ft4">Content and form of the new specification of the European patent</P>
<P class="p481 ft4">The new specification of the European patent shall include the description, claims and drawings as amended. Rule 73, paragraphs 2 and 3, and Rule 74 shall apply.</P>
<P class="p884 ft5">Rule 88</P>
<P class="p967 ft4">Costs</P>
<P class="p481 ft4">(1) The apportionment of costs shall be dealt with in the decision on the opposition. Such apportionment shall only take into consideration the expenses necessary to assure proper protection of the rights involved. The costs shall include the remuneration of the representatives of the parties.</P>
<P class="p250 ft4">(2) The Opposition Division shall, on request, fix the amount of costs to be paid under a final decision apportioning them. A bill of costs, with supporting evidence, shall be attached to the request. Costs may be fixed once their credibility is established.</P>
<P class="p250 ft4">(3) A request for a decision by the Opposition Division may be filed within one month of the communication on the fixing of costs under</P>
<P class="p174 ft76">paragraph 2. The request shall be filed in writing and state the grounds</P>
<P class="p390 ft4">348</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_349">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t21">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">on which it is based. It shall not be deemed to be filed until the</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">prescribed fee has been paid.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft4">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p840 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The Opposition Division shall decide on the request under paragraph 3 without oral proceedings.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p884 ft5">Rule 89</P>
<P class="p817 ft4">Intervention of the assumed infringer</P>
<P class="p681 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">Notice of intervention shall be filed within three months of the date on which proceedings referred to in Article 105 are instituted.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">Notice of intervention shall be filed in a written reasoned statement; Rules 76 and 77 shall apply </SPAN><SPAN class="ft5">mutatis mutandis</SPAN>. The notice of intervention shall not be deemed to have been filed until the opposition fee has been paid.</P>
<P class="p1071 ft4">Chapter II</P>
<P class="p1123 ft4">Procedure for limitation or revocation</P>
<P class="p884 ft5">Rule 90</P>
<P class="p988 ft4">Subject of proceedings</P>
<P class="p686 ft6">The subject of limitation or revocation proceedings under Article 105a shall be the European patent as granted or as amended in opposition or limitation proceedings before the European Patent Office.</P>
<P class="p884 ft5">Rule 91</P>
<P class="p931 ft4">Responsibility for proceedings</P>
<P class="p481 ft4">Decisions on requests for limitation or revocation of the European patent under Article 105a shall be taken by the Examining Division. Article 18, paragraph 2, shall apply <SPAN class="ft5">mutatis mutandis</SPAN>.</P>
<P class="p884 ft5">Rule 92</P>
<P class="p1124 ft4">Requirements of the request</P>
<P class="p672 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The request for limitation or revocation of a European patent shall be filed in writing. Part III of the Implementing Regulations shall apply </SPAN><SPAN class="ft5">mutatis mutandis </SPAN>to documents filed in limitation or revocation proceedings.</P>
<P class="p174 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft18">The request shall contain:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4">(a) particulars of the proprietor of the European patent making the request (the requester) as provided in Rule 41, paragraph 2(c), and an indication of the Contracting States for which the requester is the proprietor of the patent;</P>
<P class="p279 ft8">(b) the number of the patent whose limitation or revocation is requested, and a list of the Contracting States in which the patent has taken effect;</P>
<P class="p728 ft6">(c) where appropriate, the names and addresses of the proprietors of the patent for those Contracting States in which the requester is not the proprietor of the patent, and evidence that the requester is entitled to act</P>
<P class="p174 ft135">on their behalf in the proceedings;</P>
<P class="p390 ft4">349</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_350">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t21">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">(d) where limitation of the patent is requested, the complete version of</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td140"><P class="p3 ft7">the amended claims and, as the case may be, of the amended description</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">and drawings;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p889 ft4"><SPAN class="ft7">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft87">where the requester has appointed a representative, particulars as provided in Rule 41, paragraph 2(d).</SPAN></P>
<P class="p884 ft5">Rule 93</P>
<P class="p781 ft4">Precedence of opposition proceedings</P>
<P class="p481 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">The request for limitation or revocation shall be deemed not to have been filed if opposition proceedings in respect of the patent are pending at the time of filing the request.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p279 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">If, at the time of filing an opposition to a European patent, limitation proceedings in respect of that patent are pending, the Examining Division shall terminate the limitation proceedings and order the reimbursement of the limitation fee. The reimbursement shall also be ordered in respect of the fee referred to in Rule 95, paragraph 3, first sentence, if the requester has already paid this fee.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p884 ft5">Rule 94</P>
<P class="p977 ft4">Rejection of the request as inadmissible</P>
<P class="p686 ft4">If the Examining Division finds that the request for limitation or revocation fails to comply with the requirements of Rule 92, it shall invite the requester to correct the deficiencies noted, within a period to be specified. If the deficiencies are not corrected in due time, the Examining Division shall reject the request as inadmissible.</P>
<P class="p884 ft5">Rule 95</P>
<P class="p768 ft4">Decision on the request</P>
<P class="p672 ft4">(1) If a request for revocation is admissible, the Examining Division shall revoke the patent and communicate this to the requester.</P>
<P class="p320 ft6">(2) If a request for limitation is admissible, the Examining Division shall examine whether the amended claims constitute a limitation <NOBR>vis-à-vis</NOBR> the claims as granted or amended in opposition or limitation proceedings and comply with Article 84 and Article 123, paragraphs 2 and 3. If the request does not comply with these requirements, the Examining Division shall give the requester one opportunity to correct any deficiencies noted, and to amend the claims and, where appropriate, the description and drawings, within a period to be specified.</P>
<P class="p250 ft4">(3) If a request for limitation is allowable under paragraph 2, the Examining Division shall communicate this to the requester and invite him to pay the prescribed fee and to file a translation of the amended claims in the official languages of the European Patent Office other than the language of the proceedings, within a period of three months; Rule 82, paragraph 3, first sentence, shall apply <SPAN class="ft5">mutatis mutandis</SPAN>. If the requester performs these acts in due time, the Examining Division shall limit the patent.</P>
<P class="p38 ft4">(4) If the requester does not respond in due time to the communication</P>
<P class="p174 ft76">issued under paragraph 2, or if the request for limitation is not allowable,</P>
<P class="p390 ft4">350</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_351">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t52">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p3 ft8">or if the requester fails to perform the acts required under paragraph 3 in</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td140"><P class="p3 ft13">due time, the Examining Division shall reject the request.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr12 td140"><P class="p949 ft5">Rule 96</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr12 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p35 ft4">Content and form of the amended European patent specification</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr11 td140"><P class="p3 ft8">The amended European patent specification shall include the description,</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr11 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft8">claims and drawings as amended. Rule 73, paragraphs 2 and 3, and Rule</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">74 shall apply.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p1081 ft4">PART VI</P>
<P class="p1125 ft4">IMPLEMENTING REGULATIONS TO PART VI OF THE</P>
<P class="p939 ft4">CONVENTION</P>
<P class="p674 ft4">Chapter I</P>
<P class="p1126 ft4">Appeals procedure</P>
<P class="p884 ft5">Rule 97</P>
<P class="p1014 ft4">Appeal against apportionment and fixing of costs</P>
<P class="p681 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">The apportionment of costs of opposition proceedings cannot be the sole subject of an appeal.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p892 ft7"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft208">A decision fixing the amount of costs of opposition proceedings cannot be appealed unless the amount exceeds that of the fee for appeal.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1062 ft5">Rule 98</P>
<P class="p1117 ft4">Surrender or lapse of the patent</P>
<P class="p672 ft4">The decision of an Opposition Division may be appealed even if the European patent has been surrendered in all the designated Contracting States or has lapsed in all those States.</P>
<P class="p886 ft5">Rule 99</P>
<P class="p726 ft4">Content of the notice of appeal and the statement of grounds</P>
<P class="p480 ft4">(1) The notice of appeal shall contain:</P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft7">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft35">the name and the address of the appellant as provided in Rule 41, paragraph 2(c);</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft18">an indication of the decision impugned; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft18">a request defining the subject of the appeal.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">In the statement of grounds of appeal the appellant shall indicate the reasons for setting aside the decision impugned, or the extent to which it is to be amended, and the facts and evidence on which the appeal is based.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Part III of the Implementing Regulations shall apply </SPAN><SPAN class="ft5">mutatis mutandis </SPAN>to the notice of appeal, the statement of grounds and the documents filed in appeal proceedings.</P>
<P class="p472 ft4">351</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_352">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t93">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td274"><P class="p1127 ft26">Rule 100</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td274"><P class="p1127 ft7">Examination of appeals</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft4">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p672 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft37">Unless otherwise provided, the provisions relating to proceedings before the department which has taken the decision impugned shall apply to appeal proceedings.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">In the examination of the appeal, the Board of Appeal shall invite the parties, as often as necessary, to file observations, within a period to be specified, on communications issued by itself or observations submitted by another party.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft87">If the applicant fails to reply in due time to an invitation under paragraph 2, the Eurpean patent application shall be deemed to be withdrawn, unless the decision impugned was taken by the Legal Division.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p832 ft5">Rule 101</P>
<P class="p778 ft4">Rejection of the appeal as inadmissible</P>
<P class="p673 ft8"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft20">If the appeal does not comply with Articles 106 to 108, Rule 97 or Rule 99, paragraph 1(b) or (c) or paragraph 2, the Board of Appeal shall reject it as inadmissible, unless any deficiency has been remedied before the relevant period under Article 108 has expired.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1128 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft35">If the Board of Appeal notes that the appeal does not comply with Rule 99, paragraph 1(a), it shall communicate this to the appellant and shall invite him to remedy the deficiencies noted within a period to be specified. If the deficiencies are not remedied in due time, the Board of Appeal shall reject the appeal as inadmissible.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p832 ft5">Rule 102</P>
<P class="p1129 ft4">Form of decision of the Board of Appeal</P>
<P class="p672 ft4">The decision shall be authenticated by the Chairman of the Board of Appeal and by the competent employee of the registry of the Board of Appeal, either by their signature or by any other appropriate means. The decision shall contain:</P>
<P class="p174 ft4"><SPAN class="ft7">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft18">a statement that it was delivered by the Board of Appeal;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p283 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft18">the date when the decision was taken;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">the names of the Chairman and of the other members of the Board of Appeal taking part;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft18">the names of the parties and their representatives;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft4"><SPAN class="ft7">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft18">the requests of the parties;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(f)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft18">a summary of the facts;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p283 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(g)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft18">the reasons;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(h)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft37">the order of the Board of Appeal, including, where appropriate, a decision on costs.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p801 ft5">Rule 103</P>
<P class="p1085 ft4">Reimbursement of appeal fees</P>
<P class="p480 ft4">(1) The appeal fee shall be reimbursed</P>
<P class="p518 ft4">352</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_353">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t21">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">(a) in the event of interlocutory revision or where the Board of Appeal</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td140"><P class="p3 ft8">deems an appeal to be allowable, if such reimbursement is equitable by</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">reason of a substantial procedural violation, or</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p451 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft87">if the appeal is withdrawn before the filing of the statement of grounds of appeal and before the period for filing that statement has expired.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p279 ft32">(2) The department whose decision is impugned shall order the reimbursement if it revises its decision and considers reimbursement equitable by reason of a substantial procedural violation. In all other cases, matters of reimbursement shall be decided by the Board of Appeal.</P>
<P class="p950 ft4">Chapter II</P>
<P class="p1130 ft4">Petitions for review by the Enlarged Board of Appeal</P>
<P class="p801 ft5">Rule 104</P>
<P class="p1086 ft4">Further fundamental procedural defects</P>
<P class="p682 ft4">A fundamental procedural defect under Article 112a, paragraph 2(d), may have occurred where the Board of Appeal,</P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft7">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft87">contrary to Article 116, failed to arrange for the holding of oral proceedings requested by the petitioner, or</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">decided on the appeal without deciding on a request relevant to that decision.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1131 ft4">Rule 105</P>
<P class="p758 ft4">Criminal acts</P>
<P class="p481 ft4">A petition for review may be based on Article 112a, paragraph 2(e), if a competent court or authority has finally established that the criminal act occurred; a conviction is not necessary.</P>
<P class="p832 ft5">Rule 106</P>
<P class="p1030 ft4">Obligation to raise objections</P>
<P class="p686 ft32">A petition under Article 112a, paragraph 2(a) to (d), is only admissible where an objection in respect of the procedural defect was raised during the appeal proceedings and dismissed by the Board of Appeal, except where such objection could not be raised during the appeal proceedings.</P>
<P class="p832 ft5">Rule 107</P>
<P class="p1132 ft4">Contents of the petition for review</P>
<P class="p480 ft4">(1) The petition shall contain:</P>
<P class="p1133 ft4"><SPAN class="ft7">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">the name and the address of the petitioner as provided in Rule 41, paragraph 2(c);</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft18">an indication of the decision to be reviewed.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The petition shall indicate the reasons for setting aside the decision of the Board of Appeal, and the facts and evidence on which the petition is based.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p716 ft4">353</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_354">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t61">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">(3) Part III of the Implementing Regulations shall apply <SPAN class="ft26">mutatis mutandis</SPAN></P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td140"><P class="p3 ft13">to the petition for review and the documents filed in the proceedings.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr12 td140"><P class="p679 ft26">Rule 108</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr12 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">Examination of the petition</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p737 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">If the petition does not comply with Article 112a, paragraphs 1, 2 or 4, Rule 106 or Rule 107, paragraph 1(b) or 2, the Enlarged Board of Appeal shall reject it as inadmissible, unless any defect has been remedied before the relevant period under Article 112a, paragraph 4, expires.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p320 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft68">If the Enlarged Board of Appeal notes that the petition does not comply with Rule 107, paragraph 1(a), it shall communicate this to the petitioner and shall invite him to remedy the deficiencies noted within a period to be specified. If the deficiencies are not remedied in due time, the Enlarged Board of Appeal shall reject the petition as inadmissible.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft35">If the petition is allowable, the Enlarged Board of Appeal shall set aside the decision of the Board of Appeal and order the </SPAN><NOBR>re-opening</NOBR> of the proceedings before the Board of Appeal responsible under Rule 12, paragraph 4. The Enlarged Board of Appeal may order that members of the Board of Appeal who participated in taking the decision set aside shall be replaced.</P>
<P class="p832 ft5">Rule 109</P>
<P class="p797 ft4">Procedure in dealing with petitions for</P>
<P class="p1134 ft4">review</P>
<P class="p481 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft175">In proceedings under Article 112a, the provisions relating to proceedings before the Boards of Appeal shall apply, unless otherwise provided. Rule 115, paragraph 1, second sentence, Rule 118, paragraph 2, first sentence, and Rule 132, paragraph 2, shall not apply. The Enlarged Board of Appeal may specify a period deviating from Rule 4, paragraph 1, first sentence.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p283 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft18">The Enlarged Board of Appeal</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft7">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft87">consisting of two legally qualified members and one technically qualified member shall examine all petitions for review and shall reject those which are clearly inadmissible or unallowable; such decision shall require unanimity;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft87">consisting of four legally qualified members and one technically qualified member shall decide on any petition not rejected under sub- paragraph (a).</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4">(3) The Enlarged Board of Appeal composed according to paragraph 2(a) shall decide without the involvement of other parties and on the basis of the petition.</P>
<P class="p832 ft5">Rule 110</P>
<P class="p1060 ft4">Reimbursement of the fee for petitions for review</P>
<P class="p731 ft8">The Enlarged Board of Appeal shall order the reimbursement of the fee for a petition for review if the proceedings before the Boards of Appeal</P>
<P class="p174 ft92">are reopened.</P>
<P class="p390 ft4">354</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_355">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t94">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td275"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td275"><P class="p956 ft13">PART VII</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr11 td275"><P class="p1135 ft4">IMPLEMENTING REGULATIONS TO PART VII OF THE</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr11 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td275"><P class="p956 ft4">CONVENTION</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr11 td275"><P class="p956 ft8">Chapter I</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr11 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr11 td275"><P class="p956 ft8">Decisions and communications of the European Patent Office</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr11 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr12 td275"><P class="p956 ft26">Rule 111</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr12 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td275"><P class="p1135 ft7">Form of decisions</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p737 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">Where oral proceedings are held before the European Patent Office, the decision may be given orally. The decision shall subsequently be put in writing and notified to the parties.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p320 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft189">Decisions of the European Patent Office which are open to appeal shall be reasoned and shall be accompanied by a communication pointing out the possibility of appeal and drawing the attention of the parties to Articles 106 to 108, the text of which shall be attached. The parties may not invoke the omission of the communication.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p832 ft5">Rule 112</P>
<P class="p966 ft4">Noting of loss of rights</P>
<P class="p672 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">If the European Patent Office notes that a loss of rights has occurred, without any decision concerning the refusal of the European patent application or the grant, revocation or maintenance of the European patent, or the taking of evidence, it shall communicate this to the party concerned.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft37">If the party concerned considers that the finding of the European Patent Office is inaccurate, it may, within two months of the communication under paragraph 1, apply for a decision on the matter. The European Patent Office shall take such decision only if it does not share the opinion of the party requesting it; otherwise, it shall inform that party.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p832 ft5">Rule 113</P>
<P class="p872 ft4">Signature, name, seal</P>
<P class="p481 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft37">Any decisions, summonses, notices and communications from the European Patent Office shall be signed by, and state the name of, the employee responsible.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft37">Where a document referred to in paragraph 1 is produced by the employee responsible using a computer, a seal may replace the signature. Where the document is produced automatically by a computer, the employee's name may also be dispensed with. The same shall apply to </SPAN><NOBR>pre-printed</NOBR> notices and communications.</P>
<P class="p1049 ft4">355</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_356">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t89">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td271"><P class="p1136 ft8">Chapter II</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td271"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td271"><P class="p1136 ft4">Observations by third parties</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr12 td271"><P class="p1100 ft26">Rule 114</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr12 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td271"><P class="p1100 ft7">Observations by third parties</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p737 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft37">Any observations by a third party shall be filed in writing in an official language of the European Patent Office and state the grounds on which they are based. Rule 3, paragraph 3, shall apply.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Any such observations shall be communicated to the applicant for or proprietor of the patent, who may comment on them.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1034 ft4">Chapter III</P>
<P class="p1040 ft4">Oral proceedings and taking of evidence</P>
<P class="p801 ft5">Rule 115</P>
<P class="p1137 ft4">Summons to oral proceedings</P>
<P class="p481 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The parties shall be summoned to oral proceedings under Article 116, drawing their attention to paragraph 2 of this Rule. At least two months' notice of the summons shall be given, unless the parties agree to a shorter period.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft35">If a party duly summoned to oral proceedings before the European Patent Office does not appear as summoned, the proceedings may continue without that party.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p801 ft5">Rule 116</P>
<P class="p789 ft4">Preparation of oral proceedings</P>
<P class="p673 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft189">When issuing the summons, the European Patent Office shall draw attention to the points which in its opinion need to be discussed for the purposes of the decision to be taken. At the same time a final date for making written submissions in preparation for the oral proceedings shall be fixed. Rule 132 shall not apply. New facts and evidence presented after that date need not be considered, unless admitted on the grounds that the subject of the proceedings has changed.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p279 ft8"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft20">If the applicant or patent proprietor has been notified of the grounds prejudicing the grant or maintenance of the patent, he may be invited to submit, by the date specified in paragraph 1, second sentence, documents which meet the requirements of the Convention. Paragraph 1, third and fourth sentences, shall apply </SPAN><SPAN class="ft26">mutatis mutandis</SPAN>.</P>
<P class="p1138 ft5">Rule 117</P>
<P class="p690 ft4">Decision on taking of evidence</P>
<P class="p686 ft32">Where the European Patent Office considers it necessary to hear a party, witness or expert, or to carry out an inspection, it shall take a decision to this end, setting out the investigation which it intends to carry out,</P>
<P class="p174 ft135">relevant facts to be proved and the date, time and place of the</P>
<P class="p390 ft4">356</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_357">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t11">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p679 ft7">investigation. If the hearing of a witness or expert is requested by a party,</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">the decision shall specify the period within which the requester must</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft8">make known the name and address of any witness or expert concerned.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr12 td140"><P class="p679 ft26">Rule 118</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr12 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p678 ft7">Summons to give evidence before the European Patent Office</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p680 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">A summons to give evidence before the European Patent Office shall be issued to the parties, witnesses or experts concerned.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">At least two months' notice of a summons issued to a party, witness or expert to testify shall be given, unless they agree to a shorter period. The summons shall contain:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p279 ft4">(a) an extract from the decision under Rule 117, indicating the date, time and place of the investigation ordered and stating the facts in respect of which parties, witnesses or experts are to be heard;</P>
<P class="p837 ft4">(b) the names of the parties and particulars of the rights which the witnesses or experts may invoke under Rule 122, paragraphs 2 to 4;</P>
<P class="p320 ft4">(c) an indication that the party, witness or expert may request to be heard by a competent court of his country of residence under Rule 120, and an invitation to inform the European Patent Office, within a period to be specified, whether he is prepared to appear before it.</P>
<P class="p832 ft5">Rule 119</P>
<P class="p1139 ft4">Examination of evidence before the European Patent Office</P>
<P class="p731 ft8"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft67">The Examining Division, Opposition Division or Board of Appeal may commission one of its members to examine the evidence adduced.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p728 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">Before a party, witness or expert may be heard, he shall be informed that the European Patent Office may request the competent court in the country of residence of the person concerned to </SPAN><NOBR>re-examine</NOBR> his testimony under oath or in an equally binding form.</P>
<P class="p840 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft86">The parties may attend an investigation and may put relevant questions to the testifying party, witness or expert.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p801 ft5">Rule 120</P>
<P class="p740 ft4">Hearing by a competent national court</P>
<P class="p673 ft6">(1) A party, witness or expert who is summoned before the European Patent Office may request the latter to allow him to be heard by a competent court in his country of residence. If this is requested, or if no reply is received within the period specified in the summons, the European Patent Office may, in accordance with Article 131, paragraph 2, request the competent court to hear the person concerned.</P>
<P class="p250 ft4">(2) If a party, witness or expert has been heard by the European Patent Office, the latter may, if it considers it advisable for the testimony to be given under oath or in an equally binding form, issue a request under Article 131, paragraph 2, to the competent court in the country of residence of the person concerned to <NOBR>re-examine</NOBR> his testimony under such conditions.</P>
<P class="p283 ft4">(3) When the European Patent Office requests a competent court to take</P>
<P class="p174 ft76">evidence, it may request the court to take the evidence under oath or in</P>
<P class="p390 ft4">357</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_358">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t11">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p679 ft4">an equally binding form and to permit a member of the department</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td140"><P class="p679 ft7">concerned to attend the hearing and question the party, witness or expert,</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">either through the intermediary of the court or directly.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr12 td140"><P class="p679 ft26">Rule 121</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr12 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p678 ft7">Commissioning of experts</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p680 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The European Patent Office shall decide in what form the opinion of an expert whom it appoints shall be submitted.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft18">The terms of reference of the expert shall include:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft4"><SPAN class="ft7">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft18">a precise description of his task;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft18">the period specified for the submission of his opinion;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p283 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft18">the names of the parties to the proceedings;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft153">particulars of the rights which he may invoke under Rule 122, paragraphs 2 to 4.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft4">(3) A copy of any written opinion shall be submitted to the parties.</P>
<P class="p426 ft4">(4) The parties may object to an expert. The department of the European Patent Office concerned shall decide on the objection.</P>
<P class="p832 ft5">Rule 122</P>
<P class="p111 ft4">Costs of taking of evidence</P>
<P class="p481 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">The taking of evidence by the European Patent Office may be made conditional upon deposit with it, by the party requesting the evidence to be taken, of an amount to be fixed by reference to an estimate of the costs.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft35">Witnesses or experts who are summoned by and appear before the European Patent Office shall be entitled to appropriate reimbursement of expenses for travel and subsistence. An advance for these expenses may be granted to them. This shall also apply to persons who appear before the European Patent Office without being summoned by it and are heard as witnesses or experts.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p279 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft178">Witnesses entitled to reimbursement under paragraph 2 shall also be entitled to appropriate compensation for loss of earnings, and experts to fees for their work. These payments shall be made to the witnesses and experts after they have fulfilled their duties or tasks.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">The Administrative Council shall lay down the details implementing paragraphs 2 and 3. Any amounts due under these provisions shall be paid by the European Patent Office.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p801 ft5">Rule 123</P>
<P class="p1140 ft4">Conservation of evidence</P>
<P class="p673 ft32">(1) On request, the European Patent Office may, without delay, take measures to conserve evidence of facts liable to affect a decision which it may be called upon to take with regard to a European patent application or a European patent, where there is reason to fear that it might subsequently become more difficult or even impossible to take evidence. The date on which the measures are to be taken shall be communicated to the applicant for or proprietor of the patent in sufficient time to allow</P>
<P class="p174 ft135">him to attend. He may ask relevant questions.</P>
<P class="p390 ft4">358</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_359">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t21">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">(2) The request shall contain:</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft8">(a) particulars of the requester as provided in Rule 41, paragraph 2(c);</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft4">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p840 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft175">sufficient identification of the European patent application or European patent in question;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft18">an indication of the facts in respect of which evidence is to be taken;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft18">particulars of the means of giving or obtaining evidence;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p892 ft8"><SPAN class="ft7">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft67">a statement establishing a prima facie case for fearing that it might subsequently become more difficult or impossible to take evidence.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p889 ft4">(3) The request shall not be deemed to have been filed until the prescribed fee has been paid.</P>
<P class="p320 ft6">(4) The decision on the request and any resulting taking of evidence shall be incumbent upon the department of the European Patent Office which would have to take the decision liable to be affected by the facts to be established. The provisions with regard to the taking of evidence in proceedings before the European Patent Office shall apply.</P>
<P class="p832 ft5">Rule 124</P>
<P class="p1141 ft4">Minutes of oral proceedings and of taking of evidence</P>
<P class="p672 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft35">Minutes of oral proceedings and of the taking of evidence shall be drawn up, containing the essentials of the oral proceedings or of the taking of evidence, the relevant statements made by the parties, the testimony of the parties, witnesses or experts and the result of any inspection.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft35">The minutes of the testimony of a witness, expert or party shall be read out, submitted to him, so that he may examine them or, where they are recorded by technical means, played back to him, unless he waives this right. It shall be noted in the minutes that this formality has been carried out and that the person who gave the testimony approved the minutes. If his approval is not given, his objections shall be noted. It is not necessary to play back the minutes or to obtain approval of them if the testimony has been recorded verbatim and directly using technical means.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">The minutes shall be signed by the employee responsible for drawing them up and by the employee who conducted the oral proceedings or taking of evidence.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p283 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft18">The parties shall be provided with a copy of the minutes.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p753 ft4">Chapter IV</P>
<P class="p1142 ft4">Notifications</P>
<P class="p832 ft5">Rule 125</P>
<P class="p903 ft4">General provisions</P>
<P class="p686 ft6">(1) In proceedings before the European Patent Office, any notification to be made shall take the form of the original document, a copy thereof certified by or bearing the seal of the European Patent Office, or a computer <NOBR>print-out</NOBR> bearing such seal. Copies of documents emanating from the parties themselves shall not require such certification.</P>
<P class="p174 ft135">(2) Notification shall be made:</P>
<P class="p390 ft4">359</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_360">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t21">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">(a) by post in accordance with Rule 126;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft8">(b) by technical means of communication in accordance with Rule 127;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft4">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p840 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft153">by delivery on the premises of the European Patent Office in accordance with Rule 128; or</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft18">by public notice in accordance with Rule 129.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft86">Notification through the central industrial property office of a Contracting State shall be made in accordance with the law applicable to that office in national proceedings.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Where a document has reached the addressee, if the European Patent Office is unable to prove that it has been duly notified, or if provisions relating to its notification have not been observed, the document shall be deemed to have been notified on the date established by the European Patent Office as the date of receipt.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p832 ft5">Rule 126</P>
<P class="p8 ft4">Notification by post</P>
<P class="p481 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft87">Decisions incurring a period for appeal or a petition for review, summonses and other such documents as determined by the President of the European Patent Office shall be notified by registered letter with advice of delivery. All other notifications by post shall be by registered letter.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p279 ft32"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft127">Where notification is effected by registered letter, whether or not with advice of delivery, such letter shall be deemed to be delivered to the addressee on the tenth day following its posting, unless it has failed to reach the addressee or has reached him at a later date; in the event of any dispute, it shall be incumbent on the European Patent Office to establish that the letter has reached its destination or to establish the date on which the letter was delivered to the addressee, as the case may be.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft153">Notification by registered letter, whether or not with advice of delivery, shall be deemed to have been effected even if acceptance of the letter has been refused.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p892 ft8"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft63">To the extent that notification by post is not covered by paragraphs 1 to 3, the law of the State in which the notification is made shall apply.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p803 ft5">Rule 127</P>
<P class="p1143 ft4">Notification by technical means of communication</P>
<P class="p481 ft4">Notification may be effected by such technical means of communication as are determined by the President of the European Patent Office and under the conditions laid down by him.</P>
<P class="p832 ft5">Rule 128</P>
<P class="p1103 ft4">Notification by delivery by hand</P>
<P class="p686 ft4">Notification may be effected on the premises of the European Patent Office by delivery by hand of the document to the addressee, who shall on delivery acknowledge its receipt. Notification shall be deemed to have been effected even if the addressee refuses to accept the document or to acknowledge receipt thereof.</P>
<P class="p716 ft4">360</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_361">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t88">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td270"><P class="p916 ft26">Rule 129</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td270"><P class="p916 ft8">Public notification</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft4">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p672 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">If the address of the addressee cannot be established, or if notification in accordance with Rule 126, paragraph 1, has proved to be impossible even after a second attempt, notification shall be effected by public notice.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p279 ft8"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft63">The President of the European Patent Office shall determine how the public notice is to be given and the beginning of the period of one month on expiry of which the document shall be deemed to have been notified.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1144 ft5">Rule 130</P>
<P class="p1085 ft4">Notification to representatives</P>
<P class="p681 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft175">If a representative has been appointed, notifications shall be addressed to him.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft37">If several representatives have been appointed for a single party, notification to any one of them shall be sufficient.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p840 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft35">If several parties have a common representative, notification to the common representative shall be sufficient.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p950 ft4">Chapter V</P>
<P class="p1145 ft4">Time limits</P>
<P class="p832 ft5">Rule 131</P>
<P class="p954 ft4">Calculation of periods</P>
<P class="p681 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">Periods shall be laid down in terms of full years, months, weeks or days.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft35">Computation shall start on the day following the day on which the relevant event occurred, the event being either a procedural step or the expiry of another period. Where the procedural step is a notification, the relevant event shall be the receipt of the document notified, unless otherwise provided.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">When a period is expressed as one year or a certain number of years, it shall expire in the relevant subsequent year in the month having the same name and on the day having the same number as the month and the day on which the said event occurred; if the relevant subsequent month has no day with the same number, the period shall expire on the last day of that month.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p279 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft37">When a period is expressed as one month or a certain number of months, it shall expire in the relevant subsequent month on the day which has the same number as the day on which the said event occurred; if the relevant subsequent month has no day with the same number, the period shall expire on the last day of that month.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p279 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(5)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft37">When a period is expressed as one week or a certain number of weeks, it shall expire in the relevant subsequent week on the day having the same name as the day on which the said event occurred.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p472 ft4">361</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_362">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t95">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td276"><P class="p1000 ft26">Rule 132</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td276"><P class="p1146 ft7">Periods specified by the European Patent Office</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft4">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p672 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Where the Convention or these Implementing Regulations refer to "a period to be specified", this period shall be specified by the European Patent Office.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Unless otherwise provided, a period specified by the European Patent Office shall be neither less than two months nor more than four months; in certain circumstances it may be up to six months. In special cases, the period may be extended upon request, presented before the expiry of such period.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p832 ft5">Rule 133</P>
<P class="p765 ft4">Late receipt of documents</P>
<P class="p481 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft37">A document received late at the European Patent Office shall be deemed to have been received in due time if it was posted, or delivered to a recognised delivery service, in due time before expiry of the period in accordance with the conditions laid down by the President of the European Patent Office, unless the document was received later than three months after expiry of the period.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft153">Paragraph 1 shall apply </SPAN><SPAN class="ft5">mutatis mutandis </SPAN>to any period where transactions are carried out with the competent authority in accordance with Article 75, paragraphs 1(b) or 2(b).</P>
<P class="p832 ft5">Rule 134</P>
<P class="p1147 ft4">Extension of periods</P>
<P class="p686 ft6">(1) If a period expires on a day on which one of the filing offices of the European Patent Office under Rule 35, paragraph 1, is not open for receipt of documents or on which, for reasons other than those referred to in paragraph 2, mail is not delivered there, the period shall extend to the first day thereafter on which all the filing offices are open for receipt of documents and on which mail is delivered. The first sentence shall apply <SPAN class="ft33">mutatis mutandis </SPAN>if documents filed by one of the technical means of communication permitted by the President of the European Patent Office under Rule 2, paragraph 1, cannot be received.</P>
<P class="p279 ft6">(2) If a period expires on a day on which there is a general dislocation in the delivery or transmission of mail in a Contracting State, the period shall extend to the first day following the end of the interval of dislocation for parties which are resident in the State concerned or have appointed representatives with a place of business in that State. Where the State concerned is the State in which the European Patent Office is located, this provision shall apply to all parties and their representatives. This paragraph shall apply <SPAN class="ft33">mutatis mutandis </SPAN>to the period referred to in Rule 37, paragraph 2.</P>
<P class="p233 ft4">(3) Paragraphs 1 and 2 shall apply <SPAN class="ft5">mutatis mutandis </SPAN>where acts are performed with the competent authority in accordance with Article 75, paragraphs 1(b) or 2(b).</P>
<P class="p283 ft4">(4) The date of commencement and the end of any dislocation under</P>
<P class="p174 ft76">paragraph 2 shall be published by the European Patent Office.</P>
<P class="p390 ft4">362</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_363">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t11">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p679 ft4">(5) Without prejudice to paragraphs 1 to 4, a party concerned may</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td140"><P class="p679 ft7">produce evidence that on any of the ten days preceding the day of expiry</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft7">of a period the delivery or transmission of mail was dislocated due to an</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">exceptional occurrence such as a natural disaster, war, civil disorder, a</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td140"><P class="p679 ft4">general breakdown in any of the technical means of communication</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">permitted by the President of the European Patent Office under Rule 2,</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft7">paragraph 1, or other like reasons affecting the locality where the party or</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">his representative resides or has his place of business. If the evidence</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft7">produced satisfies the European Patent Office, a document received late</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">shall be deemed to have been received in due time, provided that the</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td140"><P class="p679 ft7">mailing or the transmission was effected at the latest on the fifth day after</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">the end of the dislocation.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr11 td140"><P class="p679 ft26">Rule 135</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr11 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft7">Further processing</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p737 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Further processing under Article 121, paragraph 1, shall be requested by payment of the prescribed fee within two months of the communication concerning either the failure to observe a time limit or a loss of rights. The omitted act shall be completed within the period for making the request.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p279 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">Further processing shall be ruled out in respect of the periods referred to in Article 121, paragraph 4, and of the periods under Rule 6, paragraph 1, Rule 16, paragraph 1(a), Rule 31, paragraph 2, Rule 40, paragraph 3, Rule 51, paragraphs 2 to 5, Rule 52, paragraphs 2 and 3, Rules 55, 56, 58, 59, 64 and Rule 112, paragraph 2.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p840 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">The department competent to decide on the omitted act shall decide on the request for further processing.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p801 ft5">Rule 136</P>
<P class="p1148 ft4"><NOBR>Re-establishment</NOBR> of rights</P>
<P class="p481 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft175">Any request for </SPAN><NOBR>re-establishment</NOBR> of rights under Article 122, paragraph 1, shall be filed in writing within two months of the removal of the cause of <NOBR>non-compliance</NOBR> with the period, but at the latest within one year of expiry of the unobserved time limit. However, a request for <NOBR>re-establishment</NOBR> of rights in respect of any of the periods specified in Article 87, paragraph 1, and in Article 112a, paragraph 4, shall be filed within two months of expiry of that period. The request for re- establishment of rights shall not be deemed to have been filed until the prescribed fee has been paid.</P>
<P class="p279 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft178">The request shall state the grounds on which it is based and shall set out the facts on which it relies. The omitted act shall be completed within the relevant period for filing the request according to paragraph 1.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p279 ft8"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><NOBR><SPAN class="ft20">Re-establishment</SPAN></NOBR> of rights shall be ruled out in respect of any period for which further processing under Article 121 is available and in respect of the period for requesting <NOBR>re-establishment</NOBR> of rights.</P>
<P class="p450 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">The department competent to decide on the omitted act shall decide on the request for </SPAN><NOBR>re-establishment</NOBR> of rights.</P>
<P class="p472 ft4">363</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_364">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t96">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td277"><P class="p1149 ft8">Chapter VI</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td277"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td277"><P class="p1149 ft8">Amendments and corrections</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr12 td277"><P class="p1149 ft26">Rule 137</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr12 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td277"><P class="p1150 ft7">Amendment of the European patent application</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
