<P class="p737 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft35">Before receiving the European search report, the applicant may not amend the description, claims or drawings of a European patent application unless otherwise provided.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">After receipt of the European search report, the applicant may, of his own volition, amend the description, claims and drawings.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p279 ft32"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft197">After receipt of the first communication from the Examining Division, the applicant may, of his own volition, amend once the description, claims and drawings, provided that the amendment is filed at the same time as the reply to the communication. No further amendment may be made without the consent of the Examining Division.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">Amended claims may not relate to unsearched </SPAN><NOBR>subject-matter</NOBR> which does not combine with the originally claimed invention or group of inventions to form a single general inventive concept.</P>
<P class="p801 ft5">Rule 138</P>
<P class="p1151 ft4">Different claims, description and drawings for different States</P>
<P class="p672 ft4">If the European Patent Office is informed of the existence of a prior right under Article 139, paragraph 2, the European patent application or European patent may, for such State or States, contain claims and, where appropriate, a description and drawings which are different from those for the other designated States.</P>
<P class="p832 ft5">Rule 139</P>
<P class="p1152 ft4">Correction of errors in documents filed with the European Patent Office</P>
<P class="p481 ft4">Linguistic errors, errors of transcription and mistakes in any document filed with the European Patent Office may be corrected on request. However, if the request for such correction concerns the description, claims or drawings, the correction must be obvious in the sense that it is immediately evident that nothing else would have been intended than what is offered as the correction.</P>
<P class="p832 ft5">Rule 140</P>
<P class="p1153 ft4">Correction of errors in decisions</P>
<P class="p672 ft4">In decisions of the European Patent Office, only linguistic errors, errors of transcription and obvious mistakes may be corrected.</P>
<P class="p1154 ft4">364</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_365">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t61">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p678 ft8">Chapter VII</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td140"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft4">Information on prior art</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr12 td140"><P class="p679 ft26">Rule 141</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr12 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">Information on prior art</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr11 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">The European Patent Office may invite the applicant to provide, within a</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr11 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">period to be specified, information on prior art taken into consideration</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft4">in the examination of national or regional patent applications and</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td140"><P class="p678 ft7">concerning an invention to which the European patent application relates.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr11 td140"><P class="p678 ft8">Chapter VIII</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr11 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr11 td140"><P class="p679 ft4">Interruption of proceedings</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr11 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr12 td140"><P class="p679 ft26">Rule 142</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr12 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p678 ft7">Interruption of proceedings</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p697 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft18">Proceedings before the European Patent Office shall be interrupted:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4">(a) in the event of the death or legal incapacity of the applicant for or proprietor of a European patent or of the person authorised by national law to act on his behalf. To the extent that the above events do not affect the authorisation of a representative appointed under Article 134, proceedings shall be interrupted only on application by such representative;</P>
<P class="p250 ft4">(b) in the event of the applicant for or proprietor of a patent, as a result of some action taken against his property, being prevented by legal reasons from continuing the proceedings;</P>
<P class="p233 ft4">(c) in the event of the death or legal incapacity of the representative of an applicant for or proprietor of a patent, or of his being prevented for legal reasons resulting from action taken against his property from continuing the proceedings.</P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">When, in the cases referred to in paragraph 1(a) or (b), the European Patent Office has been informed of the identity of the person authorised to continue the proceedings, it shall notify such person and, where applicable, any third party, that the proceedings will be resumed as from a specified date.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p279 ft32"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft185">In the case referred to in paragraph 1(c), the proceedings shall be resumed when the European Patent Office has been informed of the appointment of a new representative of the applicant or when the Office has informed the other parties of the appointment of a new representative of the proprietor of the patent. If, three months after the beginning of the interruption of the proceedings, the European Patent Office has not been informed of the appointment of a new representative, it shall communicate to the applicant for or proprietor of the patent:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4">(a) where Article 133, paragraph 2, is applicable, that the European patent application will be deemed to be withdrawn or the European patent will be revoked if the information is not submitted within two months of this communication; or</P>
<P class="p716 ft4">365</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_366">


<DIV>
<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p263 ft7"><SPAN class="ft8">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft201">otherwise, that the proceedings will be resumed with the applicant for or proprietor of the patent as from the notification of this communication.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p264 ft6">(4) Any periods, other than those for requesting examination and paying renewal fees, in force at the date of interruption of the proceedings, shall begin again as from the day on which the proceedings are resumed. If such date is less than two months before the end of the period within which the request for examination must be filed, such a request may be filed within two months of such date.</P>
<P class="p1155 ft4">Chapter IX</P>
<P class="p1156 ft4">Information to the public</P>
<P class="p1157 ft5">Rule 143</P>
<P class="p1151 ft4">Entries in the European Patent Register</P>
<P class="p139 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft18">The European Patent Register shall contain the following entries:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p71 ft4">(a) number of the European patent application;</P>
<P class="p339 ft4">(b) date of filing of the application;</P>
<P class="p71 ft4">(c) title of the invention;</P>
<P class="p71 ft4">(d) classification symbols assigned to the application;</P>
<P class="p71 ft4">(e) the Contracting States designated;</P>
<P class="p393 ft4">(f) particulars of the applicant for or proprietor of the patent as provided in Rule 41, paragraph 2(c);</P>
<P class="p493 ft8">(g) family name, given names and address of the inventor designated by the applicant for or proprietor of the patent, unless he has waived his right to be mentioned under Rule 20, paragraph 1;</P>
<P class="p1158 ft4">(h) particulars of the representative of the applicant for or proprietor of the patent as provided in Rule 41, paragraph 2(d); in the case of several representatives only the particulars of the representative first named, followed by the words "and others" and, in the case of an association referred to in Rule 152, paragraph 11, only the name and address of the association;</P>
<P class="p339 ft8">(i) priority data (date, State and file number of the previous application);</P>
<P class="p267 ft4">(j) in the event of a division of the application, the numbers of all the divisional applications;</P>
<P class="p493 ft8">(k) in the case of a divisional application or a new application under Article 61, paragraph 1(b), the information referred to in <NOBR>sub-paragraphs</NOBR> (a), (b) and (i) with regard to the earlier application;</P>
<P class="p1159 ft4">(l) date of publication of the application and, where appropriate, date of the separate publication of the European search report;</P>
<P class="p71 ft4">(m) date of filing of the request for examination;</P>
<P class="p267 ft4">(n) date on which the application is refused, withdrawn or deemed to be withdrawn;</P>
<P class="p71 ft8">(o) date of publication of the mention of the grant of the European patent;</P>
<P class="p105 ft4">(p) date of lapse of the European patent in a Contracting State during the opposition period and, where appropriate, pending a final decision on opposition;</P>
<P class="p339 ft4">(q) date of filing opposition;</P>
<P class="p71 ft4">(r) date and purport of the decision on opposition;</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p515 ft17">Prop. 2006/07:56 Bilaga 7</P>
<P class="p516 ft4">366</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_367">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t21">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p3 ft8">(s) dates of stay and resumption of proceedings in the cases referred to in</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">Rules 14 and 78;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft4">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p840 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(t)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft153">dates of interruption and resumption of proceedings in the case referred to in Rule 142;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(u)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft37">date of </SPAN><NOBR>re-establishment</NOBR> of rights where an entry has been made under <NOBR>sub-paragraphs</NOBR> (n) or (r);</P>
<P class="p283 ft4"><SPAN class="ft4">(v)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft18">the filing of a request for conversion under Article 135, paragraph 3;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft4">(w)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft37">rights and transfer of such rights relating to an application or a European patent where these Implementing Regulations provide that they shall be recorded.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft4">(x)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft87">date and purport of the decision on the request for limitation or revocation of the European patent;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p840 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(y)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">date and purport of the decision of the Enlarged Board of Appeal on the petition for review.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4">(2) The President of the European Patent Office may decide that entries other than those referred to in paragraph 1 shall be made in the European Patent Register.</P>
<P class="p832 ft5">Rule 144</P>
<P class="p894 ft4">Parts of the file excluded from inspection</P>
<P class="p681 ft4">The parts of the file excluded from inspection under Article 128, paragraph 4, shall be:</P>
<P class="p837 ft8"><SPAN class="ft7">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft20">the documents relating to the exclusion of or objections to members of the Boards of Appeal or of the Enlarged Board of Appeal;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p379 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft37">draft decisions and notices, and all other documents, used for the preparation of decisions and notices, which are not communicated to the parties;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft87">the designation of the inventor, if he has waived his right to be mentioned under Rule 20, paragraph 1;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">any other document excluded from inspection by the President of the European Patent Office on the ground that such inspection would not serve the purpose of informing the public about the European patent application or the European patent.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p801 ft5">Rule 145</P>
<P class="p1160 ft4">Procedures for the inspection of files</P>
<P class="p686 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft35">Inspection of the files of European patent applications and patents shall either be of the original document, or of copies thereof, or of technical means of storage if the files are stored in this way.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft87">The President of the European Patent Office shall determine all fileinspection arrangements, including the circumstances in which an administrative fee is payable.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p832 ft5">Rule 146</P>
<P class="p722 ft4">Communication of information contained in the files</P>
<P class="p682 ft4">Subject to the restrictions laid down in Article 128, paragraphs 1 to 4, and in Rule 144, the European Patent Office may, upon request,</P>
<P class="p174 ft76">communicate information concerning any file relating to a European</P>
<P class="p390 ft4">367</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_368">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t11">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p679 ft4">patent application or European patent, subject to the payment of an</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td140"><P class="p679 ft7">administrative fee. However, the European Patent Office may refer to the</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft8">option of file inspection where it deems this to be appropriate in view of</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">the quantity of information to be supplied.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr12 td140"><P class="p679 ft26">Rule 147</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr12 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p679 ft7">Constitution, maintenance and preservation of files</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p1161 ft8"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft67">The European Patent Office shall constitute, maintain and preserve files relating to all European patent applications and patents.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p994 ft8"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft63">The President of the European Patent Office shall determine the form in which these files shall be constituted, maintained and preserved.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p450 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Documents incorporated in an electronic file shall be considered to be originals.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Any files shall be preserved for at least five years from the end of the year in which:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft4">(a) the application is refused or withdrawn or is deemed to be withdrawn;</P>
<P class="p174 ft4">(b) the patent is revoked by the European Patent Office; or</P>
<P class="p840 ft4">(c) the patent or the corresponding protection under Article 63, paragraph 2, lapses in the last of the designated States.</P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(5)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Without prejudice to paragraph 4, files relating to applications which have given rise to divisional applications under Article 76 or new applications under Article 61, paragraph 1(b), shall be preserved for at least the same period as the files relating to any one of these last applications. The same shall apply to files relating to any resulting European patents.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1071 ft4">Chapter X</P>
<P class="p1123 ft4">Legal and administrative <NOBR>co-operation</NOBR></P>
<P class="p832 ft5">Rule 148</P>
<P class="p1162 ft4">Communications between the European Patent Office and the authorities</P>
<P class="p1084 ft4">of the Contracting States</P>
<P class="p686 ft32"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft127">Communications between the European Patent Office and the central industrial property offices of the Contracting States which arise out of the application of this Convention shall be effected directly between these authorities. Communications between the European Patent Office and the courts or other authorities of the Contracting States may be effected through the intermediary of the said central industrial property offices.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Expenditure in respect of communications under paragraph 1 shall be borne by the authority making the communications, which shall be exempt from fees.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p832 ft5">Rule 149</P>
<P class="p174 ft4">Inspection of files by or via courts or authorities of the Contracting States</P>
<P class="p731 ft17">(1) Inspection of the files of European patent applications or of European patents by courts or authorities of the Contracting States shall be of the</P>
<P class="p174 ft92">original documents or of copies thereof; Rule 145 shall not apply.</P>
<P class="p390 ft4">368</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_369">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t52">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p3 ft8">(2) Courts or Public Prosecutors' offices of the Contracting States may, in</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td140"><P class="p3 ft13">the course of their proceedings, communicate to third parties files or</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft8">copies thereof transmitted to them by the European Patent Office. Such</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">communications shall be effected in accordance with Article 128 and</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">shall not be subject to any fee.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">The European Patent Office shall, when transmitting the files, draw attention to the restrictions which may, under Article 128, paragraphs 1 and 4, apply to file inspection by third parties.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p832 ft5">Rule 150</P>
<P class="p1030 ft4">Procedure for letters rogatory</P>
<P class="p673 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">Each Contracting State shall designate a central authority to receive letters rogatory issued by the European Patent Office and to transmit them to the court or authority competent to execute them.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft37">The European Patent Office shall draw up letters rogatory in the language of the competent court or authority or shall attach to such letters rogatory a translation into that language.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p279 ft17"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft172">Subject to paragraphs 5 and 6, the competent court or authority shall apply national law as to the procedures to be followed in executing such requests and, in particular, as to the appropriate measures of compulsion.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p451 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">If the court or authority to which the letters rogatory are transmitted is not competent to execute them, the letters rogatory shall be sent forthwith to the central authority referred to in paragraph 1. That authority shall transmit the letters rogatory either to the competent court or authority in that State, or to the European Patent Office where no court or authority is competent in that State.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p279 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(5)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft178">The European Patent Office shall be informed of the time when, and the place where, the enquiry or other legal measure is to take place and shall inform the parties, witnesses and experts concerned.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p279 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(6)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">If so requested by the European Patent Office, the competent court or authority shall permit the attendance of members of the department concerned and allow them to question any person giving evidence either directly or through the competent court or authority.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p320 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(7)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft199">The execution of letters rogatory shall not give rise to any reimbursement of fees or costs of any nature. Nevertheless, the State in which letters rogatory are executed has the right to require the Organisation to reimburse any fees paid to experts or interpreters and the costs arising from the procedure under paragraph 6.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p279 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(8)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft189">If the law applied by the competent court or authority obliges the parties to secure evidence and the competent court or authority is not able itself to execute the letters rogatory, that court or authority may, with the consent of the European Patent Office, appoint a suitable person to do so. When seeking such consent, the competent court or authority shall indicate the approximate costs which would result from this procedure. If the European Patent Office gives its consent, the Organisation shall reimburse any costs incurred; otherwise, the Organisation shall not be liable for such costs.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p414 ft4">369</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_370">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t97">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td278"><P class="p868 ft8">Chapter XI</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td278"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td278"><P class="p1163 ft8">Representation</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr12 td278"><P class="p868 ft26">Rule 151</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr12 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td278"><P class="p868 ft7">Appointment of a common representative</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p445 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft68">If there is more than one applicant and the request for grant of a European patent does not name a common representative, the applicant first named in the request shall be deemed to be the common representative. However, if one of the applicants is obliged to appoint a professional representative, this representative shall be deemed to be the common representative, unless the applicant first named has appointed a professional representative. The same shall apply to third parties acting in common in filing a notice of opposition or intervention and to joint proprietors of a European patent.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft37">If the European patent application is transferred to more than one person, and such persons have not appointed a common representative, paragraph 1 shall apply </SPAN><SPAN class="ft5">mutatis mutandis</SPAN>. If such application is not possible, the European Patent Office shall invite such persons to appoint a common representative within a period to be specified. If this invitation is not complied with, the European Patent Office shall appoint the common representative.</P>
<P class="p803 ft5">Rule 152</P>
<P class="p555 ft4">Authorisations</P>
<P class="p481 ft4">(1) The President of the European Patent Office shall determine the cases in which a signed authorisation shall be filed by representatives acting before the European Patent Office.</P>
<P class="p250 ft4">(2) Where a representative fails to file such an authorisation, the European Patent Office shall invite him to do so within a period to be specified. The authorisation may cover one or more European patent applications or European patents and shall be filed in the corresponding number of copies.</P>
<P class="p233 ft4">(3) Where the requirements of Article 133, paragraph 2, have not been satisfied, the same period shall be specified for the appointment of a representative and the filing of the authorisation.</P>
<P class="p250 ft4">(4) A general authorisation may be filed enabling a representative to act in respect of all the patent transactions of a party. A single copy shall suffice.</P>
<P class="p233 ft4">(5) The President of the European Patent Office may determine the form and content of:</P>
<P class="p250 ft4">(a) an authorisation relating to the representation of persons under Article 133, paragraph 2;</P>
<P class="p174 ft4">(b) a general authorisation.</P>
<P class="p320 ft6">(6) If a required authorisation is not filed in due time, any procedural steps taken by the representative, other than the filing of a European patent application, shall be deemed not to have been taken, without prejudice to any other legal consequences provided for by this</P>
<P class="p174 ft135">Convention.</P>
<P class="p390 ft4">370</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_371">


<DIV>
<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p71 ft8"><SPAN class="ft7">(7)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft146">Paragraphs 2 and 4 shall apply to the withdrawal of an authorisation.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p105 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(8)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft175">A representative shall be deemed to be authorised until the termination of his authorisation has been communicated to the European Patent Office.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p138 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(9)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft37">Unless it expressly provides otherwise, an authorisation shall not terminate </SPAN><NOBR>vis-à-vis</NOBR> the European Patent Office upon the death of the person who gave it.</P>
<P class="p105 ft4"><SPAN class="ft7">(10)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft153">If a party appoints several representatives, they may act either jointly or singly, notwithstanding any provisions to the contrary in the communication of their appointment or in the authorisation.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p138 ft4"><SPAN class="ft7">(11)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft153">The authorisation of an association of representatives shall be deemed to be an authorisation of any representative who can provide evidence that he practises within that association.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1157 ft5">Rule 153</P>
<P class="p896 ft4">Attorney evidentiary privilege</P>
<P class="p504 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft87">Where advice is sought from a professional representative in his capacity as such, all communications between the professional representative and his client or any other person, relating to that purpose and falling under Article 2 of the Regulation on discipline for professional representatives, are permanently privileged from disclosure in proceedings before the European Patent Office, unless such privilege is expressly waived by the client.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p852 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft87">Such privilege from disclosure shall apply, in particular, to any communication or document relating to:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p71 ft4">(a) the assessment of the patentability of an invention;</P>
<P class="p71 ft4">(b) the preparation or prosecution of a European patent application;</P>
<P class="p898 ft8">(c) any opinion relating to the validity, scope of protection or infringement of a European patent or a European patent application.</P>
<P class="p1164 ft5">Rule 154</P>
<P class="p1165 ft4">Amendment of the list of professional representatives</P>
<P class="p483 ft32"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft185">The entry of a professional representative shall be deleted from the list of professional representatives if he so requests or if, despite repeated reminders, he fails to pay the annual subscription to the Institute before the end of September of the year for which the subscription is due.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p138 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft35">Without prejudice to any disciplinary measures taken under Article 134a, paragraph 1(c), the entry of a professional representative may be deleted ex officio only:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p71 ft4">(a) in the event of his death or legal incapacity;</P>
<P class="p846 ft8">(b) where he is no longer a national of one of the Contracting States, unless he was granted an exemption under Article 134, paragraph 7(a);</P>
<P class="p852 ft4">(c) where he no longer has his place of business or employment within one of the Contracting States.</P>
<P class="p138 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">Any person entered on the list of professional representatives under Article 134, paragraphs (2) or (3), whose entry has been deleted shall, upon request, be </SPAN><NOBR>re-entered</NOBR> on that list if the conditions for deletion no longer exist.</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p515 ft17">Prop. 2006/07:56 Bilaga 7</P>
<P class="p516 ft4">371</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_372">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t98">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr8 td279"><P class="p1166 ft4">PART VIII</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr8 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td279"><P class="p3 ft12">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td279"><P class="p1166 ft4">IMPLEMENTING REGULATIONS TO PART VIII OF THE</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td279"><P class="p1166 ft4">CONVENTION</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr12 td279"><P class="p1166 ft26">Rule 155</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr12 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td279"><P class="p1167 ft7">Filing and transmission of the request for conversion</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p737 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">The request for conversion referred to in Article 135, paragraph 1(a) or (b), shall be filed within three months of the withdrawal of the European patent application, or of the communication that the application is deemed to be withdrawn, or of the decision refusing the application or revoking the European patent. The effect of the European patent application under Article 66 shall lapse if the request is not filed in due time.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">When transmitting the request for conversion to the central industrial property offices of the Contracting States specified in the request, the central industrial property office concerned or the European Patent Office shall attach to the request a copy of the file relating to the European patent application or European patent.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft35">Article 135, paragraph 4, shall apply if the request for conversion referred to in Article 135, paragraphs 1(a) or (2), is not transmitted before the expiry of a period of twenty months from the date of filing or, if priority has been claimed, the date of priority.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p832 ft5">Rule 156</P>
<P class="p1010 ft4">Information to the public in the event of conversion</P>
<P class="p481 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">The documents accompanying the request for conversion under Rule 155, paragraph 2, shall be made available to the public by the central industrial property office under the same conditions and to the same extent as documents relating to national proceedings.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft37">The printed specification of the national patent resulting from the conversion of a European patent application shall mention that application.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p950 ft4">PART IX</P>
<P class="p1115 ft4">IMPLEMENTING REGULATIONS TO PART X OF THE</P>
<P class="p939 ft4">CONVENTION</P>
<P class="p801 ft5">Rule 157</P>
<P class="p1015 ft4">The European Patent Office as a receiving Office</P>
<P class="p686 ft6">(1) The European Patent Office shall be competent to act as a receiving Office within the meaning of the PCT if the applicant is a resident or national of a Contracting State to this Convention and to the PCT. Without prejudice to paragraph 3, if the applicant chooses the European Patent Office as a receiving Office, the international application shall be filed directly with the European Patent Office. Article 75, paragraph 2,</P>
<P class="p174 ft136"><SPAN class="ft135">shall apply </SPAN>mutatis mutandis<SPAN class="ft135">.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p390 ft4">372</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_373">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t61">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p3 ft8">(2) Where the European Patent Office acts as a receiving Office under</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td140"><P class="p3 ft8">the PCT, the international application shall be filed in English, French or</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft8">German. The President of the European Patent Office may determine that</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">the international application and any related item shall be filed in more</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">than one copy.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft86">If an international application is filed with an authority of a Contracting State for transmittal to the European Patent Office as the receiving Office, the Contracting State shall ensure that the application reaches the European Patent Office not later than two weeks before the end of the thirteenth month from filing or, if priority is claimed, from the date of priority.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p840 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft37">The transmittal fee for the international application shall be paid within one month of filing the application.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p832 ft5">Rule 158</P>
<P class="p1168 ft4">The European Patent Office as anInternational Searching Authority or</P>
<P class="p996 ft4">International Preliminary Examining Authority</P>
<P class="p672 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft86">In the case of Article 17, paragraph 3(a) PCT, an additional international search fee shall be paid for each further invention for which an international search is to be carried out.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">In the case of Article 34, paragraph 3(a) PCT, an additional fee for international preliminary examination shall be paid for each further invention for which the international preliminary examination is to be carried out.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p279 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft189">Where an additional fee has been paid under protest, the European Patent Office shall examine the protest in accordance with Rule 40.2(c) to (e) or Rule 68.3(c) to (e) PCT, subject to payment of the prescribed protest fee. Further details concerning the procedure shall be determined by the President of the European Patent Office.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p832 ft5">Rule 159</P>
<P class="p794 ft4">The European Patent Office as a designated or elected Office –</P>
<P class="p738 ft4">Requirements for entry into the European phase</P>
<P class="p481 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft87">In respect of an international application under Article 153, the applicant shall perform the following acts within </SPAN><NOBR>thirty-one</NOBR> months from the date of filing of the application or, if priority has been claimed, from the priority date:</P>
<P class="p840 ft4"><SPAN class="ft7">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft19">supply, where applicable, the translation of the international application required under Article 153, paragraph 4;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">specify the application documents, as originally filed or as amended, on which the European grant procedure is to be based;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p283 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft18">pay the filing fee provided for in Article 78, paragraph 2;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft37">pay the designation fees if the period under Rule 39 has expired earlier;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft7">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">pay the search fee, where a supplementary European search report has to be drawn up;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p840 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(f)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft37">file the request for examination provided for in Article 94, if the period under Rule 70, paragraph 1, has expired earlier;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p518 ft4">373</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_374">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t61">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td140"><P class="p3 ft8">(g) pay the renewal fee in respect of the third year provided for in Article</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td140"><P class="p3 ft8">86, paragraph 1, if the fee has fallen due earlier under Rule 51, paragraph</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td140"><P class="p3 ft4">1;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p889 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(h)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft87">file, where applicable, the certificate of exhibition referred to in Article 55, paragraph 2, and Rule 25.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4">(2) The Examining Division shall be competent to take decisions of the European Patent Office under Article 25, paragraph 2(a) PCT.</P>
<P class="p832 ft5">Rule 160</P>
<P class="p1169 ft4">Consequences of <NOBR>non-fulfilment</NOBR> of certain requirements</P>
<P class="p686 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft178">If either the translation of the international application or the request for examination is not filed in due time, or if the filing fee or the search fee is not paid in due time, or if no designation fee is paid in due time, the European patent application shall be deemed to be withdrawn.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft37">The designation of any Contracting State in respect of which the designation fee has not been paid in due time shall be deemed to be withdrawn.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft153">If the European Patent Office notes that the application or the designation of a Contracting State is deemed to be withdrawn under paragraph 1 or 2, it shall communicate this to the applicant. Rule 112, paragraph 2, shall apply </SPAN><SPAN class="ft5">mutatis mutandis</SPAN>.</P>
<P class="p801 ft5">Rule 161</P>
<P class="p1170 ft4">Amendment of the application</P>
<P class="p481 ft4">Without prejudice to Rule 137, paragraphs 2 to 4, the application may be amended once, within one month from a communication informing the applicant accordingly. The application as amended shall serve as the basis for any supplementary search which has to be performed under Article 153, paragraph 7.</P>
<P class="p832 ft5">Rule 162</P>
<P class="p872 ft4">Claims incurring fees</P>
<P class="p481 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">If the application documents on which the European grant procedure is to be based comprise more than ten claims, a claims fee shall be paid for the eleventh and each subsequent claim within the period under Rule 159, paragraph 1.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p279 ft32"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft185">If the claims fees are not paid in due time, they may still be paid within one month from a communication concerning the failure to observe the time limit. If within this period amended claims are filed, the claims fees due shall be computed on the basis of such amended claims.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p233 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft37">Any claims fees paid within the period under paragraph 1 and in excess of those due under paragraph 2, second sentence, shall be refunded.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft27">Where a claims fee is not paid in due time, the claim concerned shall be deemed to be abandoned.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1049 ft4">374</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_375">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t99">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td280"><P class="p1171 ft26">Rule 163</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td280"><P class="p1172 ft7">Examination of certain formal requirements by the European Patent</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td280"><P class="p1171 ft8">Office</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p737 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft35">Where the designation of the inventor under Rule 19, paragraph 1, has not yet been made within the period under Rule 159, paragraph 1, the European Patent Office shall invite the applicant to make the designation within two months.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p279 ft6"><SPAN class="ft8">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft189">Where the priority of an earlier application is claimed and the file number of the previous application or the copy thereof provided for in Rule 52, paragraph 1, and Rule 53 have not yet been submitted within the period under Rule 159, paragraph 1, the European Patent Office shall invite the applicant to furnish that number or copy within two months. Rule 53, paragraphs 2 and 3, shall apply.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft35">Where, at the expiry of the period under Rule 159, paragraph 1, a sequence listing complying with the standard provided for in the Administrative Instructions under the PCT is not available to the European Patent Office, the applicant shall be invited to file a sequence listing complying with the rules laid down by the President of the European Patent Office within two months. Rule 30, paragraphs 2 and 3, shall apply </SPAN><SPAN class="ft5">mutatis mutandis</SPAN>.</P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">Where, at the expiry of the period under Rule 159, paragraph 1, the address, the nationality or the State in which his residence or principal place of business is located is missing in respect of any applicant, the European Patent Office shall invite the applicant to furnish these indications within two months.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(5)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">Where, at the expiry of the period under Rule 159, paragraph 1, the requirements of Article 133, paragraph 2, have not been satisfied, the European Patent Office shall invite the applicant to appoint a professional representative within two months.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p250 ft4"><SPAN class="ft8">(6)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">If the deficiencies noted under paragraphs 1, 4 or 5 are not corrected in due time, the European patent application shall be refused. If the deficiency noted under paragraph 2 is not corrected in due time, the right of priority shall be lost for the application.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p801 ft5">Rule 164</P>
<P class="p1173 ft4">Consideration of unity by the European Patent Office</P>
<P class="p686 ft4">(1) Where the European Patent Office considers that the application documents which are to serve as the basis for the supplementary search do not meet the requirements of unity of invention, a supplementary search report shall be drawn up on those parts of the application which relate to the invention, or the group of inventions within the meaning of Article 82, first mentioned in the claims.</P>
<P class="p279 ft6">(2) Where the examining division finds that the application documents on which the European grant procedure is to be based do not meet the requirements of unity of invention, or protection is sought for an invention not covered by the international search report or, as the case may be, by the supplementary search report, it shall invite the applicant to limit the application to one invention covered by the international</P>
<P class="p174 ft135">search report or the supplementary search report.</P>
<P class="p390 ft4">375</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_376">


<P class="p14 ft4">Prop. 2006/07:56</P>
<P class="p1174 ft5">Rule 165<SPAN style="padding-left:232px;"><SPAN class="ft4">Bilaga 7</SPAN></SPAN></P>
<P class="p1168 ft4">The <NOBR>Euro-PCT</NOBR> application as conflicting application under Article 54,</P>
<P class="p885 ft4">paragraph 3</P>
<P class="p481 ft4">A <NOBR>Euro-PCT</NOBR> application shall be considered as comprised in the state of the art under Article 54, paragraph 3, if in addition to the conditions laid down in Article 153, paragraph 3 or 4, the filing fee under Rule 159, paragraph 1(c) has been paid.</P>
<P class="p1175 ft4">376</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_377">


<DIV id="id_1">
<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t59">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td281"></TD>
	<TD rowspan=2 class="tr40 td227"><P class="p3 ft1">Patenträttskonventionen</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td282"><P class="p1176 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr33 td281"></TD>
	<TD rowspan=2 class="tr5 td282"><P class="p1176 ft13">Bilaga 8</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr34 td281"></TD>
	<TD class="tr34 td227"><P class="p3 ft167">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr30 td281"></TD>
	<TD class="tr30 td227"><P class="p1177 ft4">Article 1</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr30 td282"><P class="p1178 ft4">Artikel 1</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td281"></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td227"><P class="p1179 ft26">Abbreviated Expressions</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td282"><P class="p1178 ft5">Förkortade begrepp</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<DIV id="id_2_1">
<P class="p81 ft8">For the purposes of this Treaty, unless expressly stated otherwise:</P>
<P class="p1180 ft4">(i)“Office” means the authority of a Contracting Party entrusted with the granting of patents or with other matters covered by this Treaty;</P>
<P class="p1181 ft6">(ii)“application” means an applica- tion for the grant of a patent, as referred to in Article 3;</P>
<P class="p1182 ft4">(iii)“patent” means a patent as referred to in Article 3;</P>
<P class="p1183 ft4">(iv)references to a “person” shall be construed as including, in particular, a natural person and a legal entity;</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2_2">
<P class="p185 ft4">I detta fördrag har följande utryck nedan angivna betydelse om annat ej uttryckligen anges:</P>
<P class="p1184 ft4">i)”patentmyndighet”: den myndig- het hos en fördragsslutande part som har till uppgift att meddela patent eller handha andra ange- lägenheter som omfattas av detta fördrag.</P>
<P class="p1185 ft4">ii)”ansökan”: en patentansökan som avses i artikel 3.</P>
<P class="p1186 ft4">iii)”patent”: ett patent som avses i artikel 3.</P>
<P class="p1185 ft4">iv)”person”: alla personer, såväl fysiska som juridiska personer.</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_3">
<DIV id="id_3_1">
<P class="p1187 ft6">(v)“communication” means any application, or any request, decla- ration, document, correspondence or other information relating to an application or patent, whether relat- ing to a procedure under this Treaty or not, which is filed with the Office;</P>
<P class="p1188 ft6">(vi)“records of the Office” means the collection of information maintained by the Office, relating to and including the applications filed with, and the patents granted by, that Office or another authority with effect for the Contracting Party concerned, irrespective of the medium in which such information is maintained;</P>
<P class="p245 ft4">(vii)“recordation” means any act of</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_3_2">
<P class="p857 ft4">v)”kommunikation”: ansökan eller begäran, förklaring, handling,</P>
<P class="p853 ft4">korrespondens eller annan information som rör en ansökan eller ett patent och ges in till patentmyndigheten, oavsett om det sker inom ramen för ett förfarande enligt detta fördrag.</P>
<P class="p864 ft6">vi)”patentmyndighetens register”: den samlade information som för- varas av patentmyndigheten och som omfattar eller rör ansökningar som givits in till eller patent som meddelats av patentmyndigheten eller någon annan myndighet med verkan för den berörda fördrags- slutande parten, oberoende av i vilken form sådan information för- varas.</P>
<P class="p635 ft4">vii)”införing”: alla sätt varigenom</P>
<P class="p487 ft4">377</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_378">


<DIV id="id_1">
<DIV id="id_1_1">
<P class="p196 ft4">including information in the records of the Office;</P>
<P class="p1184 ft6">(viii)“applicant” means the person whom the records of the Office show, pursuant to the applicable law, as the person who is applying for the patent, or as another person who is filing or prosecuting the application;</P>
<P class="p1189 ft4">(ix)“owner” means the person whom the records of the Office show as the owner of the patent;</P>
<P class="p1189 ft32">(x)“representative” means a repre- sentative under the applicable law;</P>
<P class="p1182 ft4">(xi)“signature” means any means of <NOBR>self-identification;</NOBR></P>
<P class="p1183 ft4">(xii)“a language accepted by the Office” means any one language accepted by the Office for the relevant procedure before the Office;</P>
<P class="p1181 ft6">(xiii)“translation” means a transla- tion into a language or, where appropriate, a transliteration into an alphabet or character set, accepted by the Office;</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_1_2">
<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t100">
<TR>
	<TD colspan=4 class="tr9 td58"><P class="p3 ft4">information tillförs patentmyndig-</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td43"><P class="p3 ft8">hetens register.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td10"><P class="p3 ft12">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td84"><P class="p3 ft12">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td192"><P class="p3 ft12">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 8</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD colspan=4 class="tr11 td58"><P class="p3 ft4">viii)”sökande”: den person, som i</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr11 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD colspan=4 class="tr6 td58"><P class="p3 ft4">patentmyndighetens register, i en-</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD colspan=4 class="tr4 td58"><P class="p3 ft4">lighet med tillämplig nationell lag,</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD colspan=4 class="tr4 td58"><P class="p3 ft8">anges som den som söker patentet</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD colspan=4 class="tr4 td58"><P class="p3 ft4">eller som ger in eller fullföljer</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td43"><P class="p3 ft4">ansökan.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td10"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td84"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td192"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD colspan=4 class="tr41 td58"><P class="p3 ft4">ix)”innehavare”: den person som i</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr41 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD colspan=4 class="tr4 td58"><P class="p3 ft8">patentmyndighetens register anges</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD colspan=3 class="tr4 td116"><P class="p3 ft8">som innehavaren av patentet.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td192"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD colspan=4 class="tr11 td58"><P class="p3 ft4">x)”ombud”: ett ombud i enlighet</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr11 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr6 td142"><P class="p3 ft4">med nationell lag.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td84"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td192"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr11 td43"><P class="p3 ft4">xi)”signatur”:</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr11 td10"><P class="p126 ft4">varje</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr11 td84"><P class="p1190 ft4">form</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr11 td192"><P class="p291 ft4">för</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr11 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr4 td142"><P class="p3 ft4">självidentifikation.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td84"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td192"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD colspan=4 class="tr11 td58"><P class="p3 ft4">xii)”ett språk som godtas av</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr11 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr6 td142"><P class="p3 ft4">patentmyndigheten”:</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td84"><P class="p120 ft4">vilket</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td192"><P class="p291 ft40">som</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD colspan=4 class="tr4 td58"><P class="p3 ft4">helst av de språk som patent-</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td43"><P class="p3 ft4">myndigheten</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td10"><P class="p3 ft4">godtar</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td84"><P class="p120 ft4">för</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td192"><P class="p291 ft4">det</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td43"><P class="p3 ft4">ifrågavarande</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr4 td60"><P class="p1191 ft4">förfarandet</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td192"><P class="p291 ft4">hos</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p603 ft4">patentmyndigheten.</P>
<P class="p1192 ft4">xiii)”översättning”: en översätt- ning till det språk som godtas av patentmyndigheten eller, i före- kommande fall, en transkribering till det alfabet eller den teckenuppsättning som godtas av patentmyndigheten.</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<DIV id="id_2_1">
<P class="p81 ft32">(xiv)“procedure before the Office” means any procedure in proceedings before the Office with respect to an application or patent;</P>
<P class="p1184 ft32">(xv)except where the context indicates otherwise, words in the singular include the plural, and vice versa, and masculine personal pronouns include the feminine;</P>
<P class="p1189 ft6">(xvi)“Paris Convention” means the Paris Convention for the Protection of Industrial Property, signed on March 20, 1883, as</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2_2">
<P class="p1193 ft32">xiv)”förfarande hos patent- myndigheten”: varje förfarande i ärende hos patentmyndigheten som rör en ansökan eller ett patent.</P>
<P class="p1194 ft4">xv)där annat ej följer av samman- hanget skall ord i singularform omfatta pluralform och omvänt, samt maskulinpronomina omfatta femininumpronomina.</P>
<P class="p1195 ft4">xvi)”Pariskonventionen”: Paris- konventionen för skydd av industriell äganderätt, under-</P>
<P class="p1196 ft135">tecknad den 20 mars 1883, i</P>
<P class="p390 ft4">378</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_379">


<DIV>
<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p71 ft4">revised and amended;</P>
<P class="p1197 ft6">(xvii)“Patent Cooperation Treaty” means the Patent Cooperation Treaty, signed on June 19, 1970, together with the Regulations and the Administrative Instructions under that Treaty, as revised, amended and modified;</P>
<P class="p1198 ft4">(xviii)“Contracting Party” means any State or <NOBR>inter-governmental</NOBR> organization that is party to this Treaty;</P>
<P class="p1199 ft6">(xix)“applicable law” means, where the Contracting Party is a State, the law of that State and, where the Contracting Party is an intergovernmental organization, the legal enactments under which</P>
<P class="p544 ft4">that<SPAN style="padding-left:87px;">intergovernmental organization operates;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1198 ft4">(xx)“instrument of ratification” shall be construed as including in- struments of acceptance or approval;</P>
<P class="p1200 ft4">(xxi)“Organization” means the World Intellectual Property Organization;</P>
<P class="p1198 ft4">(xxii)“International Bureau” means the International Bureau of the Organization;</P>
<P class="p1198 ft4">(xxiii)“Director General” means the Director General of the Organization.</P>
<P class="p1057 ft4">Article 2</P>
<P class="p1201 ft5">General Principles</P>
<P class="p1202 ft6">(1)<SPAN class="ft33">[More Favourable Require- ments] </SPAN>A Contracting Party shall be free to provide for requirements which, from the viewpoint of applicants and owners, are more favourable than the requirements referred to in this Treaty and the</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p71 ft4">lydelse med beslutade ändringar.</P>
<P class="p483 ft32">xvii)”konventionen om patentsamarbete”: Konventionen om patentsamarbete, undertecknad den 19 juni 1970, jämte tillhörande</P>
<P class="p105 ft4">tillämpningsföreskrifter och förvaltningsdirektiv, i lydelse med beslutade ändringar.</P>
<P class="p483 ft32">xviii)”fördragsslutande part”: en stat eller mellanstatlig organisation som är part till detta fördrag.</P>
<P class="p1203 ft6">xix)”tillämplig lag”: i fråga om fördragsslutande part som är en stat, den statens lag, och i fråga om en fördragsslutande part som är en mellanstatlig organisation, den rättsordning enligt vilken den</P>
<P class="p105 ft4">mellanstatliga organisationen verkar.</P>
<P class="p1093 ft4">xx)”ratifikationsinstrument” om- fattar bl.a. instrument för god- tagande eller godkännande.</P>
<P class="p1204 ft4">xxi)”organisationen”: Världs- organisationen för den intellekt- uella äganderätten.</P>
<P class="p506 ft8">xxii)”Internationella byrån”: orga- nisationens internationella byrå.</P>
<P class="p1205 ft8">xxiii)”generaldirektören”: Organi- sationens generaldirektör.</P>
<P class="p1206 ft4">Artikel 2</P>
<P class="p1207 ft5">Allmänna principer</P>
<P class="p483 ft31"><SPAN class="ft32">1.[</SPAN>Mer gynnsamma krav<SPAN class="ft32">] En för- dragsslutande part har rätt att tillämpa krav vilka, från sökandes och innehavares utgångspunkt, är mer gynnsamma än vad som följer av detta fördrag och dess tillämp- ningsföreskrifter, utom såvitt avser</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_3">
<P class="p515 ft17">Prop. 2006/07:56 Bilaga 8</P>
<P class="p516 ft4">379</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_380">


<DIV id="id_1">
<DIV id="id_1_1">
<P class="p71 ft4">Regulations, other than Article 5.</P>
<P class="p1202 ft6">(2)[<SPAN class="ft33">No Regulation of Substantive Patent Law</SPAN>] Nothing in this Treaty or the Regulations is intended to be construed as prescribing anything that would limit the freedom of a Contracting Party to prescribe such requirements of the applicable substantive law relating to patents as it desires.</P>
<P class="p1208 ft4">Article 3</P>
<P class="p1209 ft5">Applications and Patents to Which</P>
<P class="p1210 ft5">the Treaty Applies</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_1_2">
<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t100">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td58"><P class="p3 ft4">artikel 5.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td58"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft4">Bilaga 8</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p1211 ft8">2.[<SPAN class="ft26">Ingen reglering av materiell patenträtt</SPAN>] Ingenting i detta fördrag eller dess tillämpnings- föreskrifter är avsett att tolkas som</P>
<P class="p1212 ft4">någon inskränkning i fördragsslutande parters rätt att, med avseende på tillämplig materiell patenträtt, föreskriva de krav de finner för gott.</P>
<P class="p1213 ft4">Artikel 3</P>
<P class="p1214 ft5">Ansökningar och patent på vilka</P>
<P class="p1215 ft5">fördraget är tillämpligt</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<DIV id="id_2_1">
<P class="p196 ft4">(1)[<SPAN class="ft5">Applications</SPAN>](a) The provis- ions of this Treaty and the Re- gulations shall apply to national and regional applications for patents for invention and for invention and for patents of addition, which are filed with or for the Office of a Contracting Party, and which are:</P>
<P class="p1180 ft4">(i)types of applications permitted to be filed as international applications under the Patent Cooperation Treaty;</P>
<P class="p1189 ft6">(ii)divisional applications of the types of applications referred to in item (i), for patents for invention or for patents of addition, as referred to in Article 4G(1) or (2) of the Paris Convention.</P>
<P class="p1182 ft4">(b)Subject to the provisions of the Patent Cooperation Treaty, the provisions of this Treaty and the Regulations shall apply to international applications, for patents for invention and for patents of addition, under the Patent Cooperation Treaty:</P>
<P class="p1180 ft4">(i)in respect of the time limits applicable under Articles 22 and</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2_2">
<P class="p1193 ft6">1.[<SPAN class="ft33">Ansökningar</SPAN>] a) Bestämmel- serna i detta fördrag och dess tillämpningsföreskrifter tillämpas på nationella och regionala ansök- ningar om patent på uppfinningar och om tilläggspatent, vilka ges in till en fördragsslutande parts patentmyndighet eller för dess räkning och vilka är:</P>
<P class="p1216 ft4">i<SPAN class="ft5">)</SPAN>ansökningar av sådant slag som får ges in som internationella ansökningar enligt patentsam- arbetskonventionen.</P>
<P class="p1217 ft6">ii)avdelade ansökningar av sådant slag som avses i punkt i) ovan för patent på uppfinningar eller tilläggspatent som avses i artikel 4G.1 eller 2 i Pariskonventionen.</P>
<P class="p1218 ft32">b)Om inte annat följer av konventionen om patentsamarbete tillämpas bestämmelserna i detta fördrag och dess tillämpnings- föreskrifter på sådana interna- tionella ansökningar för patent på uppfinningar och för tilläggs- patent, som avses i konventionen om patentsamarbete, med avseende på</P>
<P class="p1219 ft4">i)tidsfrister hos en fördrags-</P>
<P class="p1196 ft76">slutande parts patentmyndighet</P>
<P class="p390 ft4">380</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_381">


<DIV id="id_1">
<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t1">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td283"><P class="p3 ft4">39 (1) of the Patent Cooperation</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=3 class="tr9 td133"><P class="p101 ft4">som gäller enligt artikel 22</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td40"><P class="p291 ft7">och</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td283"><P class="p3 ft13">Treaty in the Office of a</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td129"><P class="p101 ft13">39.1</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td108"><P class="p127 ft13">i</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td106"><P class="p3 ft13">konventionen</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td40"><P class="p291 ft13">om</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 8</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td283"><P class="p3 ft4">Contracting Party;</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=3 class="tr4 td133"><P class="p101 ft4">patentsamarbete,</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td40"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<DIV id="id_2_1">
<P class="p543 ft4">(ii)in respect of any procedure commenced on or after the date on which processing or examination of the international application may start under Article 23 or 40 of that Treaty.</P>
<P class="p1199 ft6">(2)[<SPAN class="ft33">Patents</SPAN>] The provisions of this Treaty and the Regulations shall apply to national and regional patents for invention, and to national and regional patents of addition, which have been granted with effect for a Contracting Party.</P>
<P class="p1220 ft4">Article 4</P>
<P class="p1221 ft5">Security Exception</P>
<P class="p1200 ft4">Nothing in this Treaty and the Regulations shall limit the freedom of a Contracting Party to take any action it deems necessary for the preservation of essential security interests.</P>
<P class="p1222 ft4">Article 5</P>
<P class="p1162 ft5">Filing Date</P>
<P class="p139 ft5"><SPAN class="ft4">(1)[</SPAN>Elements of Application<SPAN class="ft4">]</SPAN></P>
<P class="p543 ft4"><SPAN class="ft7">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">Except as otherwise prescribed in the Regulations, and subject to paragraphs (2) to (8), a Contracting Party shall provide that the filing date of an application shall be the date on which its Office has received all of the following elements, filed, at the option of the applicant, on paper or as otherwise permitted by the Office for the purposes of the filing date:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1223 ft8">(i)an express or implicit indication to the effect that the elements are</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2_2">
<P class="p859 ft4">ii)förfarande som inletts på eller efter den dag då handläggning</P>
<P class="p1211 ft32">eller prövning av den internationella ansökningen får påbörjas enligt artikel 23 eller 40 i konventionen om patentsamarbete.</P>
<P class="p861 ft6">2.[<SPAN class="ft33">Patent</SPAN>] Bestämmelserna i detta fördrag och dess tillämpningsföre- skrifter tillämpas på nationella och regionala patent på uppfinningar, och på nationella och regionala tillläggspatent, vilka har meddelats</P>
<P class="p859 ft4">med verkan för en fördragsslutande part.</P>
<P class="p1224 ft4">Artikel 4</P>
<P class="p1225 ft5">Undantag för säkerhetsintressen</P>
<P class="p861 ft6">Ingenting i detta fördrag och dess tillämpningsföreskrifter begränsar rätten för en fördragsslutande part att vidta de åtgärder som den</P>
<P class="p853 ft4">finner nödvändiga för tillvaratagande av väsentliga säkerhetsintressen.</P>
<P class="p1213 ft4">Artikel 5</P>
<P class="p1226 ft5">Ingivningsdag</P>
<P class="p139 ft5"><SPAN class="ft4">1.[</SPAN>Vad en ansökan skall innehålla<SPAN class="ft4">]</SPAN></P>
<P class="p857 ft8"><SPAN class="ft7">a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft67">En fördragsslutande part skall, om annat inte följer av punkterna</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1227 ft6"><NOBR>2-8</NOBR> nedan eller av tillämpningsföreskrifterna, före- skriva att ingivningsdagen för en ansökan skall vara den dag, då dess patentmyndighet erhållit samtliga följande uppgifter, in- givna, med valfrihet för sökanden, på papper eller i den form som i övrigt medges av patentmyndig- heten för ändamålet att fastställa ingivningsdag:</P>
<P class="p635 ft4">i)En uttrycklig eller underförstådd</P>
<P class="p71 ft76">upplysning om att uppgifterna är</P>
<P class="p390 ft4">381</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_382">


<DIV>
<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p71 ft4">intended to be an application;</P>
<P class="p1200 ft4">(ii)indications allowing the identity of the applicant to be established or allowing the applicant to be contacted by the Office;</P>
<P class="p1198 ft4">(iii)a part which on the face of it appears to be a description.</P>
<P class="p1228 ft32">(b)A Contracting Party may, for the purposes of the filing date, accept a drawing as the element referred to in subparagraph (a)(iii).</P>
<P class="p1202 ft4">(c)For the purposes of the filing date, a Contracting Party may require both information allowing the identity of the applicant to be established and information allowing the applicant to be contacted by the Office, or it may accept evidence allowing the identity of the applicant to be established or allowing the applicant to be contacted by the Office, as the element referred to in subparagraph(a)(ii).</P>
<P class="p1229 ft8">(2)[<SPAN class="ft26">Language</SPAN>](a) A Contracting Party may require that the indications referred to in para- graph(1)(a)(i) and(ii) be in a language accepted by the Office.</P>
<P class="p1230 ft4">(b)The part referred to in paragraph(1)(a)(iii) may, for the purposes of the filing date, be filed in any language.</P>
<P class="p1199 ft4">(3)[<SPAN class="ft5">Notification</SPAN>] Where the application does not comply with one or more of the requirements applied by the Contracting Party under paragraphs(1) and(2), the Office shall, as soon as practicable, notify the applicant, giving the opportunity to comply</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t101">
<TR>
	<TD colspan=3 class="tr9 td284"><P class="p3 ft7">avsedda att utgöra en ansökan.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td225"><P class="p1231 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td220"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td192"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td109"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td225"><P class="p1231 ft13">Bilaga 8</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td220"><P class="p3 ft4">ii)Upplysningar</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td192"><P class="p3 ft4">som</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr4 td285"><P class="p19 ft4">möjliggör</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td220"><P class="p3 ft4">identifikation av</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr4 td72"><P class="p54 ft4">sökanden</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td225"><P class="p19 ft4">eller</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD colspan=4 class="tr6 td85"><P class="p3 ft4">som gör det möjligt för patent-</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td220"><P class="p3 ft4">myndigheten</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td192"><P class="p3 ft4">att</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr4 td285"><P class="p19 ft4">kontakta</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td220"><P class="p3 ft4">sökanden.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td192"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td109"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td225"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p1232 ft4">iii)En del som vid ytligt betraktande framstår som en beskrivning.</P>
<P class="p864 ft8">b)En fördragsslutande part får för ändamålet att fastställa ingivnings- dag godta en ritning såsom den del vilken avses i a) iii) ovan.</P>
<P class="p1233 ft6">c)För ändamålet att fastställa in- givningsdag får en fördrags- slutande part kräva både uppgifter som möjliggör identifikation av sökanden och upplysningar som</P>
<P class="p1211 ft6">gör det möjligt för patentmyndigheten att kontakta sökanden, eller får patent- myndigheten såsom upplysningar enligt a) ii) ovan godta bevisning som möjliggör identifikation av sökanden eller som gör det möjligt för patentmyndigheten att kontakta sökanden.</P>
<P class="p1232 ft4">2.[<SPAN class="ft5">Språk</SPAN>] a) En fördragsslutande part får kräva att upplysningar som avses i punkt 1.a) i) och ii) är på ett språk som godtas av patent- myndigheten.</P>
<P class="p67 ft4">b)Den del som avses i punkt 1.a)</P>
<P class="p859 ft4"><SPAN class="ft4">iii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft21">får, för ändamålet att fastställa ingivningsdag, ges in på vilket språk som helst.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p864 ft32">3.[<SPAN class="ft31">Underrättelse</SPAN>] Om ansökan inte uppfyller ett eller flera av de krav som den fördragsslutande parten ställt upp i enlighet med punkterna 1 och 2, skall patentmyndigheten så snart det låter sig göra underrätta sökanden och ge denne</P>
<P class="p71 ft135">möjlighet att uppfylla kraven och</P>
<P class="p390 ft4">382</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_383">


<DIV>
<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p81 ft17">with any such requirement, and to make observations, within the time</P>
<P class="p1234 ft4">limit prescribed in the Regulations.</P>
<P class="p1184 ft6">(4)[<SPAN class="ft33">Subsequent Compliance with Requirements</SPAN>](a) Where one or more of the requirements applied by the Contracting Party under paragraphs (1) and (2) are not complied with in the application as initially filed, the filing date shall, subject to subparagraph (b) and paragraph (6), be the date on which all of the requirements applied by the Contracting Party under paragraphs (1) and (2) are subsequently complied with.</P>
<P class="p1189 ft6">(b)A Contracting Party may pro- vide that, where one or more of the requirements referred to in subparagraph (a) are not complied with within the time limit prescribed in the Regulations, the application shall be deemed not to have been filed. Where the application is deemed not to have been filed, the Office shall notify</P>
<P class="p190 ft4">the applicant accordingly, indicating the reasons therefore.</P>
<P class="p1181 ft6">(5)[<SPAN class="ft33">Notification Concerning Missing Part of Description or Drawing</SPAN>] Where, in establishing the filing date, the Office finds that a part of the description appears to be missing from the application, or that the application refers to a drawing which appears to be missing from the application, the Office shall promptly notify the applicant accordingly.</P>
<P class="p1184 ft8">(6)[<SPAN class="ft26">Filing Date Where Missing Part of Description or Drawing Is Filed</SPAN>] (a) Where a missing part of the description or a missing drawing is filed with the Office within the time limit prescribed in</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p163 ft4">att yttra sig inom den tidsfrist som föreskrivs i tillämpningsföre- skrifterna.</P>
<P class="p1235 ft6">4.[<SPAN class="ft33">Senare kravuppfyllelse</SPAN>] a) Om ett eller flera av de krav, som den fördragsslutande parten ställt upp i enlighet med punkterna 1 och 2, inte har uppfyllts genom ansökan, såsom ursprungligen ingiven, skall, om annat inte följer av b) nedan och av punkt 6, vara den senare dag, då alla de krav, som den fördragsslutande parten tillämpar i enlighet med punkterna 1 och 2, har uppfyllts.</P>
<P class="p1236 ft4">b)En fördragsslutande part får föreskriva att en ansökan skall anses som ej ingiven, då ett eller flera av de krav som avses i a) ovan inte har uppfyllts inom den tidsfrist som föreskrivs i tillämpningsföreskrifterna. När ansökan har ansetts ej ingiven, skall patentmyndigheten under- rätta sökanden om detta och ange skälen för det.</P>
<P class="p1237 ft6">5.[<SPAN class="ft33">Underrättelse om saknade delar av beskrivning eller ritning</SPAN>] Om patentmyndigheten vid prövning av frågan om ingivningsdag finner att en del av beskrivningen förefaller saknas i ansökan, eller att det hänvisas till en ritning vilken förefaller saknas i ansökan, skall patentmyndigheten snarast underrätta sökanden om detta.</P>
<P class="p1238 ft5"><SPAN class="ft4">6.[</SPAN>Ingivningsdag då saknade delar av beskrivning eller ritning ges in<SPAN class="ft4">]</SPAN></P>
<P class="p81 ft6"><SPAN class="ft7">a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft189">Om en saknad del av beskriv- ningen eller en saknad ritning ges in till patentmyndigheten inom den tidsfrist som föreskrivs i tillämp-</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_3">
<P class="p599 ft17">Prop. 2006/07:56 Bilaga 8</P>
<P class="p516 ft4">383</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_384">


<DIV id="id_1">
<DIV id="id_1_1">
<P class="p1187 ft6">the Regulations, that part of the description or drawing shall be included in the application, and, subject to subparagraphs(b) and(c), the filing date shall be the date on which the Office has received that part of the descrip- tion or that drawing, or the date on which all of the requirements applied by the Contracting Party under paragraphs (1) and (2) are complied with, whichever is later.</P>
<P class="p1188 ft32">(b)Where the missing part of the description or the missing drawing is filed under subparagraph (a) to rectify its omission from an application which, at the date on which one or more elements referred to in paragraph (1)(a) were first received by the Office, claims the priority of an earlier application, the filing date shall, upon the request of the applicant filed within a time limit prescribed in the Regulations, and subject to the requirements prescribed in the Regulations, be the date on which all the requirements applied by the Contracting Party under paragraphs</P>
<P class="p343 ft4">(1) and (2) are complied with.</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_1_2">
<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t100">
<TR>
	<TD colspan=3 class="tr9 td117"><P class="p3 ft8">ningsföreskrifterna,</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td128"><P class="p29 ft4">skall</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td46"><P class="p291 ft4">den</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td13"><P class="p3 ft7">Prop. 2006/07:56</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td19"><P class="p3 ft13">delen</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td131"><P class="p3 ft13">av</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr5 td81"><P class="p3 ft13">beskrivningen</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td46"><P class="p291 ft13">eller</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td13"><P class="p3 ft13">Bilaga 8</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD colspan=5 class="tr4 td58"><P class="p3 ft4">ritningen fogas till ansökan och,</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD colspan=5 class="tr4 td58"><P class="p3 ft4">om annat inte följer av b) och c)</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD colspan=4 class="tr6 td284"><P class="p3 ft8">nedan, ingivningsdagen vara</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td46"><P class="p291 ft4">den</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td19"><P class="p3 ft8">senaste</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td131"><P class="p28 ft4">av</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td168"><P class="p1239 ft4">de</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td128"><P class="p223 ft4">dagar</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td46"><P class="p291 ft4">då</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td13"><P class="p3 ft9">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
